<s> Last week Frank Minyard the Orleans Parish coroner concluded that he could not determine what caused the death of Jannie Burgess a <math> year-old patient who perished at Memorial Medical Center in New Orleans after a doctor is orders led her to be given multiple doses of morphine in a short period <s> The hospital was cut off for several days by the floodwaters of Hurricane Katrina and a number of patients were found dead with elevated levels of morphine and other drugs 'We cannot tell what she died of except that she was extremely ill 'Minyard said in a phone interview several hours before a scheduled press conference on Thursday 'She had a lot of physiologic reasons to die 'Minyard said his official finding was that the cause of Burgess ' death was 'unclassified 'His ruling makes it highly unlikely that any charges will be brought in the case The details of Burgess ' death were first disclosed in a report published by <weirdcaps> and The New York Times Magazine last August <s> Her medical records showed that she was repeatedly dosed with morphine after the hospital had lost power temperatures soared and rescue helicopters failed to arrive in sufficient numbers The physician who ordered the medication Dr <s> Ewing Cook said that he intentionally 'hastened her demise 'because Burgess who had advanced metastatic uterine cancer was close to death was being cared for by nurses whose help was needed elsewhere and would have suffered greatly if her pain medication wore off during any attempt to evacuate her 'Dr <s> Cook thinks that he knocked her off 'Minyard sai 'dbut we can 't prove that <s> He might have he might not have <s> Because it is not <date> percent proved we have to call it unclassified 'He said some of the experts he consulted pointed to the fact that Burgess ' death was recorded as having occurred more than three hours after the last of the morphine injections Cook is attorney Ralph Capitelli called Minyard is decision 'the correct decision 'Minyard said that he had not spoken with Cook <s> He said that during his investigation he consulted with four pathologists who work in his office three local experts and Dr <s> Michael Baden a renowned forensic pathologist from New York Baden has said he has a different view of the case <s> In an interview several months ago after he reviewed Burgess ' records Baden said that Burgess ' death was 'no question a homicide 'Homicide is defined by coroners as a death caused by the action of another person <s> Such findings do not a 'ress the issue of intent which is critical to deciding whether a crime has been committed Burgess ' daughter Linette Burgess Guidi said she had not seen the experts ' determinations <s> She said she hoped that some sort of review board could review Cook is actions 'I understand he was under a lot of pressure ishe said 'I am not out for vengeance <s> I just want to know the truth I want to know what happened 'She a 'e ' <weirdcaps> is too many questions 'The district attorney in Orleans Parish Leon Cannizzaro released a statement after Minyard is announcement 'Since it is the Coroner is opinion that this victim did not die as a result of being administered a lethal dose of narcotics I cannot pursue a homicide charge at this time 'Minyard conducted his assessment of the Burgess case at Cannizzaro is request <s> In September <date> shortly after the <weirdcaps> and New York Times Magazine report Cannizzaro said he asked Minyard 'to classify the deaths reported in 'the article In <date> authorities arrested Dr <s> Anna Pou and nurses Lori Budo and Cheri Landry for alleged mercy killings at the same hospital after Katrina <s> A local grand jury heard evidence in the case and declined to bring charges <s> The nurses and Dr <s> Pou emphatically denied that they had murdered patients and the case prompted outrage in New Orleans where medical professionals who worked in horrific conditions after the storm were widely viewed as heroes and victims <s> Some close to Minyard speculated that the coroner who recently won re-election to his 10th term decided to postpone his determination in the case until after the election -- something Minyard denies Minyard 80 said the reason he had not completed his investigation of Burgess ' death before now was because his office has a great deal of work on other cases and is understaffed 'I 've just got too much going 'he said when contacted last December 'I just want to make sure when I do it that I have it right 
<s> Venezuela already under watch from the likes of Reporters Sans Frontieres for jeopardizing press freedom appears to be edging closer towards the type of restrictive governmental Internet interference as seen in Cuba China and Iran Hugo Chavez the Venezuelan president has called for greater regulation of the Internet this weekend with the following statement as reported by Reuters 'The Internet cannot be something open where anything is said and done <s> Every country has to apply its own rules and norms ' Chavez is said to have singled out one website as an example where such an 'open ' policy has troubled him <s> Noticierodigital had a post up for two days suggesting that Diosdado Cabello a senior minister and close aide of Chavez had been assassinated 'We have to act <s> We are going to ask the attorney general for help because this is a crime <s> I have information that this page periodically publishes stories calling for a coup <smiley> 'etat <s> That cannot be permitte 'd Chavez said Twitter Twitter and Facebook Facebook are also said to have come under criticism from Chavez with the president reported to have complained 'that people use such sites to spread unfounded rumors ' Recently he called Twitter messages a 'tool of terror ' Chavez has already moved to control <smiley> and radio networks in the country in August last year 34 broadcasters were closed down on 'administrative grounds ' while Chavez is own lengthy presidential broadcasts are now aired compulsorily across both terrestrial and cable <smiley> stations Chavez expressing such negative interest in the online world will no doubt be met with great concern by those who oppose him as well as in the wider world Chavez is comments serves to remind all of us regardless of nationality about the importance of a free and open Internet <s> When it ceases to be such it is no longer the world wide web but a poor imitation propagated by repressive regimes

nice outside <s> You proceed to walk expecting any moment to see the steeple <s> You climb up a hill <s> Then you walk down another artfully dodging okadas and wayward cars <s> Can 't these people see <s> Your friend has sent a text telling you he got tired of waiting outside so you should meet at the restaurant down the street <s> WHY ME you cry in your heart as you wearily trudge to the spot planning how you 'll chop off his head if he even suggests that you just walk home Step 3 <repeatedchars> your friend is AC works <s> You sit back in the car and just enjoy the coolness of it while you reminisce about those bottles of real cold water you just downed <s> Then you feel a rumble <s> You look around in shock thinking o Lord are there earthquakes now in Nigeria Then you realize its coming from your tummy <s> Your mind flashes back to the orgasmic moi-moi and ogi you had for breakfast <s> Your stomach rumbles again and you wonder why your friend is su 'enly driving so slowly <s> <s> For some sales is arguably the hardest job in the world <s> For others however the adrenalin of the roller coaster ride that is the sales process keeps most on the edge of their seat for their entire careers The real question are however do businesses truly recognize and properly rate the critical importance of their sales people and do businesses ensure that their sales people are skilled and motivated enough to sell in a more than ordinary fashion It is hard to find any businesses in the world who don 't have something to sell and don 't want to make money and succeed <s> It doesn 't matter whether the company is selling services or products if they don 't have sales people who 'feed 'the business the business won 't exist <s> So as most can imagine motivating training and energizing the salesforce should be as critical to a business as advertising and promotion <s> Without a strong sales force them businesses can 't close a sale and book revenue With that said here are some tips to help motivate and empower a collective salesforce Give your team the power of positive feedback Executives are fooling themselves if they think a sales force will work forever on financial motivation alone but that is simply not true <s> Most sales people are a personality type that requires feedback <s> They emotionally connect with their customers peers and networks constantly seeking approval satisfaction and achievement The business owner or manager is role is to support and reinforce the efforts of a motivated sales person <s> Without realizing it a manager can drain the motivation right out of a team <s> A manager can strip away motivation them by creating a stressful negative work environment Guide and support them in building their own approach Many people 'fall 'into sales as a career finding themselves to be good at it early on <s> As they improve their techniques and confidence they gradually work their way higher and higher up the food chain of a business until they reach the ceiling and seek entrepreneurial opportunity

the not so good side I have been finding myself struggling more lately <s> I have reached the point in my course where I am kept very busy and there is a lot riding on these last few months essays <s> I am also struggling more with my health <s> I had a good clinic visit at the end of January but for months now I have been getting more breathless exhausted with trivial things <s> Last month I had my oxygen levels checked to see if I required more oxygen to make my life easier <s> Everything is coming back as stable my lung function is stable oxygen is ok blood tests showed my infection markers are fine all definate positives but I still feel awful on a day to day basis <s> It sounds awful but I almost feel as though I am hovering in an area in between 'ill enough to do something and ok enough that theres nothing that will make a difference ' and to be honest I 'd rather be one or the other <s> Its been over 2 and a half years since I went on the list and while I expect things to have declined it is very very hard to feel you need help and support but not to recieve it <s> Over the last few weeks I have become very wheezy and my chest often feels very uncomfortable <s> My treatment regieme barely leaves me any time to study and I feel like what I want to do has to take a back seat <s> Its like the CF is getting bigger and I am getting smaller <s> I am determined to finish my course and to do it to the very best of my ability but when I am constantly doing meds or feeling ill it is becoming almost impossible see here <s> Things like my blog keeping in touch with friends etc are falling down my list and I am struggling to keep my head above water at the moment <s> That said I will keep going until things get easier <s> I will do as much as i can even in the small snatches of time that I get away from treatments <s> I will keep on because of how lucky I am to still be here and because I will not let CF take away something else I hold so dear to me <s> I want this transplant so badly now this life at the moment is making me appreciate how good things are going to become one day <s> There are so many things right now that I have to push to the back of my mind because I can 't do them and to think about them physically hurts me <s> I miss so many aspects of the life I haven 't even been able to begin yet <s> If I am not around much lately you will now know why I am still here even if a little worse for wear and I am keeping on the only way I know how

<s> Many people I meet as a marketer ask me how quickly their marketing will lead to sales and ultimately revenue <s> I reply by asking them what their time to sale is and what their level of awareness is within their target markets I also like to understand how many happy customers or clients they have created over time <s> Occasionally I get some puzzled looks <s> Whenever I do I offer this simple Marketing lesson Have you ever heard of the principle that one satisfied customer can bring you up to 10 more customers in a shorter amount of time than you can build them all by yourself Well let me show you why There is five stages to building a customer from no-awareness to full blown evangelist <s> Get it right and you 'll only have to go through the initial campaigns once or twice to build the initial base of satisfied customers extolling your virtues This is the foundation I build many marketing campaigns on ensuring I have strategies to take a potential customer on the journey through each stage Awareness You must make a customer aware of your product or service category your business and its capability <s> At this point of the process lets face it many potential targets are largely disinterested or indifferent as they can 't see a need for your product or service in their life much of the time <s> This step is a hard often cold part of the sales process full of apathy and rejection Interest Something happens in a potential target is life or business for them to move from basic awareness phase and raise their interest in your offering <s> A target cannot get to interest if you haven 't raised awareness of your brand and offering or capability with them except through step five satisfaction <s> This is the point of a process where we would qualify a target as a warm lead and nurture them carefully to build their interest into hungry desire

<s> Clifford is own connection to soup is profound <s> As a ten-year old vacationing in Spain he is taken for his first meal in a fine dining restaurant A bowl of soup can be a powerful dish <s> It recalls memories warm the heart and soul and can use up plenty of leftovers in our cupboards and refrigerators <s> Clifford Wright is The Best Soups in the World Wiley <date> appeals to all these aspects of soup <s> His book delivers recipes from around the world with intelligent commentary <s> Even as the weather warms up this Spring get out the soup pot and make some soup <s> It starts as almost all soup books do with basic broths <smiley> 9 followed by clear soups <smiley> <math> <s> The real action is in the next chapter on chunky meat soups <smiley> <math> The first recipe isn 't for a standard beefy mushroom soup but for Blackfoot Bison and Blackberry Soup <smiley> <math> for which you need buffalo bones suet and meet and spicebush berries all of which might be hard to find <s> Clifford calls the recipe a 'curiosity ' but he expects the reader to make the soup even with the substitute ingredients of beef bones suet and meat and juniper berries <s> What is really interesting is that in the recipe notes he writes about who the Blackfoot Nation are three different tribes and a bit of their culinary culture He follows with a recipe for Shchi <smiley> <math> the Russian beef and sauerkraut or fresh cabbage soup that has a thousand variations and Borshch <smiley> <math> along with an essay on 'Everything You Want to Know About Borshch ' that covers the history of borshch and the boscht belt <s> From there Clifford roams the world from Greece with Avgolemono Meatball Soup <smiley> <math> to Polish Zurek <smiley> <math> to Turkmen Boiled Soup <smiley> <math> <s> There are side essays that fill you in about soup practices in Africa or specific kinds of obscure soups <s> Although there is a wealth of information the recipes dominate this is a book to cook with and enjoy

Centre for Photography for inviting me to Australia and Foto Freo <s> There is an interesting article in Seed Magazine that sums up recent research around the growing debate of whether animals are people <s> It would appear that many of the traits we have long considered uniquely human are not so unique after all <s> The debate feels less like a struggle for scientific clarity and more like a brainy ape is desperate attempt to hold on to his fragile sense of supremacy Instead of 'what makes us human 'being a question where we are able to constantly adjust the answer maybe we should make it a statement and choose a definition that commits us to a more humane standard of dominion <s> A year ago I met Stacy Mehrfar for a drink at the Half King in Chelsea <s> We 'd known each other since her new adopted country she mentioned a strange phrase Tall Poppy Syndrome <s> Tall Poppy Syndrome is an Australian societal phenomenon where people who are seen to be successful are resented by their fellow citizens <s> Having been raised in a country that preaches the religion of individual success USA USA USA this concept was foreign to me <s> As we discussed it further we decided it would be a great structure for a photo series about Australia

<s> I can 't get the stories of Haiti out of my mind A patient showed up at the Port au Prince hospital ward with a massive left sided paralysis an obvious stroke <s> This 48 year old woman had collapsed the day before and was now accompanied by her three grown daughters who were most attentive and worried <s> I examined her in the bed with other patients and families gathered around There is no sense of privacy and even an exam seems to be everyone is business in Haiti <s> One daughter spoke broken English but I had a good translator that helped me get the information I needed It was a sad story <s> They had been on the 5th floor when the Earthquake hit <s> They fell straight down and dad was killed <s> One of the children had a crush injury to his leg and the entire remaining family was now 'on the street ' <s> Just surviving must have been such a strain <s> Then mom has a massive stroke As I was examining the patient further one daughter handed me a quickly scrawled note <s> It read 'I have a problem She have a AIDS 'In this private way the daughter wanted me to know her mom had AIDS In a country with such poverty lack of health care and lack of education it is not a surprise that HIV and AIDS remains a significant problem and Haiti is the Caribbean island most affected by AIDS <s> There also remains a stigma and HIV infection is a big secret <s> Once I asked my Haitian interpreter to ask an emaciated patient if he was HIV positive and the interpreter couldn 't even ask the question <s> It is just not done <s> It was a real act of bravery for that daughter to pass me the secret note

<s> On Wednesday night I was honored to be a guest on CUNY <smiley> is Brian Lehrer Live a weekly current events show filmed here in New York <s> I was there along with Marisa Meltzer the author of Girl Power the Nineties Revolution in Music and Rob Walker who writes the NYT is 'Consumed 'column and is also the author of Buying In What We Buy and Who We Are <s> I was there to talk about the <weirdcaps> phenomenon that is the haul video <s> If you 've never seen a haul video it is basically a person doing on camera what you usually do when you come back from a shopping trip excitedly show what you 've bought to anyone who 'll listen <s> Except in a haul video you show it in front of your webcam and then post it on <weirdcaps> for an audience of thousands <s> Most haul videos are made by teenage girls and most of the items been shown off are clothing or makeup though a thorough browsing of the genre reveals that there are haul videos about a whole range of products including groceries <s> It was a really interesting discussion one that touched on issues of consumerism teenage belonging and self-identity and on the cultural emphasis placed on women is beauty and the products we 're encouraged to buy to achieve it <s> As you can imagine I 've been thinking a lot about haul videos in the last few days and I think there are a few noteworthy things going on here <s> First I think it is important to note that these videos are predominately made by teenage girls and that the vast majority of the money they 're spending is on clothes and on makeup <s> As I mentioned in the segment the average American woman will spend over 20 <date> on cosmetic products alone between the ages of 13 and 29 <s> And that doesn 't include manicures pedicures haircuts or colorings - that is just for makeup products Once you a ' in those services and include other services like tanning and waxing the number goes up over 40 <date> <s> Over the course of a lifetime the average American woman will spend about <date> <date> on making herself beautiful <s> Half a million dollars <s> That is a studio apartment in New York <s> It is two full rides to medical school <s> And while a lot of women never go tanning or get a pedicure and while products and services obviously cost less depending on where you live as well as a number of other factors that is still an enormous percentage of women is collective earnings being spent on making ourselves beautiful <s> As I said on Wednesday night I am in no position to tell anyone how to spend their money but I think it is important to take a moment and imagine all the other things we could do with that money and to carefully examine the reasons why we spend it on making ourselves beautiful <s> I should clarify that I don 't think these women are buying these products because I think they 're vain or vapid

<s> Hi <s> I am Kim Moldofsky from Morton Grove Illinois <s> Agliophobia is a fear of pain iatrophobia is a fear of doctors but I have yet to find a word that defines my biggest fear a fear of pre-existing conditions <s> My fear of pre-existing conditions began years ago when I was diagnosed with Sjogren is Syndrome an auto-immune disease that causes dry eye and dry mouth <s> My illness seemed more of nuisance than a health crisis so I was shocked when after my husband is employer went bankrupt and we lost our medical coverage I was repeatedly told that I was uninsurable due to this condition <s> That was back in <date> when I was 33 years old Eventually my husband found a job with benefits <s> After a period of time my faulty immune system was covered in full which was helpful because by then I had developed rheumatoid arthritis <s> Still once it was diagnosed and I found the right combination of medicines to combat my symptoms life continued at a normal pace <s> We were happy to have medical insurance but we didn 't have a great policy <s> We had a 5 <date> deductible for our family and with two young children under foot we often met that deductible <s> At one point I realized our high cost high deductible actually penalized us for using the plan <s> For example using the mail-order pharmacy aligned with our plan it cost me over 2 <date> a year for certain medication a certain arthritis drug <s> On my doctor is recommendation I checked the prices at the local Costco <s> It turned out that the same drug cost me less than <date> without my insurance at Costco In the fall of <date> my husband lost his job and eventually his benefits <s> This time I felt fortunate to find a private insurance a private insurer saving me the expense of the state plan <s> However like many policies it does not provide coverage on the issues that matter most to my family even my 9-year-old son has a pre-existing condition that is not covered <s> And of course my arthritis well they accepted me into a plan into the plan with a special deductible for arthritis-related treatment <s> Knowing that this typically only involves a couple thousand dollars of treatment a year we felt okay with that <s> However it wasn 't until after we had signed on the dotted line the only dotted line that was available to cover my entire family that we learned this deductible which I assumed was 5 <date> or 10 <date> was actually a 65 <date> deductible a 65 <date> deductible for the most pressing medical condition in my family It is not creaking bones that keep me awake at night it is the fear of developing a condition related to my arthritis that could send us tumbling into bankruptcy <s> Although I have some coverage I have a fear of unexpected news o ' test results a new diagnosis <s> I have a fear of a new pre-existing condition a phobia without a name <s> Although we pay several hundred dollars a month for access to quality care I am afraid to use it <s> I often ignore minor aches and pains <s> I have held off on some scheduled blood tests and exam and I worry that my attempt to save a few dollars now could cost me dearly in the future if minor problems spiral into larger ones but ironically as long as people with pre-existing conditions can be denied coverage spending money on doctor visits and tests to solve problems early on could actually cost more dearly in the future

last couple of years <s> I honestly didn 't recognize her when I was going through the thumbnails Yesterday is answer is behind the cut <s> Were you correct 
<s> It is funny but I barely remember the first time I visited New York <s> I was nine years old and went with my Dad and brother to see the World is Fair in Queens <s> I remember the It is a Small World Exhibit but mostly I remember the car ride home on the Jersey Turnpike gazing out at the brightly lit New York skyline and realizing for the first time that if it is dark outside you can actually look sideways out the window and not get car sick The next time I visited New York I was on an eight grade class trip <s> I think we went to the United Nations but I don 't recall that <s> Here are the two things I do remember - <math> singing '99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall 'while stuck in traffic coming out of the Lincoln Tunnel onto 42nd Street which in those days was lined with Peep Shows and Porn Shops and <math> being a smart-ass with my friends and leaving a one-cent tip at the restaurant in Tudor City where we were packed in and served overcooked Salisbury Steak which was basically inedible Even then I was a food critic The third time I visited New York I fell in love <s> It was a day trip I took during college with my best friends <s> I think we must have seen a play but for the life of me I don 't remember what it was <s> This time it was lunch at Mama Leone is which even I the rube from Philly recognized as cattle call for tourists - the place was loud and packed and I felt like a number And the portions HUGE <s> Like 'I think I am gonna ' be sick ' huge So we decided to walk it off with a stroll in Central Park <s> And it was there sitting under the Wisteria Arbor on the West Drive that I fell <s> Hard Maybe it was the intoxicating floral perfume <s> Combined with post-prandial carbohydrate overload and a bit of a buzz from the wine we had with lunch <s> And a warm spring day and best friends <s> And that skyline Clearly it was not the food All I knew was - I was in love <s> With a city <s> And I knew - I had to move here 
<s> Acne is the word every teen hates but faces this nightmare at one point or the other during her growing years <s> There are as many numbers of creams and lotions available as the number of teens with acne New research suggests that a diet with foods containing low glycemic loads could help people suffering from acne to get rid of their acne Scientists from th RMIT university in Melbourne studied the effect of food on about forty three patients aged between 15 and 25 years <s> They were randomly assigned a normal diet and a low glycemic load diet for 12 weeks <s> The diet consisted of 25 percent energy from protein and 45 percent from low-glycemic-index carbohydrates It was found that people whose diet consisted of low-glycemic-index carbohydrates had a significant reduction in the total acne when compared to people on a normal diet What is Glycemic index The Glycemic Index GI relates to the way your body is sugar levels respond to certain foods <s> Foods are given a rating from 0 <math> on the glycemic index with glucose in the highest position <s> High Glycemic Index foods such as simple carbohydrates will increase the body is sugar levels rapidly whereas low glycemic index foods will increase the body is sugar levels slowly according to HWF The new findings suggest that diets that contain low glycemic loads may not only improve insulin sensitivity and helps reduce weight but clears up acne as well So if you want to get rid of acne and have a blemish free skin foods that have high glycemic index like white bread sugar potatoes are a strict NO <s> However you can eat low-glycemic foods like whole grains vegetables fish and lean meat as these foods are kinder to your skin and say good bye to acne forever 
<s> Marisa Meltzer is the author of Girl Power The Nineties Revolution in Music and the co-author of How Sassy Changed My Life A Love Letter to the Greatest Teen Magazine of All Time <s> She is a contributor at Slate and the Daily Beast where she reviews books and movies and writes about gender in popular culture Girl Power which Courtney posted about a few months ago is about the evolution of the feminist message in music during the era when Meltzer was coming of age <s> In the process of writing her book Meltzer who was a fan of Kathleen Hanna and Sleater-Kinney as a teen travelled around the country attending music festivals revisited the records of her youth and even got a chance to meet and interview some of the women who made those records <s> But she also confesses that in order to write Girl Power she had to watch the Spice Girls movie <s> Meltzer seems to have pretty much the coolest job in the world - Spice Girls movie aside Feministing readers who love music movies and Sarah Haskins should check out Meltzer is archive of writing for the Daily Beast <s> Feministing readers who secretly love the Bring It On franchise should wait until no one is around to see their browser tabs and then go read Meltzer is analysis of the series And now without further ado the Feministing Five with Marisa Meltzer 
<s> Public Online is the the rallying cry during this year is Sunshine Week an annual event to highlight the importance of open government and the freedom of information <s> The week is sponsored by the American Society of News Editors and many editorial boards have echoed the thoughts of the Cleveland Plain Dealer ' government information ought to be made available to the public as quickly as possible with a minimum of rigmarole and in the easiest most accessible way possible--which these days means via the Internet ' We agree--and what better way to celebrate Sunshine Week than with leading thinkers on government media and citizen engagement on all sides of the political spectrum who feel the same Yesterday at our Google D <s> C office the Sunlight Foundation announced its Public Online campaign It is exciting to see growing support for transparency and to see the progress that is been made in the last year alone <s> Every day through sites like Data gov and projects like Open Congress OMB Watch and our Public Data Explorer more data is available online But there is still a gap between having access to government data and easily understanding what it means <s> To help fill this gap Google has partnered with the Sunlight Foundation in its Design for America contest to make government data more comprehensible to the public <s> You can learn more and get started on the contest homepage <s> There is room for all kinds of folks to participate and we can 't think of a more fun way to keep the spirit of Sunshine Week going 
<s> Students excavate a kiln at Cheung Ek Cambodia <s> Photo courtesy of Phon Kaseka Cheung Ek is infamous for being the site of a Khmer Rouge killing field some 20 <date> Cambodians were murdered here between <date> and <date> <s> Yet Cheung Ek also has a much older history and today a team of archaeologists led by Phon Kaseka of the Royal Academy of Cambodia is investigating what lies beneath this once horrifying landscape <s> The team has found that Cheung Ek was settled around <date> B <s> C and played an important part in the emergence of Southeast Asia is first great economy the mysterious Indian-influenced civilization known as Funan <s> Centered in the lower Mekong floodplain Funan flourished from about the first to the sixth century and eventually gave rise to the well-known kingdom of Angkor which culminated in the 13th century <s> According to Kyle Latinis of the University of Cambodia 'Cheung Ek may be one of the pinnacles ' in a complex of sites <s> Both Roman and Chinese historical texts record trade voyages to Funan and archaeologists have uncovered artifacts from Rome Persia India and Greece at the Funan port town of Oc Eo now located in southern Vietnam <s> Archaeologists also have investigated another important Funan site Angkor Borei in southern Cambodia <s> Kaseka is team is just beginning to investigate Cheung Ek but it has already discovered 61 pottery kilns strung out over a distance of three miles five kilometers <s> The kilns have been carbon-dated to between the fifth and seventh centuries making them the oldest uncovered so far in this part of Southeast Asia <s> If the kilns were all used around the same time that would support the idea that Cheung Ek was a major pottery producer and therefore critical to Funan is economy <s> Local potters likely made several kinds of pots including spouted vessels called kendi which were used for storing and pouring water perhaps in ritual ceremonies <s> Archaeologists can learn a remarkable amount about ancient technology and trade from studying kilns and the waste that can be recovered from them such as clay debris and pots broken during manufacture <s> By examining the chemical composition of the clay debris and then testing kendi pots from the same time period that have been recovered at sites across Southeast Asia the team hopes to determine the extent of Cheung Ek is trade network <s> Like many other Funan-period sites Cheung Ek may have continued to be occupied after the decline of Funan and well into the era of Angkor <s> A mysterious large almost perfectly circular earthwork dates from at least the tenth century and the team is testing several hypotheses as to its design and purpose <s> Work has yielded stone inscriptions architecture brick temple or shrine foundations and other features characteristic of later periods <s> Kaseka is team is eager to continue excavating the site is kilns temples and houses but it faces difficulties Cambodia is recovering from its violent past under Pol Pot and the Khmer Rouge but the recovery process is proving detrimental to the nation is cultural heritage <s> Growth has been rapid and often uncontrolled and the external demand for marketable artifacts has intensified <s> Urbanization and looting are destroying Cheung Ek is history 'Action needs to be taken now ' says Kaseka <s> As part of a new generation of Cambodian scholars Kaseka wants any fieldwork plans to include community education and he wants to find ways to persuade developers and looters not to destroy the site or any others like it <s> Sections of Cheung Ek have been preserved as a site museum a memorial to the horrors of the killing fields <s> Now efforts are being made to preserve the parts of this site that could reveal so much about Cambodia is distant past 
<s> New rules took effect February in Delaware governing the arbitration of business disputes in the Delaware Court of Chancery <s> The rules implement amendments to Delaware law adopted last year granting the Chancery Court jurisdiction to arbitrate certain business disputes and compliment rules already in place governing the Court is mediation of business and technology disputes Under the new law the Court of Chancery has jurisdiction to arbitrate 'business disputes ' which would include most complex corporate and commercial disputes <s> At least one of the parties must be a business entity and at least one must be organized under Delaware law or have its principal place of business in Delaware <s> No party can be a consumer <s> In a claim exclusively for monetary damages the amount in controversy must be at least 1 million <s> All parties must consent to the arbitration Arbitration in the Court of Chancery can have numerous advantages over litigation or other forms of arbitration in that it provides prompt and confidential resolution by an experienced and sophisticated arbitrator <s> The arbitration will be heard by either a judge or master sitting permanently in the Court of Chancery <s> The petition and all subsequent arbitration proceedings are confidential and are not included in the Court is pubic docketing system unless there is an appeal <s> A preliminary conference will be held within 10 days of the filing of a petition with a final hearing taking place within 90 days of the filing Selection of arbitration in the Delaware Chancery Court may be appropriate for many complex commercial ventures and arrangements among U <s> S entities as well as those involving non-U <s> S entities often presenting the most straightforward predictable and efficient form of dispute resolution including for buy-sell arrangements purchase price adjustments governance disputes in joint ventures and a wide variety of similar situations <s> Litigation in Delaware and elsewhere will continue to be a feature of disputes involving public company merger and acquisition transactions and governance matters and planning for stockholder litigation in particular is a crucial part of transactional and governance preparedness <s> But serious thought should be given to selecting arbitration in the Delaware Chancery Court as a dispute resolution mechanism for other forms of corporate and commercial disputes both in transactions and more generally 
<s> Its not particularly hard to lose a messaging war against Republicans <s> I mean you aren 't working against the kind of sophisticated public relations machine typically reserved for say a Kardashian <s> You 're not even handling a hot potato <s> If it weren 't for the lucky strike of stumbling into a minority by nominating a candidate who up close appeared to be melting Republicans wouldn 't even be able to consider their drumbeat of 'NO amuch of a message at all <s> Putting aside the deep irony - Nancy Pelosi and Henry Waxman both filed amicus briefs when Ralph Nader challenged the Constitutionality of the so-called 'Slaughter Rule '- Democratic leaders immediately fell prey to the only response 'deem '-ing a bill passed can possibly elicit No <s> Seriously <s> WTF followed as usual by 'Tea Party 'but that is another story for another day Don 't get me wrong <s> I 'd be happy to adopt a 'deem 'and 'pass 'approach to almost anything <s> Louboutains too expensive I deem them passed into my closet <s> Parking too tough I deem and pass my double parking into legitimacy <s> Deeming and passing a flurry of ideas would not only ensure that the world bows to my dominion but would frankly make Congress more effective <s> But call me skeptical that an <date> billion spending bill should be deemed to have passed just like that <s> Beyond feeling powerless in the whole matter I feel like I should have the right to know if my Congressman decided for example to have his vote purchased with earmark spending or a lobbyist-sponsored 'fact-finding 'trip to the Caymans Not to mention the current bill happens to be unpopular <s> Which presents a problem <s> The real solution would be to go back to the drawing board and draft a bill we can all live with but that involves work - which people get themselves elected to Congress to avoid - and if they spend more than one more week a 'ressing health care as opposed to say dramatic job losses Congress will see its approval rating sink even lower perhaps to the level of their Kardashian rivals So faced with a decision - significant work or pass an unpopular bill through a back door method that people don 't quite understand - Democrats chose the latter

<s> Nobody knows DIY beauty better than Kayla Fioravanti Co-founder and Chief Cosmetic Formulator for Essential Wholesale <s> So if the Visa bill was bigger than you expected or you 've just been keeping a keener eye on your pennies then these tips are just up your alley Winter Beauty Tips Potatoes have so many uses Slice raw potatoes and put them on your eye lids to reduce puffiness Or cure swollen feet with a mashed potato foot soak Just purchase a box of dehydrated mashed potatoes and followed the recipe <s> Once you have your mashed potatoes a ' lukewarm or cool water to get the temperature to the right level to soak your feet The potatoes will retain heat longer than a traditional foot bath and they help reduce swelling and soften skin To make it special a ' essential oils before you put your feet in <s> Then indulge feet into one of the best soaks you 'll ever experience It is perfect for making use of those leftovers This same concept can be used with Oatmeal Oatmeal will be soothing and deeply restorative to dry cracked and painful feet Exfoliate In the winter the most important thing to do to keep skin remaining healthy is to exfoliate twice per week to remove dead skin cells Central heating plays havoc on the sebum our skin normally produces which makes our skin lose water which should be retained in the lower dermis of the skin During the winter months there are thousands of dry skin cells ready to be sloughed off the surface and they become clumped together with oil which forms what appear to be flakes <s> Don 't be flaky exfoliate Exfoliate your facial skin with crËme based exfoliates with jojoba beads You can exfoliate your body with a butter oil or crËme scrub that uses salts or sugars Hydrotherapy For a simple in home hydrotherapy start out your day with a hot steamy shower and just as you are finishing switch the water to cold for about fifteen seconds <s> Repeat the process for two minutes <s> This hydrotherapy technique will revitalize your skin by stimulating the flow of blood through the skin

<s> It is always such an encouragement to see other families dealing with SID <s> My son 6yrs was diagnosed with SID with speech language delay when he was 2 <s> We 've been in heavy and expensive therapy since then <s> Before kindergarden when we were seeing very little improvement from the OT he was also diagnosed with ADHD <s> As what I felt was a last resort we chose to try medication a patch Daytrana that administers meds only when on <s> I was so concerned about how he would be able to function in a classroom setting <s> For you doctors and researchers out there I think this is worth noting My son is speech was pretty bad <s> Low understanding of language and an often flipping of phrases almost as if every sentence was a word scramble with conjunctions rarely used <s> Within 3 hours of administering his first patch my son began talking at lightning speed AND FULLY CORRECT It was as if a knotted ball of string that once was his words and thoughts had been pulled straight <s> IT WAS AMAZING And he seemed to know that he was speaking correctly <s> He talked for about 8 hours straight <s> For the first time words were coming out the way he meant them <s> The medication hasn 't been a cure-all but it has enabled him to focus on his work and sit still at school follow complex instructions from parents and teachers and helped him with social interaction <s> I know that is not what some of you want to hear but I think research needs to be done on how ADHD meds can benefit SID kids

manifesto about what he wanted to see happen in the school lunch movement I love the word amanifesto ' <s> Not all schools accepted his new program but many did <s> In <date> the Institute for Social and Economic Research ISER at Essex University comes along and decides to study <math> year-old kids who ate the new diet of fresh food for at least 12 months <s> Results An independent study shows the performance of <math> year-old pupils eating Oliver is meals improved by up to 8 in science and as much as 6 in English while absenteeism due to ill-health fell by <math> <s> The researchers controlled for other variables and compared the results to the schools where the kids did not have access to the fresh food <s> WOW <s> That is all I can say 
<s> I 've been inundated with emails and notes from various Alzheimer is charities and groups about their promotions leading up to World Alzheimer is Day on September 21 <s> We 're right around the 2 year anniversary of when my dad was violently taken from the house after trying to kill my mom and thus he started on the horrible spiral that led to his death 2 months later <s> I can 't bear to read it again maybe I never will but if you are interested it starts here <s> I can 't imagine when I will ever be able to look back at the months of September October and November <date> without pain <s> Some days I can 't even bear to think about my father <s> It is usually when I am alone driving when it hits me--a song on the radio passing a store or restaurant he liked or even a random chain of thoughts that leads me to think my dad was stolen from me and no matter what drugs they come up with now I can never ever get him back <s> Then I drive the long way home until I finish crying <s> Which is my excuse I guess for neglecting this blog <s> I think about writing but it stirs everything up and then I end up in front of my computer crying into my cat is fur <s> Here are some of the campaigns that have been brought to my attention lately <s> If I missed yours let me know

<s> <repeatedchars> Those Numbers Are Frustrating <punctuationfreak> Try as I might I don 't seem to be able to consistently keep my blood glucose level where it is supposed to be <s> Oh there are always times when I know exactly what I splurged on that shot it up and I can accept that as a rare occurrence <s> It is when I think I 've eaten a really good diabetic meal and still have a high reading that is so frustrating <s> Hubby thought maybe my testing equipment was just registering high after we read an article stating that home testing equipment can give results as much as <math> in error <s> So just to see what would happen I double tested for several days last week using the same blood drop with two different testing kits <s> Sometimes the second one would be lower and sometimes it would be higher <s> But both kits consistently showed me too high when it went over the limit my doctor set for me <s> So I can 't blame it on the <math> inaccuracy findings <s> I seem to be particularly susceptible to a glucose rise if I eat most whole wheat breads something I thought I could have in moderation <s> So it is a small piece of sour dough bread with lunch and occasionally a few whole wheat Melba toast pieces with dinner <s> And I can only manage a very small amount of fruit which seems to work better if I eat it first <s> I guess it gets mixed in with the rest of the meal that way and doesn 't have a chance to make a big spike of sugar <s> So in effect I eat my dessert first now <s> So I continue to learn what my body will tolerate and what it will not and we both read everything we can get our hands on that might help me beat this disease as quickly and completely as possible 
<s> As I 've mentioned in a number of my posts my A ' spouse and I separated several years ago because I just couldn 't take dealing with his A ' issues any more <s> Even though he had been on medication and in counseling for 10 years there were still many problems especially in the area of communication <s> As our marriage disintegrated the communications got worse <s> So when we decided we wanted to try to salvage our marriage my husband is counselor who also knew me from some joint counseling sessions we had done suggested that we should try a different approach to communication <s> Instead of discussing things at any old time and getting into communications problems constantly he proposed that we have several formal meetings each week where we would talk about problems and conflicts matters that might require negotiation plans and status -- just like in a business meeting <s> The rest of the time outside the meetings we would only converse on pleasant topics -- like social chit-chat or anything else we both enjoyed unless it was something exceptionally urgent like 'the house is on fire ' <s> The intent was to create a context for my husband to be able to focus his attention on the items we needed to discuss while freeing him the rest of the time from having to try to pay attention when his mind was already engaged with something else <s> With some reservations on both sides we began scheduling meetings and trying to work within this framework <s> I found it frustrating to 'hold off 'talking about matters that arose that were important to me until our meeting -- when I see a problem I want to tackle it NOW -- and my husband initially had trouble with being prepared for the meetings but we adjusted after a couple of months <s> Business meetings are usually set for definite periods of time and we quickly learned that we needed to do the same -- at first my husband could only maintain focus for an hour at best <s> Often that meant that topics got deferred to a later meeting which was very frustrating for me <s> But as we became more practiced he was able to increase his focus time so this problem eventually went away <s> Normally people don 't yell at each other in a business meeting it is unprofessional -- at first we didn 't implement this concept in our meetings and we ended up with some meetings being just one concentrated yelling spree <s> Since my husband can 't think at all when he gets upset our discussions were going nowhere so we adopted this business policy as well <s> This was very difficult for me to implement since I am an impatient angry sort of person by nature but it was well worth it since the reduction of the emotional tension made it much more possible for my husband to apply his mind to the subjects at hand <s> Other problems arose my husband took few notes and so some of things we 'd talk about never got 'on his radar screen 'for follow-up when he took notes they were often so vague that he 'd misinterpret them later on and then we 'd be at o is about what had been discussed and worst he 'd forget the date time and not show up or show up late even though we created a regular schedule <punctuationfreak> <s> These were serious roadblocks and it took some pretty hard work to deal with them <s> To help my husband take better notes we 'd compare notes at the end of each discussion or at the end of the meeting to make sure we had both captured the same information -- he would read back his notes and I 'd identify any discrepancies with mine and then we would mutually resolve the discrepancies <s> In the process of making sure we were 'on the same page ' we 'd also be able to ensure that his notes were more detailed and less vague <s> As far as the lateness forgetting problem went we agreed to implement a rule that if he failed to renegotiate a meeting date time ahead of time and was late or a no-show that the meeting would be rescheduled at my convenience but I had to be fair and not just schedule a bad time for him as 'pay-back ' <s> There were other policies we found useful to implement through trial and error <s> Since it wasn 't certain there would be enough time to cover everything we decided to cover 'logistical 'topics first e g who has what appointments coming up this week who is picking up the dry cleaning when etc then topics where some decision was necessary project status and such and finally more nebulous topics that involve some negotiation or conflict or exploration <s> Before we instituted the meetings my husband often felt that I was always the one driving the discussions so to avoid that we developed a policy that we would a 'ress his agenda before mine not necessarily his entire agenda -- but his logistics before mine his project status before mine etc When my husband would agree to take on some task in our meetings he 'd make notes about it but wouldn 't necessarily set a particular target date -- and without a target date he would have no reminder alarm in his PDA or anywhere else so it often wouldn 't get done -- so now we set up a target date in the meeting as well <s> When I would ask for status on some item that he was supposed to be working on he 'd sometimes have a hard time remembering what he was supposed to have been doing and it slowed down our meetings a lot to go over it -- so now he does a brief review of his notes of the previous meeting before we start each new one <s> We fi 'led with the frequency of our meetings at times but generally have found that three times a week works best for us <s> We both sometimes relapse into bad old habits but we now have the mechanisms in place to correct those problems when they occur <s> Once we ironed out these wrinkles after about six months we found that the meetings not only accomplished their intended purposes of providing a structured context for discussion and negotiation plus better interactions outside the meetings but they some pleasant unexpected results as well <s> My husband has become much better at follow-through because he knows there will be a status check in an upcoming meeting and this has reduced my need to nag <s> I 've learned how to a 'ress conflicts without yelling well most of the time <s> We have a much more structured dynamic for communications which leads to fewer misunderstandings <s> My husband is note-taking has improved so greatly that we rarely need to do re-caps anymore which shortens the meetings and again contributes to better follow-through <s> And the meetings as we have set them up provide a method for coming back to unresolved problems with the chance to review the notes and reflect during the intervening time -- this has been an important element in reaching an accord on many of the more fundamental complex problems surrounding A ' behaviors <s> I 've resisted the urge to end with a bullet-list summary of 'rules 'for setting up such meetings this kind of setup should not be a straight-jacket and I think that each couple has different problems and therefore needs for different rules which only they can discover as they work through this kind of process themselves <s> I think the only real rule is the original intent -- to create a context for focused attention on interpersonal matters and to exclude those discussions from the rest of your interactions <s> This isn 't a perfect system -- it doesn 't always work smoothly every time -- but it is a very helpful framework <s> Suffice it to say that these meetings were a key component in ending our separation -- I really don 't know if we could have resolved our communications problems without them -- and we have found them so helpful we are still holding them more than four years later They can definitely be a powerful tool in the A '-coping toolbox 
<s> School lunch costs me <date> per day <s> I don 't carry cash <s> The cash part of this 'experiment 'has been pretty challenging <s> I do carry bills but they are usually twenties and disappear quickly <s> Open your wallet <s> Do you have three singles Would you be able to acquire single dollar bills for every lunch this week It is been o 'ly difficult for me <s> The lunch ladies don 't make change <s> I have shown up with a 5 and they give me a look like I think they are some kind of shiny ATM <s> Grudgingly they find the money but I often have to wait for it <s> So since starting this project I have had to be creative with my money <s> I 've borrowed money from my husband indefinite loan <s> I 've stopped at businesses and bought random things just for the change <s> One day I stopped at Star bucks before work and bought a drink <s> I never do this by the way <s> I asked the barista 'Can I have change in dollars 'He asked me 'You need it for the tolls 'I stammered with a smile 'Yeah basically 'I am sure he knew I was lying but I didn 't want to get stuck in a long discussion not to mention my concern about my anonymity there might be other teachers waiting for their cappuccinos <s> I mean what do people need singles for The only thing I can think of is going to a strip club <s> Mr <s> Barista was left wondering what I was up to <s> I certainly look like an exhausted working mother -- not the kind of gal gearing up to go to Chip n Dale is

<s> One day last week I wore a pair of pants to work that I bought for 5 online and on sale <s> I love to get a bargain when I shop for clothes <s> I know full well that I 'll probably get a year out of them and that 'll be it <s> It has taken me most of my life to realize that there are things that you buy on sale and things that you spend more on <s> Over the past year I took stock of my shoes and realized that I had bought too many 'for the right price 'and too few for their quality <s> When I analyzed how many pairs I actually wore and why I figured out that my favorite pairs are high quality shoes I spent a lot of money on <s> So I threw out all the pairs that don 't fit right or my foot jiggles in or the ones that rub my ankle raw if I don 't wear them with socks inevitably I forget that fact and wear them to work without socks <s> I spend the whole day on my feet so quality shoes are a priority <s> Then I bought myself a couple new pairs that cost me a lot but I realize the high cost up front pays off my back and feet don 't hurt My husband and I are the rare duo that both enjoy food shopping and we buy quality food <s> We are lucky to be able to splurge on little indulgences and bigger ones sometimes too <s> For our family organic options matter <s> I enjoy cooking my husband doesn 't know how to cook but he can boil water and shopping is the natural extension of that experience <s> We 're passing on a love of food to our kid and we make sure to buy the best that we can afford <s> Why can 't we give all children the best possible food we can find while they are at school Why do they have to get the cheapest stuff If their health and wellness is truly a priority then we need to pony up and find a way to feed them as if they matter <s> Children are not 'little adults 'They are learning and growing every day I am only growing out not up <s> There are some things you spend extra money on and that would be this nation is kids

<s> Yesterday Mr Man was 'not fine ' <s> He was very ill in fact <s> He was banging his head on his pillow in an effort to get the voices to stop <s> He didn 't even hear me talking to him and seemed unaware of my presence until I put my arm around him <s> He told me he had to get on with his 'work 'again and he had to mark himself with his number - <date> <s> I was worried that he was going to carve it into his arm with a knife or something <s> Later he got out 'the folder ' <s> The folder has paper in it and that is where he writes his 'codes 'and things like that - 'work 'that the voices have given him to do <s> He hasn 't got the folder out since <date> <s> I couldn 't believe his symptoms had deteriorated so much in such a short space of time but I knew what the trigger was - we were supposed to be going out that evening to commemorate the death of Christ and he was very anxious about it <s> Needless to say we didn 't go <s> Mr Man is still unwell today but much better than yesterday and typically he doesn 't remember much of yesterday <s> I say 'typically 'because it is quite common for Mr Man to be unable to remember periods when he has been acutely ill <s> He is been a little unwell for a while now though <s> Just a couple of weeks ago he spoke to his Occupational Therapist about how he was feeling <s> She was concerned enough to start visiting him every couple of days and she even gave him her mobile phone number in case of a crisis but he didn 't want to talk to me about how he was feeling <s> I didn 't mind I understood that he doesn 't like me to worry about him and to be honest I was just glad that he was talking to someone instead of keeping it all to himself
