<s> Post note Little bunny died about three hours after I brought him in house <s> I am sure the stress was just too much for him <s> He seemed to be picking up some speed at one point <s> It is all for the better <s> He was warm and cared for <s> I found a wounded bunny near a hay pile I was moving by the lamb stalls this morning <s> He had tucked himself into the safest spot he could and squeaked when I was near by <s> His hind leg has a puncture wound through to the bone <s> He is alive but I 've had my Dr <s> Quinn episodes with bunnies wildlife doesn 't fare well with human interference even when well intended <s> I imagine a cat got him <s> I iodined it after saline bath <s> He is more alert than when I found him and I have him at my desk safe from puppies and wandering felines <s> Not sure if he will make it <s> He 'll die attended though although the sounds of the dogs playing is probably not helping <s> He is calm when held <s> The wandering array of life continues as does pending death <s> These little episodes are not meant to distress but to remind us of the bigger picture <s> Life is temporary and can be snapped away in a bite by man or beast <s> The conflict of having compassion for but raising livestock to sustain me the conflict of helping a bunny that eats my food intertwined <s> Lilly had her lambs last night <s> She finally started labor around six p m and we came to the barn a few times to find her still in pre labor <s> This early morning we arrived to find lambs two beauties <s> The male is very large and already eating a little grass this usually doesn 't happen for a few days or more The girl is this wonderful strawberry blonde <s> Sadly on my second trip to the barn she had torn her eyelid on a piece of the lambing pen - I treated with saline and antibiotic and think it will heal fine <s> Lilly is one of our work horse sheep - always calm and stoic <s> She is a big girl who throws strong lambs <s> I was concerned she had held out this long as we never have lambs past <date> and of course my over active imagination drummed up all sorts of possibilities <s> I tortured myself by re-reading my sheep books about possible causes and lay in bed last night with visions of Lilly lying in breach birth trauma but I guess Mlle <s> Nature just wasn 't ready to pop those two out and they arrived very mature - with ears already standing by morning <s> Normally I wait at least one day to put mom and lambs out but it is sunny and warm and Lilly is an old pro <s> It is less stressful than being separated from the flock <s> They develop so much faster - I find - when they can go outside <s> I want to thank all the nice thoughts people held for us this season- I have to say I feel like a boulder has been lifted off my chest <s> The trauma of last year really made a mark on me and Martyn and it showed this season <s> We lost the stillborn girl and I still fret about the surviving twin is rattle but all in all we are pleased <s> And relieved <s> As the last ewe to lamb Lilly rests and waits <s> And one of Audrey is boys catches some sunny <repeatedchars> is <s> On what most likely was a chilly March 10th in <date> in a hospital room at St <s> Mary is in Rochester Minnesota I came bolting into the world at precisely 10 18 PM <s> And so begins the story which over the years has reached mythical proportions- how I almost killed my mother on my birthday <s> Perhaps it is one reason I chose to never have children - my own mother terrified the heck out of me with my own birth story <s> In all seriousness my mother did almost bleed to death and I have this scar she likes to point out on my forehead from the momentous occasion <s> Supposedly my father looked pale and upset when he saw me because I was pink and red and lobster like where as my brother came out a year earlier looking like JFK - seriously for years my mother compared my brother is looks to JFK <s> I was compared to a lobster <s> And hours before I barged out of the womb my father had been called to the morgue where his 57 year old mother lay dead of a heart attack diabetes related <s> Her untimely death led me to receive her name Katherine instead of Bridgette which my mother had picked out <s> I cant imagine being named Bridgette although as a child I liked to tell this story since Bridgette Bardot was all the rage and as a chubby little redhead I thought BB was quite the cat is pajamas <s> So I can only imagine the yin and yang and surreal quality of that cold March night for my father <s> I wonder if there were things that brought it all back to him as he aged <s> Did the sound of heels on a linoleum floor late at night bring back a sensation of the events he dealt with that night As I get older 52 years older to be exact I can understand how this moment is burned into my mother or father in some kind of post traumatic stress way <s> But being true Minnesotans we carried on and every year my mother made me one of my favorite layer cakes- at the time it was white cake with pink butter frosting <s> In time my tastes changed to German chocolate or her white cake with chocolate frosting <s> I still have the same recipe cards she hand wrote so many years ago all spotted with vanilla stains <s> While I appreciate that I was born I am not one of the people out there saying that birth is beautiful <s> In fact I couldn 't disagree more <s> It is an intimate moment of a mother creature being out of control of her body <s> Miraculous yes but not beautiful <s> I get just about as much birth as I need on the farm thank you very much and all the blood after birth and vaginal prolapses that come with it <s> I think birth is traumatic terrifying bloody and completely chaotic <s> It is a mess <s> In fact it makes no sense <s> A creature pushed out of a keyhole - that is not beautiful it is bizarre <s> It is a miracle but it is not beautiful <s> But it is the only way to get a foot in the door isn 't it Staying in a womb all your life would be safe and warm and inexpensive - no taxes no maniacs on the radio shouting at you <s> But there would be no grand entrance no kisses no pie made with the first strawberries no front row seats to Neil Young <s> No puppies <s> No showers on a hot day <s> No hand to hold when a father dies and no little mouths to feed when a mother dies <s> No matter what creatures come into your life mothering is the beautiful part of birth <s> That some one would go through that trauma to give another creature a way to get their foot in the door of this big messy place called life <s> The winds have come in it is bone chilling <s> All day I was carried back to a place I liked to hide when I was little a grove of sumac bushes out behind our house <s> Alone I felt protected but spooked at the same time <s> Rushing back to the house I 'd hear the wind blowing buckets and roof tops and it felt scary like the Wizard of Oz <s> But home was warm there was homemade cake even on my non birthday <s> It wasn 't messy <s> It is like that today - the sounds of the barn roof rattling in the wind are spooky but I feel safe in the barn surrounded by my mothering ewes <s> Together with my flock I experienced the trauma of last year is lambing and just like my mother did after my birth I carry that trauma with me in a little surface wound in danger of getting reopened if I bump it just right <s> I realized it is my very own birth story and it is required if one expects to find a sense of place in this messy world <s> March 10 Post Note Daisy presented my with two healthy lambs this morning a perfect way to start my birthday <s> They 've made it 8 hours we 'll hope they do well tonight <s> They appear okay <s> I saw some tail wiggling while at the u 'er asign they are getting milk <s> When I saw these pictures I was quite amused at their expressions <s> Amazing how they adapt <s> We are grateful for the sun and warmer weather to help our lambing week along <s> These are Fern is lambs now one week old <s> We had hoped more of the girls would lamb this weekend - perfect weather <s> I knew everyone of the 5 ewes was ready to pop but I like to keep them up and atom until they really go down into labor <s> The new mothers can surprise you though - I once had a new mom wa 'ling casually back to the barn with her baby half way out <s> So last night I was pretty sure Nelly Moser would lamb <s> And she did <s> I have been somewhat concerned about what type of mother Nelly would be- of all our sheep she is somewhat flighty <s> Arriving at the barn there she was with two fresh lambs probably born around 8 am <s> But she wasn 't caring to them very proficiently- she wasn 't licking them or chortling much <s> One was quite dopey looking and chilled not a good sign <s> I checked her u 'er and she had milk and both ram lambs did suck on my finger another good sign <s> I opted not to tube them a procedure where you insert a stomach tube and force feed and gave him milk from my finger instead <s> I decided to take them outside since it is sunny and much warmer outside than the cool barn <s> Nelly was just a bit clueless but she is adapting <s> She is chortling more and can get them to the u 'er but she is not as good as the pros at helping them 'get it ' <s> She did not dry them off well either and I had to step in and help <s> Within a half hour I had them warmed up thanks to the towel and the sun <s> We will just have to watch them and see <s> In the last 3 hours I think both mother and lambs are adjusting to the newness of everything <s> And the other girls wait here is Lilly who I am sure will go soon <s> In fact they are all showing signs of pending labor <s> The rules of this game are simple wait watch then run with all your heart to where ever the guy in front of you runs 
<s> I 've just got back from the hairdresser is and talking to you <s> I left at <date> and have just got back <s> I don 't know whether I should feel ridiculous or relieved <s> Maybe and you know who you are you 'll email and let me know 1 January <date> From John O 'Donohue <math> a blessing for your New Year Beannacht <smiley> 'Blessing ' On the day when the weight deadens on your shoulders and you stumble may the clay dance to balance you <s> And when your eyes freeze behind the grey window and the ghost of loss gets in to you may a flock of colours indigo red green and azure blue come to awaken in you a meadow of delight <s> When the canvas frays in the currach of thought and a stain of ocean blackens beneath you may there come across the waters a path of yellow moonlight to bring you safely home <s> May the nourishment of the earth be yours may the clarity of light be yours may the fluency of the ocean be yours may the protection of the ancestors be yours <s> And so may a slow wind work these words of love around you an invisible cloak to mind your life <s> Sorry haven 't been here for a while <s> Trying to go forwards <s> Hope you are all well and using up the last of the year well <s> During the week I got onto a tube in London feeling very tired and despondent as you often do cramming onto a tube at rush hour and without a book to read I stared up at the adverts and amongst them was this poem <s> It is called 'Prayer ' and was almost in answer to one in that moment and was so lovely I thought I 'd put it here <s> I hope you think so too <s> PRAYER - Carol anne Duffey Some days although we cannot pray a prayer utters itself <s> So a woman will lift her head from the sieve of her hands and stare at the minims sung by a tree a su 'en gift <s> Some nights although we are faithless the truth enters our hearts that small familiar pain then a man will stand stock-still hearing his youth in the distant Latin chanting of a train <s> Pray for us now <s> Grade 1 piano scales console the lodger looking out across a Midlands town <s> Then dusk and someone calls a child is name as though they named their loss <s> Darkness outside <s> Inside the radio is prayer - Rockall <s> Malin <s> Dogger <s> Finisterre Not sure why but this poem seems appropriate today <s> Sonnet to Orpheus Oh you gentle ones every once in a while step into the breath that is indifferent to you let it be parted on your cheeks behind you it trembles reunited <s> Oh you blessed ones oh you whole ones you who seem to be the beginning of the hearts <s> Bow of arrows and target of arrows your smile beams eternally with tears <s> Do not fear to suffer the heaviness give it back to earth is weight heavy are the mountains <s> Heavy are the oceans <s> Even what you planted as children the trees have long become too heavy you could not carry them <s> But the breezes but the spaces <s> Psalm 91 for my sins this for pleasure <s> I wish I had written it <s> To An English Friend In Africa Ben Okri Be grateful for the freedom to see other dreams <s> Bless your loneliness as much as you drank of your former companionships <s> All that you are experiencing now will become moods of future joys <s> So bless it all <s> Do not think your way superior to another is <s> Do not venture to judge but see things with fresh and open eyes <s> Do not condemn but praise when you can and when you can 't be silent <s> Time now is a gift for you <s> A gift of freedom to think and remember and understand the ever perplexing past and to recreate yourself anew in order to transform time <s> Live while you are alive <s> Learn the ways of silence and wisdom <s> Learn to act learn a new speech <s> Learn to be what you are in the seed of your spirit <s> Learn to free yourself from all the things that have moulded you and which limit your secret and undiscovered road <s> Remember that all things which happen to you are raw materials <s> Endlessly fertile <s> Endlessly yielding of thoughts that could change your life and go on doing so forever <s> Never forget to pray and be thankful for all things good or bad on the rich road for everything is changeable so long as you live while you are alive <s> Fear not but be full of light and love <s> Fear not but be alert and receptive <s> Fear not but act decisively when you should <s> Fear not but know when to stop <s> Fear not for you are loved by me <s> Fear not for death is not the real terror but life magically is <s> Be joyful in your silence be strong in your patience <s> Do not try to wrestle with the universe but be sometimes like water or air sometimes like fire and constant like the earth <s> Live slowly think slowly for time is a mystery <s> Never forget that love requires always that you be the greatest person you are capable of being self-regenerating and strong and gentle--your own hero and star <s> Love demands the best in us <s> To always and in time oversome the worst and lowest in our souls <s> Love the world wisely <s> It is love alone that is the greatest weapon and the deepest and hardest secret <s> So fear not my friend <s> The darkness is gentler than you think <s> Be grateful for the manifold dreams of creation and the many ways of the unnumbered peoples <s> Be grateful for life as you live it <s> And may a wonderful light always guide you on the unfolding road <s> Today it was the smell of lilacs that got me <s> I turned a corner on a road I 'd never walked down before quite close to home and bang <s> There I was a child of seven or eight again dragging her feet on the way to the big houses under the railway bridge where on some Sunday mornings a tiny lady who lived in one of them sold us rhubarb and bunches of mint for potatoes <s> Delicious smells but before we got to them we walked with our huge bundles of rhubarb along a crescent-shaped road that was full of what I now know to be lilacs and the smell cleared everything else from your mind <s> For a while everything <s> One of the saving graces of childhood <s> To this day I love lilac - the colour the smell the look of them and of course the way they make my mouth water for rhubarb crumble <s> I am at a writing course this weekend given by the legendary Robert <weirdcaps> the Los Angeles writer of the book STORY <s> He is an amazing teacher <s> I did the London course 2 years ago too and read his book a month or so before my own book came out but it has taken all this time to absorb what he had to say on the level it needed to be known at I feel like I am finally mastering story and all that instinctive way of writing is being tamed by proper plotting and structure <s> I am really excited that bits of the craft are finally slipping over from right to left brain very excited <s> But as he says in his book no matter how much you think you 've got it sussed you can 't do it properly until you have actually done it Here is something I re-read from his book last night and which has stayed in my head all day <s> It is commonplace but something that really hit home <s> He says once you 've mastered the rules of story and the conventions of the genre you have chosen to write in put away the rules and 'Write only what you believe <s> Write your kind of story <s> The kind of story you 'd stand in line in the rain to buy 'What fantastic advice ' the kind of book you 'd stand in line in the rain to buy ' well actually he says ' the kind of film you 'd stand in line in the rain to watch 'because his course is also for screenwriters but it is relevant for all forms <s> Just a word of warning if anyone is thinking of going to his next course and he does them in countries around the world <s> Two years ago I got lambasted by him because my phone went off during the first day of the 3 day course when he had forbi 'en us to have phones on in the auditorium <s> He fined me 10 the total sum of money I had on me for lunch but he made me hand it over To this day I swear I don 't know how my phone switched on as I am convinced I turned it off <s> I was emotionally raw because my book was about to come out plus all that ugly stuff that was going around about me at the time false and malicious though it all was had finally got to me and so the emotion his 'telling off ' brought about almost knocked me for six <s> I wouldn 't have believed it possible to feel that much over 'relatively ' so little <s> I must have been holding all that emotion in for all that time waiting for my book to finally go public and there in that lecture theatre I almost went into meltdown <s> I had shut myself down over the years especially all those months that I was living in the car and almost never cried anymore about anything <s> But during the 3 days of the course I couldn 't stop <s> I just couldn 't hold back the tears and in fact it got so bad that on the afternoon of the last day as we all settled down for the screening of Casablanca I had to leave <s> The crying was silent of course or as much as I could make it but it felt like a hand had passed into my chest and was squeezing my heart over and over again big fist-sized handfuls of it kneading it over and over like dough and I almost couldn 't see for the tears or breathe for the pain of it <s> And although no one else in the lecture theatre seemed to notice who doesn 't cry at Casablanca it felt like somehow he knew <s> I don 't know how but it felt like he did and as he passed behind my seat as he briefly left the theatre for a few minutes while we continued to watch Casablanca he slowed down and seemed to look directly at me and tears were just streaming down <s> He must have thought I was mad having a slight overreaction anyhow <s> I think he recognises me this time too <s> Maybe I am just imagining that but <s> Anyhow this year I have been smart enough to leave my phone behind for that read so terrified of it happening again that I didn 't dare bring it along <s> The man is a genius but you don 't want to see his dark side <s> So be warned if any of you decide to go to his next course and I would absolutely recommend it switch your phones off You have been warned <s> I am sitting here typing this under blue skies <s> The busy city street below my window is full of the smell of warm blossom and now and then when there is the occasional lull in traffic and all you hear is the slow swish of trees from neighbouring gardens and the call of birds in flight you can close your eyes and think yourself almost anywhere <s> I love days like today

away from Chicago even after 9 years of living here it slips my mind <s> I can 't wait to catch up with Betsy I can 't remember the last time we saw each other <s> But I think it was at the Portland <s> After finishing this it occurred to me I had George <weirdcaps> is allegorical fairytale Lilith in mind when working on it <s> George <weirdcaps> was a good friend of Charles Dodgson Lewis Carroll <s> The story is that of a sort of super-succubus who holds half the waters of the world in her hand <s> Her sin is in cutting off life which results in her living a sort of half-life and doing harm to others <s> George <weirdcaps> was quite an interesting character a Presbyterian minister whose unorthodox sermons he believed in that God was internal and in love rather than doctrine got his parishioners riled up to the point where he was essentially demoted from a parish with a good living to a less remunerative one <s> It is also interesting that C <s> S <s> Lewis was such an admirer of <weirdcaps> whose vision seems to me much more generous than that of Lewis <s> This on Imaginary Bicycle made me cry in a good way

<date> So boys you know how I am always trying to drill those stupid disability misconeptions out of your beautiful minds Well stand-up comedian Ryan Niemiller has actually found a better way to do it <s> His A Guide to Dating for the Handicapped takes the humor route and I couldn 't have said it better myself <s> As someone with a handicap I have had my fair share of troubles finding love <s> Luckily all of my non-handicapped friends have been so kind over the years to help me along the way and tell me how I someone with a handicap should date <s> I 've compiled in conjunction with Ally 'Wheels 'Bruener this helpful list for anyone else here that might have a disability I present the Guide to Dating for the Handicapped -Only look for others people with disabilities -Never try to date up <s> You will fail -Make yourself look as normal as possible <s> If someone is stupid enough they may think you 're normal -Never complain about the fact that you don 't have anybody <s> You 're handicapped and supposed to be an inspiration <s> Don 't be selfish -Everyone that hangs out with you is paid to do so <s> Just accept it -Don 't ask for anyone to set you up <s> No one is going to be that mean to their friends -If you are disabled you must be asexual -If you really want a date try getting it setup through the Make-A-Wish Foundation <s> It is your best bet -Just accept the fact that a pat on the head from a little old man will be the most action you 'll see -Take some classes on counseling You 'll be the one everyone comes to with their problems -If anyone actually offers to sleep with you decline <s> It is a fraternity sorority initiation prank <s> Or your parents paid them -If you don 't want to die a virgin begin shopping around for the best-priced hooker immediately -Never let your quest for a relationship get out to your family They 'll reassure that it just isn 't practical -Your non-handicapped friends are right - you 're just being silly -Society isn 't as harsh as you think <s> You 're just being overly critical -Every member of the opposite sex you talk to will tell you there is someone out there for you - it is just not them -You just aren 't trying hard enough -You 're trying too hard <s> Just let it happen -You want a family Don 't these supposed rules society buys into just look completely ridiculous and ignorant when seen on paper well on the screen and listed all together Don 't they want to make you scratch your eyes out Because you know I have a big mouth allow me to a ' a couple of my own to round out the list -Always have your date talk for you cut your meat for you and tell people to move out of the way as you 're coming through <s> Because you know you can 't use your voice in public <s> Don 't want to scare the little children do you -If the most action you ever get is looking into the gorgeous blue eyes of Silvio every time he comes to help you shower be grateful <s> Silvio is your in-home health-care worker -You 're loved by your family <s> That is more than what some people have <s> Don 't cry with a loaf of bread under your arm <s> Let me know boys when those guilty oh-my-gosh-I-can 't-believe-I-let-her-get-away feelings set in <s> Go ahead boys <s> I 'll wait <s> Heck I 've got all day - and night you know because it is not like I have a date or anything <kikoo> Photos via happythings I love the meaning behind these travel-themed engagement photo shoots <s> These couples look so happy and excited to be starting a new adventure in marriage don 't they <kikoo> P <s> S <s> The Map Shoot is my favorite Too bad there is not really a Map of Love somewhere out there And the Plane Shoot makes me want to burst into my own rendition of <smiley> Where We Belong <s> Sigh <s> P <s> P <s> S <s> Check out Beau-Coup is We 'ing Blog for more <repeatedchars> -inspiring couples The wonderfully insightful Kasey is back to share more tales with us this week read his previous tales here here <s> And just so you know readers these are in no way solicited by me but I will say I am loving his style aren 't you <kikoo> Rule 11 Put your money where your mouth is <s> Guys if you like a girl you need either to pay or offer to pay for the evening <s> Period <s> Ladies if you like a guy and you 've been on a few dates and you 're not going to dump him offer to pay every now and then <s> I typically refuse to let girls pay if I like them <s> But I love it when they ask <s> And if the ladies want to pay for their own that is fine too <s> If a guy does not offer to pay it is usually safe to assume that he isn 't that into you <s> If a girl wants to pay her own way guys let her <s> Actually guys let her do whatever she wants <s> Don 't screw it up <s> But AT LEAST OFFER to pay <s> You are not trying to buy your date or buy sex or any of those ludicrous ideas <s> You are simply saying 'I like you ' and proving it by how you handle your money <s> Rule 22 Always call with a plan <s> Recently a girl friend of mine received a call from a guy who supposedly likes her where his only question was 'Can I call you tomorrow to see when you 're free ' Let this sink in <s> Read it again <s> Exactly <s> Dumb dumb dumb dumb dumb <s> He had her on the phone already wouldn 't it make sense to just ask her when she was free Yes <s> People are actually this silly <s> Anyway the point is always call with a plan <s> Even if the plan is just to talk about the other person is day <s> That counts because you 're talking building communication skills and hopefully getting to know more about the other person is likes and dislikes so you can pull out that information when it really counts <s> Guys unless it is too late to go do something you always need to have a plan that puts the two of you together <s> Suggestions include movies dinner walks in the park heck you can even walk around Wal-mart and do some grocery shopping I like asking girls if they would like to play with my Wii <s> O 'ly enough they like it <punctuationfreak> <smiley> It is OK if the girl wants to change the plan <s> Just make sure you have thought of something <s> Especially avoid this exchange 'What do you want to do ' 'I don 't know what do you want to do ' 'I don 't know maybe well what do you want to do ' NO NO NO If all else fails say 'I want to see you <punctuationfreak> ' That at least is the truth Photos via We Heart It Prologue You know your nonexistent love life has become close to extinction territory when your own mother makes you feel as though it is the most ludicrioous idea in the world that you could possibly be interested in or even have a chance with a romantic beau <s> I had another one of those invisibility moments last week <s> You know the kind friends where you 're just standing there and wishing you had a white flag that you could wave wildly in the air and scream 'HELLO I am right here aren 't I Why can 't you see me And yet even though I was there I felt completely invisible <s> And what made me feel even worse was that the person whom I felt invisible toward wasn 't some guy or some guy is girlfriend or even Mr <s> Hefner himself <s> It was my mother <s> Here is how the situation went down I got a sweet email from Cute Guy Friend on the anniversary of my dad is death last week <s> He wrote to say that he was thinking of my family and remembering my dad <s> How sweet is that Well as my awkward and awful luck would have it things turned pretty sour pretty quickly when I casually brought it up to my mother later that day 'Oh that is sweet ishe replied and then immediately turned to my sister and sai ' <weirdcaps> should date him 'My sister Really I mean really I just sat there floored and quite a bit deflated <s> A few minutes later during which time my mother had probably forgotten what she 'd said in the first place I said flat-out 'Why didn 't you say that to me 'You 've never expressed an interest in him ishe replied as if my question was the dumbest thing she 'd ever heard <s> NEWSFLASH Neither has my sister <s> She is never expressed an interest in him <s> Not even once <s> So let is review the facts shall we friends -He emailed me -My sister hardly knows him I suppose it bothered me even more because this isn 't the first time my mother has bypassed me completely which is why I 've always looked at my sister as the pretty one <s> I know it is being overly sensitive probably on my part and my mother probably wasn 't even thinking about my disability when she made that remark <s> In the last few months I 've been feeling increasingly confident as a sexy woman with a disability OK gosh just typing the word sexy to describe myself just made me blush literally and I suppose this harmless comment brought some of those invisibility wallflower feelings back <s> Even if just a little bit you know Is it impossible for my mother - or anyone really - to think that I could be capable of being in a relationship Has that concept just never even dawned on her Am I not worthy of that just as much as anyone else I know she doesn 't do it consciously but sometimes I swear my mother is incapable of seeing me as a woman and yes I am aware that this is a common theme among mothers <s> But it just seems so much more pronounced in my life especially when you a ' the disability factor to it <s> Or maybe at the end of the day I am just being overly sensitive <s> Maybe I am projecting my own insecurities and using them as a lens by which to judge things <s> Let is be honest friends It is not like I haven 't done that sort of thing before <s> But you know what damnit It bothered me <s> It hurt me <s> It eroded just a little of the disability self-esteem that had been slowly growing like a flower <s> Well now the flower looks as if it is beginning to wilt <s> What do you think friends Am I just being overly neurotic once again <kikoo> Photos via happythings Routines my gosh they can be hard to get back into can 't they friends I am back at work today and am trying to get back into the swing of things <s> May these calming photos inspire me - and you <kikoo> Photos via flickr Happy Monday friends I was going over the Man Candy archives over the weekend and I had to gasp when I realized I haven 't featured this guy yet <s> Well he is more of a man than a guy and let is just say that he is only gotten better with age <s> He showed us a new life of living on a prayer and always promised to lay us down in a bed of roses <s> And as she is aged he is up the sexy-wow factor by declaring 'it is my life 'and reminding us that yes we can go home again <s> JON BON JOVI <punctuationfreak> Happy Friday friends How was your week My spring break was entirely too short as always but I am looking forward to returning to work on Monday and get back into some semblance of a routine <s> Are you doing anything exciting this weekend I 'll be heading to a pancake breakfast tomorrow morning and let is just say that I might be unnaturally excited about this <s> Pancakes Eggs Sausage My equivalent of Food Heaven <s> I loved all your sweet comments this week about my dad your kind words always brighten my day Thanks also to the awesome etsy owners who contributed their talents to our 5 Days of Giveaways series this week <s> What fun While I am enjoying my hearty and delicious breakfast check out my Top 5 Favorite Blogs this week FYI I 'd love to hear what your favorite blogs are too <s> Letters of Note A great collection of old letters Color Collective Because you can never fill <s> Longtime FSP readers know that I am interested in how academia is depicted in literature and other artistic venues and that I have a particular interest in academic satire in novels <s> Although I generally disapprove of attempts to make academia and academics seem like bizarre megalomaniacal control freaks who are entirely disconnected from the 'real 'world I am not incapable of enjoying a good academic satire hence my fondness of the novel Straight Man by Richard Russo <s> I even like the Indigo Girls ' song 'Closer to Fine ' despite this horrific set of anti-academic lyrics I went to see the doctor of philosophy With a poster of Rasputin and a beard down to his knee <s> He never did marry or see a B-grade movie He graded my performance He said he could see through me <s> I spent four years prostrate to the higher mind got my paper And I was free <s> Give me a break <s> Anyway I was curious to read the recent novel '36 Arguments for the Existence of God ' Rebecca Goldstein described in some reviews as a brilliant new example in the academic satire genre <s> Washington Post Ron Charles The field of academic satire is crowded with such classics as 'Lucky Jim 'and 'Straight Man 'but '36 Arguments isports so many spot-on episodes of cerebral pomposity that you 've got to place this novel among the very funniest ever written <s> New York Times Janet Maslin <smiley> When Cass witnesses a <weirdcaps> presentation featuring 'brain scans of sophomores neuroimaged in the throes of moral deliberation over whether they should in theory toss a hapless fat man onto the tracks in order to use his bulk to save five other men from an oncoming trolley ' this book occupies its ideal vantage point close to the absurdity of current academic thinking yet just far enough away to laugh <s> Cerebral pomposity The absurdity of current academic thinking Did these reviewers also spend their college years prostrate to bearded Rasputin-loving higher minds Certainly there are pompous intellectuals in academia and some research topics and methods seem quite absurd but these are not the kinds of things I enjoy seeing parodied in novels and pilloried in reviews <s> For me the most clever and entertaining academic novels are the ones that show the absurdity of the weird-but- mundane rituals of academic life professor-student interactions faculty meetings budgets tenure and that are a bit more subtle in their portrayal of classic personalities in academe <s> Therefore I am not particularly impressed by bizarre and disturbing characters such as the 'Extreme Distinguished Professor 'in 36 Arguments and am much more entertained by a depiction of strangely recognizable people embroiled in the bizarre and disturbing rituals of a faculty search as in Straight Man <s> Said FSP is daughter is mi 'le school Science teacher to FSP when he saw her in the corridor of the school Hey it is the famous woman scientist <s> I was taken aback at first wondering why he used adjectives one of which was strange and the other implied that scientist man unless you specify otherwise hence the somewhat cynical name for this blog <s> But then I figured out why he greeted me that way <s> Later this same science teacher asked me if I would come talk to his class in a month or two <s> Great I replied <s> But I thought you were done with the unit on My Science <s> Oh ah yes <s> Actually we are doing a unit on Diversity and so we need a a a <s> Woman scientist Yes exactly <s> The state expects us to do something on Diversity and I uh uh have no clue what to do and don 't even know enough to ask this favor in a non-offensive way I didn 't say that but actually I don 't have a clue either <s> I have never talked about Diversity to a group of mi 'le school kids before <s> I assume that I should talk about all types of diversity not gender <s> I would like to keep my overall message positive and talk about Science as a rewarding career but perhaps we could also discuss stereotypes of scientists strange white males <s> I am going to have to give this a lot more thought <s> Has anyone else given a talk on Diversity to mi 'le schoolers I could use some advice <s> As both a student and a professor I have experienced at various times both the <smiley> quarter and semester systems <s> For those unfamiliar with these systems An academic year composed of quarters involves 3 academic terms a summer term 4 quarters each of 10 weeks duration fall winter spring <s> An academic year composed of semesters involves 2 terms each 15 weeks duration fall and ispring ' the former of which may include the end of summer and the latter of which includes the winter season <s> Some of my colleagues and students experience the 'block plan ' 1 intensive course per 3 week period but I have not so I will confine my comments to quarters v semesters <s> Both quarter and semester systems have advantages and disadvantages for professors and students but these pros and cons may shift around from course to course depending on various factors related to course content and professorial teaching ability <s> Quarter system Terms are shorter <s> Boring classes are over sooner and boring professors can inflict less damage <s> The content and format of some courses even very enthralling ones are better suited to a shorter term <s> Quarters typically start later September in the <smiley> and end later June than the semester-based academic year <s> You may like or dislike quarters owing to this feature alternatively you may like this feature in late August and early September when your semester colleagues have started their academic year and hate it in May and early June when your semester colleagues already have their grades done <s> It may be easier for professor to get a research leave for a quarter than it is to get a semester leave <s> Students on the quarter system may be at a disadvantage in the summer because their academic year ends late relative to the start of some summer internships and other jobs <s> Semester system Semesters can seem very very long <s> Your joy at making it to Spring Break may be a bit dampened by the realization that the semester is only half over <s> You can however explore more topics in more depth than you can with a shorter term <s> You may have more flexibility in course content owing to the longer term <s> You get to know your students better <s> You might even learn all their names <s> You may start the academic year before you are ready for summer to end but you are done in the spring <s> Depending on your institutions policies re teaching load you may have fewer course preps year <s> You only have to deal with beginning and end of semester craziness twice instead of 3 times <s> In an academic term the first couple of weeks and the last week or two can be quite chaotic but in a semester there is plenty of time in the mi 'le to get into a routine in which the logistics of the course are at least functioning well <s> As a student I didn 't have a strong preference even once I had experienced both systems <s> Depending on how many courses I was expected to take at once and what the course offerings were I may have had a slight preference for one over the other but overall it didn 't matter a lot to me <s> As a professor I think I prefer the quarter system recognizing that semesters do have some distinct advantages <s> For most courses I feel that I can convey the most essential information in 10 weeks <s> I wouldn 't like quarters if I had to create new courses all the time but for a relatively stable set of courses and only the occasional new course to prepare quarters are better for maintaining a high energy level and morale from term start to term end <s> Which do you like Semesters or quarters or something else Some applications for open faculty positions require letters of recommendation up-front some request letters only after there has been a first stage of selection based on other information supplied by the applicant <s> Although I don 't mind the first method I prefer the second because it seems like a better use of time for those writing the letters and for those reading the applications <s> I know that things are done in a different way at many non- <smiley> institutions but lately I have encountered variations on this system within the <smiley> <s> In the past few months - I received a request for a letter of reference for someone who had already been invited to interview at a <smiley> institution <s> In fact no letters of reference were solicited until this stage so my letter wasn 't supplementary or an attempt to fill a reference letter quota <s> The letters were clearly not a part of the interview selection decision <s> It is unclear what role if any they have in the search and - I received a request for a letter of reference after someone had a phone interview but before they were invited for the actual interview <s> I am glad I am not on that hiring committee as it seems to involve several extra steps <s> I didn 't mind either of those requests although the first case made me wonder why the institution even bothered to get letters if they are so unimportant in the process <s> Perhaps it is an administrative requirement Having read thousands of these letters I must say I can 't really blame anyone for not valuing reference letters very much <s> A letter request that did annoy me however was one accompanied by the information that my letter would not even be read unless the candidate advanced to the final interview stage <s> In this case the position is not an academic one so perhaps I just lack familiarity with how things are done outside academia <s> From what I could tell from the instructions the organization will not read the letters before the final candidates are selected from a huge pool of applicants but wants to have the letters on hand to read as soon as the final interviewees are selected and hence the request for possibly superfluous letters <s> I can understand the wish for efficiency especially given the large number of applicants but it is a bit of a strange request Please write this letter even though we are unlikely to read it <s> We need to be efficient but we are willing to possibly waste your time <s> Wouldn 't such a request lend itself to getting cursory letters or letters that are not focused specifically on the position for which the applicant has applied I typically take some time to customize each letter depending on what the position is and in some cases this takes quite a bit of time <s> Why would I do that if I don 't know if my letter will even be read I guess I will do it for the same reason we write any reference letters not knowing if the subject of the letters will get the position <s> Despite knowing in this particular case that my letter may be transferred unread directly to an electronic trash heap I think the best strategy is to try to forget about that and write the letter in the hopes that it will eventually be read the student will get the job and it will all be worthwhile in the end <s> A reader asks How long do you typically give 1st or 2nd year grad students to 'pull things together 'when they struggle in the beginning Where is the line is drawn and what factors affect the judgments professors will make about their students I will consider only <weirdcaps> students in this discussion <s> I should say right away that I do not have a foolproof way of deciding when or where to draw the line on struggling students <s> I tend to err on the side of delusional optimism hoping that some solution involving change in project topics methods degree of supervision more structure specific goal-setting or approach to writing will pull us all through the problems <s> Only in hindsight has it been obvious when this was a bad plan resulting in prolonged suffering and expense <s> In other cases it has worked by 'worked 'I mean that the student got their <weirdcaps> and therefore any difficulties were worth it I think <s> That said when and where I draw the line depends on the specific things with which the student is struggling and how or whether they are making an effort to communicate about and or deal with the problem <smiley> <s> Is the problem motivation If a student is unproductive owing to a severe lack of interest or motivation in any reasonable research project they can do with me as adviser that is something that should be quite clear in the second year if not the first though I have had students who started out very energetic in the first year but whose motivation was completely extinguished in the second by the reality of what research and or working with me involves Is the problem that the student lacks the information or skills necessary to do the research That can be fixed in many cases and should be dealt with by the end of the second year <s> The student should be as proactive as possible about learning what they need to know to do their research <s> Is the problem the adviser Is this something that could be fixed by discussing the situation or is it something that can 't be changed If the latter the student has a decision to make about whether to continue with that adviser <s> Although it is possible that with time the student may understand better what seems like irrational or unkind behavior it is likely that the adviser won 't become more sane or nice with time <s> Is the problem beyond the student is control Examples Access to facilities A complex and difficult research project that may proceed in a non-linear way Lack of clear direction Research that takes a long time to produce interpretable results I am impressed by students who find ways to deal with obstacles like these <s> In fact a student who feels like they are struggling perhaps because they are too critical when comparing themselves with others may not be struggling in the eyes of the adviser and other faculty <s> Other problems such as those involving finishing a project or writing may not manifest themselves until later after the first two years <s> In the first two years it is not too late to change course in a possibly dramatic way including deciding that there is no point in continuing in the graduate program <s> There have been a few cases in which I decided in the first or second year that there was no point in advising a student for a <weirdcaps> these students got an MS instead <s> There has to be an obvious major reason for going this route though -- e g failed classes or lack of productivity owing to extreme lack of effort <s> Will a student who has a slow but not catastrophic first year or two be at a permanent disadvantage I suppose this depends on the adviser but in my opinion a student who struggles with something in the first year or two but who eventually surmounts the obstacles and succeeds should not be at a disadvantage later <s> In fact few arrive in graduate school perfectly prepared to leap into the perfect project that goes perfectly from Day One <s> If you had asked any of my graduate advisers or committee members what they thought of me in my first or second years of graduate school the responses would have ranged from a derisive snort to a polite but sympathetic chuckle at my likely future career as a cat sitter <s> That changed a few years later once I started getting results and writing papers and my slow start didn 't harm my career <s> If you mostly like what you are doing and at times possibly even love what you are doing and you want to keep going with your research despite initial problems my advice summarized is Stay focused know what your goals are short-range intermediate-range long-range communicate with your adviser and others if you feel stuck at least make some progress step-by-step even if the steps seem small and don 't worry so much <s> The Chronicle Review the magazine-like part of The Chronicle of Higher Education recently asked a group of ischolars and experts 'to comment on stress in the lives of academics using the Amy Bishop incident as a springboard for the discussion i e what role might stress related to the tenure process have played in this tragedy The scholars and experts included a writer and <weirdcaps> candidate in English literature the chancellor of the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education a professor of international politics a professor of English an assistant professor of public policy and political science an assistant professor of sociology and women is and gender studies a <weirdcaps> candidate in anthropology a dean of a School of Arts amp Sciences a professor of management a professor of history Clearly there was an effort to consult a wide variety of academics associated with the <smiley> system of higher education professors and administrators tenured professors and tenure-track professors professors at universities and professors at small liberal arts colleges even some <weirdcaps> candidates who have no direct experience yet with the stresses of being on the tenure-track <s> Many of these people had thoughtful insights I was interested to know the opinions of sociologists and anthropologists and others <s> Even so Amy Bishop was an assistant professor of biology <s> Does it seem o ' to anyone else that there were no biology or other science professors in this particular group of academics commenting on the incident I looked up the chancellor and the dean and learned that their field of expertise is psychology so perhaps they come the closest but that is not the same as getting the opinion of someone who has recently experienced the tenure process as a scientist <s> I realize that a biology professor would not necessarily have any more insight into the general implications of the incident than those who provided comments in this piece in the Chronicle <s> And I still stand by my overall view shared by the <weirdcaps> candidate in English literature that the murders were the actions of an imbalanced person with a rage problem and a gun and the tragedy was therefore not a direct result of the stresses of academia in general or the tenure evaluation system in particular <s> Still I think it is strange that in an otherwise diverse group not one is a science professor with direct knowledge of what it is like to get tenure as a scientist today at a university <s> Consider how bizarre it would have been if an English professor for example had committed a heinous crime that may or may not have been related to the experience of being an English professor and the only people asked to comment in a particular series of essays were science engineering and math professors <s> I also think it would have been illuminating to read for comparison the thoughts of a scientist recently denied tenure <s> With all due respect to the <weirdcaps> candidates and literary scholars who wrote thoughtful essays for the piece surely the Chronicle could have found some current or former science professors -- ideally in the life sciences -- to comment I don 't want to perpetuate an 'us ' scientists vs 'them non-scientists mentality but often when I read about academia in the Chronicle and elsewhere the point of view of non-scientists is the only one represented <s> This gives a very incomplete view of academia and the lives of academics in general and in extreme cases <s> Although we have much in common as researchers and educators there are also significant differences that at times merit consideration <s> Who is staying away from campus for Spring Break by choice i e not owing to a furlough Who is doing this because otherwise they will have a dire childcare challenge Who is staying away from campus for a week as a sanity break so that they can face the rest of the academic year with renewed energy Of those avoiding campus Will you be going somewhere preferably fun and interesting or just staying home and possibly working there Who will be on campus but would rather not be there Who will be on campus because if they don 't they fear the consequences from their adviser from their advisees from a promotion amp tenure committee from collaborators If you are a graduate student has your adviser specifically discussed with you whether you can should will work over Spring Break If so what did they say If not what do you think they would say And who is going to be on campus because they want to be there -- to enjoy a week of relative quiet in their office catch up on research get ready for post-break classes and possibly even clean their desk and its immediate surroundings What are you doing for Spring Break professors postdocs off campus but working off campus and not working on campus and working but would rather not be on campus and working happily pollcode com free polls What are you doing for Spring Break grad students off campus but working off campus and not working on campus and working but would rather not be on campus and working happily pollcode com free polls Many times I have conversed with a visitor who is much more famous and smarter than I am <s> We sit in my office and we I try to find something of mutual interest that we can discuss <s> I am not a skilled conversationalist but I can almost always find something to talk about for half an hour <s> One of the things I am not tempted to discuss is the disparity in success or fame or IQ or amount of funding of whatever between the visitor and me <s> What would be the point of that It is therefore disconcerting for me when I find myself in the visitor is chair in someone else is office and they start the conversation with a series of self-deprecating statements about how they have not published as much as I have and how I write better proposals than they do and how they are basically not as successful as I am <s> This does not happen often but it happens from time to time <s> I hasten to note that this is not because I am so awesomely famous or well funded <s> My usual description of myself is 'reasonably successful 'as a scientist and I think that is accurate <s> I do not think the self-deprecation is a form of false modesty <s> The self-deprecating person is genuinely ripped up about their lack of productivity <s> I think these conversations stem more from insecurities than from anything specific about me or my career <s> Even so what I am supposed to say when confronted with these types of statements I am more than willing to have a conversation about proposal strategies or ideas for new directions in research or even to have a group wallow about some aspect of Science or Academia that is particularly controversial or nerve-wracking <s> If the self-deprecating person is a stressed out early career professor I can go into mentor mode if that seems to be a useful way to go <s> Otherwise I try to steer the conversations to research-related topics that might be of mutual interest or I ask a lot of questions <s> It is possible that some isuccessful 'visitors will want to tell you how amazing they think they are but in the absence of such a conversational foray here is a gentle request to those scheduled for an individual meeting with a visiting speaker Even if you feel that you are orders of magnitude less successful than your visitor in some professional capacity even if you have the most raging case of impostor syndrome even if you are in awe of the towering intellect of your distinguished visitor and even if you can think of nothing more fabulous than being a short unprepossessing mi 'le-aged female science professor like your visitor please tuck away these feelings and talk about Science or Students or Something else other than your relative lack of success <s> Some visitor is egos may need continual care and stoking but I think you will feel better and everyone will have a more interesting half hour if self-deprecation whatever the reason for it is not a major feature of the conversation 
<s> Click here for more Wordless Wednesday participants If you are reading this anywhere besides Emm in London or in an RSS reader then the content is stolen <s> Please report stolen content to missus emm gmail com Copyright <date> Missus Emm http missus-emm blogspot com 3mm <date> m2ndy One of the greatest benefits of running this blog has been the opportunity to meet all sorts of people I might not have encountered otherwise <date> A short while ago I received a couple of comments from a friendly blogger called 'Revivor ' and when I popped over to his blog I saw that he was organising a four day run from Clapham to Brighton to raise money for the charity CASPA Children on the Autistic Spectrum Parents ' Association <date> Naturally I was intrigued and so I contacted him straight away and we decided to meet up and chat about his noble adventure <s> Ivor Reveley check out the 'Gotta Run ' t-shirt On whether he has done such a thing before Two years ago on his fiftieth birthday Ivor and a team of runners ran from Romford to Orpington <date> They ran 50kms over 50 hours to raise money for 50 young people with autism <date> Ivor broke that down for me and explained that it is not as impossible as it sounds bearing in mind that I walk a 5km fun run once a year you run for two to three hours a day over three days and cover about 20 kilometres a day <date> It is not easy but it is possible They raised 8 <date> on that occasion which meant that their charity CASPA was able to obtain viability and get the real start that it required <date> This is so important as Ivor explains because it meant that the charity could remain a stable entity in the lives of the children and families it serves <s> On why he was raising money for CASPA Ivor is sixteen-year-old son has autism <date> After being a charity trustee for fifteen to twenty years Ivor realised that he had the skill necessary to make a difference in the lives of other children with autism and he decided to get involved with CASPA <s> On what CASPA is and what they do <s> Ivor is the chair and trustee of the charity <date> They started off as an informal parents ' association in <date> and formally registered the charity in <date> <date> As a charity they run events and workshops for young people with autism such as Brighton Beach kid is days out Youth Club on a Friday night A residential week long summer camp Independent Living Workshops which are sponsored by the LDA They have received brilliant feedback from the children who say it is a safe environment for them to have fun free from bullying or other such concerns <s> On making the runs interesting After completing A-levels in Economics Geography and Maths Ivor went on to study Economics at university <s> An avid map lover Ivor is now using his Geography and Maths skills again as he plans the most historical and geographically interesting routes through cathedrals and up high streets <date> The idea is for the runners to enjoy these events and to see and learn about the places they run through <s> On this year is event Date 30 April 3 May <date> <s> Route Clapham Common to Brighton Beach route details Ivor hopes to do events like this every even year and this year they will be doing a four day run from Clapham to Brighton <date> Ivor is keeping a log of all of the training and organising of the event in his blog Four Days Running <s> A half marathon is 21km and these runners will be doing more than that each day as they will run from about <date> pm to 5pm every day for four days <s> Friends family and supporters will be able to meet up with the runners every evening as pub nights are being organised on Facebook and the hotels that the group is staying in is published on the site stay on route <s> This is not a public run but anyone interested in joining the run can contact Ivor at the site to get involved <date> They have a photographer taking part this year so expect great photos On how YOU can help You can donate money using the button above <date> That will take you to the Just Giving site where the money will go straight to the charity and won 't touch anyone is hands <s> But don 't worry there are lots of other ways to help too Follow the Four Days Running blog Follow Ivor is Twitter account revivor <date> Join the fun and do the four day run Run With <smiley> Stay on the route advice on fine read really rather expensive dining in Britain <s> Barely a day goes by when we don 't hear of someone is tales of woe with regards to their finances <s> Maybe nary a day goes by when you don 't think of your OWN tales of personal finance horror but this post isn 't about personal finances in fact this post isn 't even going to be particularly serious in the slightest perhaps a welcome break from the drudgery we encounter on a day-to-day basis <s> This post is for those who dare to dream who occasionally or often there is no discrimination at play here have flights of fancy where they can afford whatever they please consequences be damned <s> Food <s> Everyone loves food <s> Of course there are picky eaters gluttons who eat anything and then there is the gourmet who will indulge in only the finest of fripperies wherever food is concerned <s> You 've probably guessed where this is going and it is headed in a direction in which the subject matter will revolve around the finest most expensive eating establishments in Britain avoiding the clichÈ that is the 'world is most expensive ' and instead opting for the lower-key 'just in Britain ' subtitle so maybe you 'll want to bear these in mind next time you 're booking any flights to London <s> There are no diamonds in food gemstones on cutlery-related shenanigans here for these places are expensive because well they just ARE <s> London Restaurant Gordon Ramsay Also one of the single most expensive restaurants in the world this place can set you back at least <date> for a single person and that is just selecting from the average stuff <s> If you were to opt for more exquisite dishes and then a bottle or wine or so well then you 're looking at a hefty price-tag indeed A favorite amongst locals and tourists alike provided that can afford it of course the restaurant itself is known for serving up the most palate-pleasing dishes in the whole of England is fine capital city <s> Typical delights on offer might include Cornish lamb pork belly and the finest Angus beef all mixed in with a wide range of other fine accoutrements <s> By the time you were done with this place you 'd certainly be in a better position to understand the reason behind the three Michelin Stars that have been awarded to it <s> However your wallet might not be Berkshire Waterside Inn Put on the proverbial map thanks to fantastic food a three-star Michelin chef in the form of owner Michel Roux and a 24 plum soufflÈ that made it onto the Forbes list of the world is most expensive desserts it came tenth the Waterside Inn is not only a dive into opulence but also a dive into quality as those stars aren 't awards to just anyone that comes along <s> With 'Inn ' in the title you 'd be correct in suspecting that the building housing the restaurant also serves as a place where you can for a modest sum spend a few nights <s> The restaurant is chefs serve the whole gamut of dishes you 'd expect lobster rabbit lamb duck turbot and many others each served as decadently and in an adept a fashion as you 'd imagine <s> Truly an experience for the rich in taste as well as the rich in wealth as you will most likely be set back around <date> for a two-course meal <s> London Sketch Back to the nation is capital again for meals that again breach the <date> mark <s> Sketch has long been touted as an incredibly expensive place to eat hence the gaggle of celebrities and other people of note that occasionally dine at the establishment <s> However the price doesn 't belie the quality and instead is more of an indication of it what with the restaurant itself being a product of Algerian restaurateur Mourad Mazouz and celebrated French chef Pierre Gagnaire you can rest assured that the place will contain blogspot com 3mm <date> m2ndy On Tuesday night we went to see the Garrick Theatre production of Douglas Carter Beane is The Little Dog Laughed <s> The Little Dog Laughed is about a rising Hollywood star Mitchell Rupert Friend who in the words of his agent isuffers from a slight recurring case of homosexuality ' <date> He meets rent boy Alex Harry Lloyd and their lives are turned somewhat upside down when they both fall for each other despite both asserting that they are not gay <date> The play is set against the backdrop of Hollywood and homosexuality and explores all of the double standards and difficulties with coming out in show business <date> There is a fantastic quote by Colin Firth in the programme which just about sums it up 'If you 're a straight actor who takes on the role of a gay man it is obviously not the same as being one in this business ' <s> The Little Dog Laughed was written by Douglas Carter Beane who also wrote To Wong Foo Thanks for Everything Julie Newmar a <date> film starring Patrick Swayze and Wesley Snapes <date> It first opened off-Broadway at the Second Stage Theatre in <date> <date> The play is narrated by Mitchell is morally challenged agent Diane played by Tamsin Greig who has such classic lines as quot A writer with the final cut I 'd rather give firearms to small children ' <date> It is no secret really that I am a massive fan of Harry Lloyd and have spent the past three years watching each and every one of his plays but it is Greig who absolutely steals the show and her acting wardrobe and personality all fit the role perfectly <date> In her role as Diane Greig superbly breaks through the fourth wall allowing the audience into the world of Hollywood agents actors and writers and she did it very well indeed <date> She was incredibly comfortable chatting and winking to the audience one minute and then diving right back into her encounters with the rest of the cast the next <s> Rupert Friend plays the drunken privileged and somewhat sheltered Mitchell really well <date> While I tend not to question how characters were written as it is generally a fixed factor when putting on a play I have to wonder at a rising Hollywood star who doesn 't get the significance of coming out to the world and the effect that could have on his career <date> In the end his naivetÈ is what trips him up though <s> In an equal sense Harry Lloyd is Alex just doesn 't seem to understand the dynamic of his relationship with his girl pal Ellen played by Gemma Arterton and the effect that his growing relationship with Mitchell will have on her <date> He does however utter my favourite line of the play while trying to get a point across to Mitchell 'God talking to you is like sewing a button on cottage cheese ' <s> As far as rather shallow clueless roles go Friend and Lloyd do as well as they can do but they have both taken on much better roles in the past <date> The one thing they do both handle extremely well is the intimacy and affection that develops between their two characters <date> There is a fair bit of nudity in the play with Harry Lloyd being fully nude at one point and both actors were professional and convincing in their roles <s> Gemma Arterton was far less convincing and you got the idea that she was trying to inflate her supporting role somewhat as the character definitely shrinks in comparison to the other three <date> She seemed to posture a lot and to shout her lines rather than speak them with meaning and emotion <date> She is quite inexperienced in theatre though and this certainly didn 't ruin the play <date> You have to wonder though if those in casting didn 't foresee that she would be completely overshadowed by Greig or perhaps that was the point This production of The Little Dog Laughed was directed by Jamie Lloyd and I must say he made good use of the space and actors <date> There is one invisible character so to speak who appears in one scene and speaks on the phone but is not played by anyone <date> I thought this was really well portrayed by the cast and well managed by the director <s> The set was designed by Soutra Gilmour who received an Olivier Award nomination for Best Set Design in <date> <date> While Gilmour is sets are often dark and almost sinister this was stark bare and completely white but the minimalist set worked in this play <date> The play itself is incredibly funny and highly entertaining <date> It doesn 't provide any grand answers to the problems it identifies but seems to focus more on the situation at hand and how that plays out <date> The audience was laughing along raucously at the numerous one-liners and there was much enthusiastic clapping and cheers of 'bravo ' at the end <date> All in all it was a fun night out and I 'd certainly recommend the play for people seeking a light-hearted comedy experience <s> The Little Dog Laughed is playing at the Garrick Theatre until 10 April <date> <date> There are really good prices available on tickets at <weirdcaps> com and we got tickets for <date> each from <weirdcaps> com <s> Watch The Little Dog Laughed trailer If you are reading this anywhere besides Emm in London or in an RSS reader then the content is stolen <s> Please report stolen content to missus emm gmail com Copyright <date> Missus Emm http missus-emm blogspot com 3mm <date> m2ndy NME is the biggest alternative music publication in the UK <date> Each year they showcase some of the biggest up and coming indie alternative bands in the run up to the NME Awards <date> This year The Maccabees Bombay Bicycle Club The Big Pink and The Drums hit the road on a nationwide tour and I caught them at The Brixton Academy in London <s> The Drums The Drums are a post-punk band hailing from Brooklyn New York and it is likely that you would recognise their song 'Let is Go Surfing ' <date> They are currently on a sold out tour of UK Ireland and mainland Europe and will be supporting Florence and the Machine on their nationwide tour starting in May <s> The Drums have a sound reminiscent of the punk and ska bands of the early eighties but I found them to be pretty average and unoriginal <s> I had not even heard of them before the night but certainly won 't be rushing off to buy any of their albums <date> Most importantly I have never seen a bunch of people look so uncomfortable on a stage before <date> I 've seen cheesy robotic dancing before and singers playing air drums but it is clear that The Drums have a long way to go as a band before they make that look cool <date> The Big Pink The Big Pink are the reason we went to the Shockwaves NME Awards Tour this year and it is safe to say that I am a massive fan of their album A Brief History of Love which I reviewed on <weirdcaps> in January <date> The Big Pink arrived on stage with lights and explosions and their whole set was energetic frenetic and loud <date> Their songs were much heavier than they had sounded on their CD and it was a manic mash up of squealing guitars and noise <s> I imagine that this signals a heavier direction for their new album but it could also be overcompensation for the fact that most of their music is pre-recorded and sampled <date> That meant that vocalist Robbie Furze was screaming his vocals and grinding his guitar while we debated amongst ourselves whether the bassist and drummer weren 't in fact miming <date> I am always happy for indie alternative bands to take on a heavier louder sound in fact the noisier the better as far as I am concerned <date> But this was not a great performance <date> I 've seen many bands that use heavy sampling including The Prodigy Dan le Sac vs Scroobius Pip and Faithless and it is so difficult to put on a great show in front of a massive audience when the majority of your band members are doing little on the actual night but miming <date> The Big Pink didn 't really get it right on Saturday night <s> Bombay Bicycle Club Bombay Bicycle Club hail from north London and took their name from a string of curry restaurants in the area <date> I have no idea what I expected from them before I heard them play on Saturday night as I had barely even heard of them but wasn 't in the least bit interested in listening to any of their music <s> I certainly didn 't expect to have them rock my socks off <date> Seconds into their first song I found myself debating whether to rush off to the shops the next day or order their album through Amazon <date> Thankfully such debates were soon put out of my mind as I got caught up in their energetic enthusiastic set <date> The one thing they did prove was that the problems with the previous two acts weren 't down to bad acoustics in the venue because their whole sound and lights show was fabulous <date> Jack Steadman has a fantastically unique voice and the band are confident and exciting on stage <date> Oh and they can dance <date> Perhaps the guys from The Drum need to take some dancing lessons from them <date> The crowd went mad for them and I would have to say that Bombay Bicycle Club were the best band of the night <date> It is not often that I am won over to unknown bands during a live performance but they were that good <s> The Maccabees The Maccabees played a massive fifteen song set on Saturday night and gave one of the most impressive live performances I have seen in years <date> The Maccabees are from south London but are currently based in London <date> They have five full time members but their incredible show included three musicians on brass instruments and at one stage Edwyn Collins joined them to sing 'Rip It <smiley> ' <date> The Maccabees use the whole stage and everything from their backdrop to their set up and lighting is absolutely professional and first class <date> I honestly found myself widening my eyes to try drink everything in <date> Like with Bombay Bicycle Club the sound was perfect and the crowd went absolutely mad for The Maccabees <date> They didn 't quite have the impact on me that Bombay Bicycle Club did but that is not to say that they weren 't brilliant <date> They were really good and I 'd definitely go see them again sometime <s> After a rocky start the <weirdcaps> NME Awards Tour <date> was a huge success and Bombay Bicycle Club and The Maccabees certainly made up for a slightly shaky start <date> The best thing about the O2 Brixton Academy of course is that after the show we were able to nip into Nandos for some chicken burgers thus avoiding the British tradition of the post-night out dodgy vindaloo <s> If you are reading this anywhere besides Emm in London or in an RSS reader then the content is stolen <s> Please report stolen content to missus emm gmail com Copyright <date> Missus Emm http missus-emm blogspot
