<s> I started digging my wallet for the extra quarter and he seemed to sense that I wanted a bag for my lonely little OJ and I told him that no I didn 't need one <s> I fished out the quarter and laid it on the counter as he handed me the OJ and smiled warmly <s> As I walked away I felt filled with an unexpected joy and contentment <s> In that moment I felt the city wrap around me for the first time in a while protectively cu 'ling me from all sides <s> I looked around and saw the New York I had first seen in <date> that energy that life that art pulsing through everything <s> No matter how many chain coffee houses there are or how much money gets poured into meaningless capitalistic pursuits in this city there will always be that feeling of endless possibility that freedom like if you just believe in it and want it bad enough you can literally be anything you want <s> That feeling that uniquely New York feeling is something that everyone who ever came to New York to pursue a dream has experienced and can speak to whether it was in the 60s 70s 80s 90s or beyond and as I walked the block to my office from the coffee cart - which by the way was set up right across the street from a Starbucks - I felt it pressing on me in the most comforting way <s> Despite everything I 've been through and all the uncertainty that continues to face me I heard the city telling me it is going to be OK and I believed it <s> I put my hands in the pockets of my trench coat smiled to myself and walked on 
<s> We are so pleased to announce that our new website is up and running <s> We are officially moving all of our blog activity to our new <repeatedchars> urbansprouts org site <s> Please check it out and bookmark our new page <s> I recently learned from my students that oxalis an invasive and aggressive weed for many San Francisco gardeners is also called sourgrass whose flower stalk can actually be chewed <s> Although oxalis has another beneficial function that is to prevent soil erosion on slopes I can 't help but feel that every time I am up at one of my schools it is a renewed battle between oxalis and gardener <s> Last week I issued a challenge to my students at Ida B <s> Wells to pull out as much oxalis as they could from our two main beds which would be documented as before and after pictures on this blog <s> Although some students went right to work others required much more coaxing many students seem to have an inherent dislike of weeding even if it is just the patch in front of them <s> At the end of class and after three huge piles of oxalis it still looked like we barely made a dent in the ratio of oxalis to vegetables <s> Note to self - next time to prevent oxalis takeovers try mulching early before the rains start <s> Before weeding around the fava beans <s> After weeding one student is work <s> Mulching with straw with my afterschool class <s> I am very excited to bring to you a glimpse of a day in our gardens <s> Thanks to our new Flip cameras you can see Urban Sprouts in action preparing freshly harvested collards into delicious simple gourmet snacks Students at both Martin Luther King mi 'le school and International Studies Academy have gotten excited about sharing their perspective of the garden to the community and each other <s> In the near future I hope to use the Flip camera as a medium of communication between the two schools <s> At Urban Sprouts we want to connect students to local produce whether it is food from the school garden persimmons and lemons from someone is backyard or fresh finds from the farmer is market <s> At Aptos Mi 'le School the lettuce arugula and radish from our school garden were ready to be harvested and tossed into a salad <s> Students washed chopped and combined local fruits and vegetables with a sesame salad dressing and a persimmon vinagrette <s> Although some students were more interested in the cooking than in the eating it was a first step towards creating healthy and colorful dishes using many local ingredients <s> A 'itionally students at Ida B <s> Wells Continuation High School learned how to whip up persimmon ice cream using only five ingredients lemon vanilla sugar buttermilk and persimmons and without a fancy ice cream maker <s> Thank you Ms <s> Bressack for donating the delicious persimmons from your backyard Help grow the school gardens movement We are looking for members to join our Outreach Committee <s> These individuals will work alongside our staff to represent Urban Sprouts at partner school events community fairs farmers markets and other city-wide events <s> Please join us for our first meeting December 8th <date> <date> Hayes St 2nd Floor San Francisco CA <date> Questions or want more information Please contact Audrey at <date> or helpout urbansprouts org We are hosting our first garden work party at our newest site Log Cabin Ranch <s> Come out and - tour the site - help plant our orchard - build new garden beds - lots of other exciting garden activities As the garden is located in La Honda about 45 miles south of San Francisco we will be organizing carpools for all participants <s> We will be contacting those attending by December 10th to arrange rides <s> To RSVP please CLICK HERE Please note this is a San Francisco Juvenile Probation Department Facility and participants in the work day will need to be at least 21 years of age and bring a photo id <s> Pictures from Log Cabin Ranch Last week was a busy week in the gardens worm bins and compost bins dug new beds and completed some general garden work <s> This was a fantastic start to our new composting initiative as we are on track to build new compost bins worm bins Rosie LIFE COMPLETE <s> At the Independent Fashion Bloggers conference at NYFW there was a panel including the Fashionista girls Susie Bubble Phil Oh Bryanboy and myself and we talked about-WAIT FOR IT- the future of fashion blogging Pretty RANDOM topic if you ask me <s> There is a video but I am too afraid to watch it because I probably said some stupid things <s> But If I were to paraphrase I would say we mostly talked about -Discretion when it comes to accepting gifts or freebies -Advice to new bloggers Which mostly came to write about what is interesting to you <s> What works for one blogger doesn 't always work for another and writing about the exact same stuff that a popular blogger writes about will go unnoticed since someone else is already doing the same thing -A blogger is place at Fashion Week -Hey remember when we all decided we were the greatest people ever and that blogs were the new everything Me neither The media likes the story but it ain 't no big thang -We can 't predict the future of fashion blogging <s> The same way no one saw it coming no one knows where it will go <s> The big difference between bloggers and journalists isn 't the fact that we 're using computers <s> I mean Cathy Horyn and Lynn Yaeger have blogs lots of critics write for style com and a number of editors including Hamish Bowles and Andre Leon Talley write blog posts but it is not the same as my having a blog - the difference is experience <s> It is not remarkable that we 're using the internet <punctuationfreak> but what most people are pointing out - with me mostly since this doesn 't apply to the other bloggers that were on the panel - is lack of experience <s> I haven 't gone to journalism school I haven 't had any internships etc <s> And I am 13 which oh my God I can 't tell you how excited I am to outgrow that number <s> This honestly is what I think is the future of fashion blogging or at least part of it <s> The same way teenagers can start a Flickr account and be noticed by a magazine or a band can start a <weirdcaps> and be picked up by a label blogs will act as jumping-off platforms for people that want to work in the industry <s> When I started Style Rookie in March of <date> only <weirdcaps> and teenvogue com would write about blogs <s> It wasn 't a big media thing and having one wasn 't an affiliation for Fashion Week it was a nice circle of ladies and occasional dudes who supported each other and often found themselves saying 'Thank you for this post None of my friends get my feelings about ______ 'Then some of us started taking opportunities that had arisen and I spent some money on a Hussein Chalayan dress and then all of a su 'en it was like <repeatedchars> <s> Which is you know bizarre <s> Allow me to direct you to this epic Dave Eggers essay <s> So now my inbox and comment section are full of 'Can you critique my blog Can you tell me what to do to get invited to shows How do I get my blog recognized in the industry 'which isn 't a bad thing I guess other than the critiquing thing which like it is about you and your thoughts <s> No one is able to tell you what to think or how to explain your thinking to others Now blogging is a full-time job for some people and in some cases a segway into the industry but I guess that is the way it goes <s> And it is sort of a bummer especially because now I am far more aware of the number of people that read my blog and when I take this into consideration when writing a post I feel pressured to sound smarter or fancier when mostly I just enjoy writing journal-like streams of thought my blog has always been a virtual diary even though I am supposed to be writing grand reviews because a newspaper or magazine told whoever to expect that <s> That is a problem with my own outlook though and I still enjoy blogging <s> A lot <s> And thankfully it doesn 't have to be a job for me <s> When it starts to feel like one I 'll stop <s> But I don 't think anyone is saying blogs are the equivalent to magazines or inexperienced bloggers like myself are the equivalent to journalists anyway <s> Still there is nothing wrong with having a range of perspectives <s> I think fashion is important to discuss <s> Which brings me to this recent Isabel Marant quotation 'For me fashion shows are not for the public they are trade shows for the press <s> It is time for the press to understand the collection and then spread the information <s> That is more interesting than just the image <s> Everyone wants to be first <s> It is too too much <s> There should be privacy and mystery <s> There is no excitement about anything anymore as everything is available immediately and all the time you don 't have to wait for anything <s> I don 't like the idea of being flooded with image and information <s> I don 't belong to the generation of spending time on the internet <s> I think it is too fast and too fake <s> It is like going to a museum on the internet where is the pleasure It is sad because everyone is running after everything but after what Everything is too quick <s> There is no room in your heads for all this information <s> No one retains anything ' I think that when it comes to fashion shows being online it is exposure for a brand <s> I think that a customer deserves to see the show and get to know the world of that label <s> I like privacy and mystery too but there is a fine line between that and exclusivity <s> And-TWIST -I also hate the fastness of the Internet And the fakeness I like buying my magazines and zines and having special stuff I can hold in Oldy <weirdcaps> from Oldsville Oldesota <s> And tumblr then will be like xanga now <s> Who knows where fashion blogging will be <s> Point is things are changing 'Classics with a twist 'Retro futurism In fashion all those cliches have been done time and again but I think that Nicolas Ghesquiere is collection for Balenciaga was the only one as of recent to elevate these concepts to a level that was more refined and thoughtful 'Retro futurism 'didn 't mean the Jetsons and 'classics 'didn 't mean camel coats or button-downs <s> They were elements of home-living and domesticity that were brought into the present with what has now become Nicolas <weirdcaps> is signature futurism aesthetic <s> He said his goal was 'to ennoble every day objects 'Mission accomplished <s> Ew that makes me think of evening <s> Unless you read her book of course <s> I finished reading 'My Life in France 'two days ago and the movie 'Julie amp Julia 'just ended on my DVR <s> I wanted to know Julia Child through her own words first so I could test the movie against them or the words she wrote with her beloved husband Paul Child is grand-nephew Alex Prud 'homme 'My Life in France 'was a delightful read <s> It made and 'From Julia Child is Kitchen ' a book Julia calls her 'favorite ' <s> I am still uninterested however in reading the blog-turned-book 'Julie amp Julia 'written by Julie Powell <s> I liked Powell is husband in the movie way more than I liked Powell and I adore Amy Adams <s> I decided to share a few items that I found fascinating from Julia is tale <s> Here is a taste 10 <s> Julia attended Smith College <s> She majored in history and graduated in <date> <s> Her plan after college was to become a famous woman novelist <s> She sought employment at Time Newsweek and The New Yorker and when she didn 't get a job at either magazine she worked in the advertising department at the W amp J <s> Sloane furniture store <s> She made 25 a week 9 <s> Julia met Paul while working for the Office of Strategic Services OSS and 'looking for adventure 'The OSS was an intelligence agency formed during World War II <s> The two met in Ceylon what is now Sri Lanka in <date> both were transferred with the OSS to Kunming China and in September of <date> they were married <s> Paul had a black belt in judo and was a 'physical person 'He was a photographer and 'his pleasure was in the act of creating 'Paul took many of the photographs Julia used to inspire the artwork in her 'Mastering 'cookbook <s> Julia and Paul never got around to sending Christmas cards so instead they sent their family and friends homemade Valentine is Day cards <s> The more ridiculous the better <s> They seemed to be an adorable couple and I hope for that kind of married happiness someday 8 <s> One of Julia and Paul is first meals in France was at Restaurant La Couronne in Rouen the city where St <s> Joan of Arc was burned at the stake <s> Julia described it as 'the most exciting meal 'of her life <s> She feasted on sole meuniere and oysters <s> The restaurant is considered to be the oldest inn in France established just a few years ago in <date> 7 <s> Julia was big on nicknames <s> Her sister Dorothy -- five years her junior -- was nicknamed 'Dort the Wort 'while Julia was called 'Julia Pulia 'and at some times even 'Juke the Puke 'Julia became a very good friend of the legendary James Beard he asked Julia to call him Jim and whenever they cooked together they were known as <weirdcaps> as in Jim and Julie with the letter 'j 'pronounced the French way 6 <s> Julia attended her first cooking class at Le Cordon Bleu with 11 GIs who were istudying cooking under the auspices of the GI Bill of Rights 'She was the star student although she began unable to properly scramble an egg 5 <s> Julia sought a diploma from Le Cordon Bleu so she could teach but she failed the first exam <s> It was made of two parts a written and practical exam <s> She aced the written but didn 't know how to cook a single item on the practical exam <s> It included the following an oeuf mollet a veau 'en surpise 'and caramel custard <s> Her teacher Chef Bugnard insisted that despite this debacle Child was qualified to be a chef <s> She aced the second exam and became a graduate of Le Cordon Bleu 4 <s> On November 6 <date> after more than seven years of collaboration Julia is manuscript for a cookbook co-written with two of her French friends Simone 'Simca 'Beck later Madame Jean Fischbacher and Louisette Bertholle was rejected by the editor-in-chief at Houghton Mifflin for being 'a big expensive cookbook of elaborate information 'that amight well prove formidable to the American housewife <s> She might easily clip one of these recipes out of a magazine but be frightened by the book as a whole '3 <s> The woman who would later be Julia is editor Judith Jones left New York for Paris in <date> at the age of 24 for a three-week vacation got her purse stolen and never left her return ticket was in her purse <s> She was working for Doubleday in New York at the time and ended up getting a job as an editorial assistant to a Doubleday editor in Paris <s> She just so happened to pick up a book her boss was planning to reject urged him to give it a second go and when he did Doubleday bought it and it became a worldwide sensation <s> You may have heard of it 'Ann Frank The Diary of a Young Girl 'A similar situation happened with Julia is manuscript <s> Jones tested several of the recipes realized what an incredible feat it was and insisted to her bosses it be published <s> In May <date> Jones are delicious I REALLY want to find out for myself <kikoo> I had heard of the croque-monsieur sandwich often in the past year or so apparently it is making the rounds in the foodie-blog world since that is where I discover many foods I 'd never heard of before <s> It sounded intriguing something I might want to try one day but nothing to a ' to the MUST MAKE list <s> I mean seriously it is a grilled ham amp cheese sammie <s> No big whoop <s> And then I was going through some magazine last week - for the life of me I can 't remember what it was called - and saw this photo of the most awesome looking sandwich I 'd ever seen <s> It had a fried egg on top I don 't think I 've ever spoke of my obsession fascination complete and utter GLEE when it comes to the fried egg specifically the yolk <s> But there is a twist <s> Yes I love fried eggs for breakfast or dinner with the usual accoutrements - buttered toast sausage or bacon hashbrowns you know heart attack on a plate <smiley> But this obsession - fascination - complete and utter glee that I feel when I see something topped with a friend egg that normally wouldn 't be topped with an egg <s> I just can 't find the words without sounding gross <s> Salivate upon seeing oozing yolk is what it is but frankly I just grossed myself out by saying that <s> Salivate and oozing really shouldn 't be in the same sentence <s> Hopefully you yolk lovers out there will get where I am coming from if not maybe try to block out what you 've just read by closing your eyes tightly and singing LA LA LA LA LA I CAN 'T HEAR YOU MISS GROSS-Y MCGROSSTER extremely loudly until the images go away <smiley> It was the mental vision of a crispy baked sammie loaded with cheese and that broken yolk oozing I can 't stop with the fakkin oozing Someone give me a better word for crissakes - and don 't say 'runny 'cuz that squicks me out too down the side of it that had me in such a tizz hell it could have been a rabbit turd amp peat moss sandwich and I would have been drooling all because of that egg <s> I once saw a salad made of greens roasted sweet potato chunks and a big old fried egg on top and although I haven 't made it YET I still drool over the thought of it <s> A salad with roasted chunks of sweet potato for crissakes All because of that ooz glorious fried egg <s> Anyhoo <s> As I read the intro to the recipe and realized it was a croque-monsieur with a fried egg thrown on top the sandwich jettisoned to the MUST MAKE list tout de suite <s> So I ripped the pages out brought it home to show hubbs and he agreed we needed to have this for dinner ASAP <s> Basically if ya 'll haven 't heard of the croque-monsieur it is ham amp cheese usually gruyËre or emmental between two slices of bread that have been slathered with a bechamel sauce and then more cheese on top <s> It is baked until the edges are lightly browned and the cheese is melty and bubbly <s> Once it comes out of the oven you slap a fried egg on top to create the croque- madame throw a nice salad next to it and call it heaven on a plate <s> I made a few changes to the recipe <s> I couldn 't find the jambon de Paris ham it called for so I used prosciutto <s> I am not a big bechamel sauce by itself kinda gal so I decided to doctor it up by tossing in a couple generous handfuls of gruyËre I still had quite a bit left over from the bread and just the barest peench of ground mustard <s> I used a loaf of French miche which I bought at Panera - miche I assume means fakking huge <s> It is a very large square loaf of French bread just perfect for grilling baking toasting and of course making a croque-madame <smiley> Hubbs made a cucumber tomato olive amp red onion salad in balsamic vinaigrette to go with and I think that is really a must <s> At least for us this sammie is rich kids <s> It definitely needs a salad or other light side with it <s> I had considered frying potatoes amp onions making our dinner more breakfast-like but am glad that I didn 't <s> So who doesn 't like a ham cheese sammie eh I like them they are O <s> K not my favorite but I 've eaten many in my day <s> Who hasn 't Feel about the same way Kinda meh Yeah well make this kicked up hot ham cheese sandwich and I doubt you 'll ever go back to the usual <s> We were both amazed at how good this was <s> Admittedly the prosciutto wasn 't the right ham <s> It was too salty but that still didn 't take away much from the sandwich in whole <s> And it was fun to eat a 'gourmet 'hot ham cheese with a fork knife I suppose you could pick it up and eat it as you would any other sammie but it 'd be kinda messy but hey if that is your thing go for it I urge you all to go out and buy a good ham that is not too salty a big chunk of gruyËre or emmental I am sure Swiss would be just fine and a dozen eggs and get to making this for your dinner this week - and then throw it into your rotation every once in a while <s> It is a bit of a splurge both in price and calories but you won 't be sorry after you take that first bite <s> Trust me <s> SO <s> FAKKIN <s> GOOD <s> Croque Monsieur or Madame Serves 4 For Bechamel sauce 3 TBS butter <math> c all-purpose flour 3 c whole milk I used fat-free and it came out just fine Pinch of freshly grated nutmeg Salt white ground pepper to taste For the sandwiches 8 slices high-quality bread the recipe called for 'Pullman 'loaf I used French sliced <math> to <math> inch thick 12 oz thinly sliced jambon de Paris high quality wet-cured ham not too salty 10 oz <s> GruyËre cheese coarsely grated 4 whole eggs for the madame Over low heat in a small saucepan melt butter then whisk in flour until blended <s> Continue to whisk while pouring in milk to avoid lumps <s> Continue to cook stirring constantly until thickened <s> This should take about 10 minutes If you are only making enough for 2 the sauce thickened within 2 minutes Once thickened season with nutmeg salt pepper This is where I a 'ed a couple handfuls of grated gruyËre and the smallest pinch of ground mustard Take off heat set aside <s> The recipe says you can make the bechamel sauce up to 24 hours early <s> Place plastic wrap directly on the sauce so it won 't form a skin then refrigerate <s> Gently reheat a few minutes before you are going to use it <s> Preheat the oven to <date> ∫ F <s> Place the 8 slices of bread in a single layer on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper <s> Spread the bechamel sauce evenly to the edges of all the slices you may not need all of the bechamel <s> Divide ham between only 4 slices covered with bechamel keeping the ham within <math> inch of the edges <s> Top all 8 slices with equal amounts of grated gruyËre cheese again spreading it evenly within <math> inch of the edges <s> Place the 4 slices with bechamel and cheese cheese side up on top of the slices layered with ham <s> Bake until cheese topping is melted and golden brown about 10 to 15 minutes it took about 20 minutes in my oven To make the croque-madame fry 4 eggs sunny-side up I went with over easy because egg slime is A VERY BAD THING and place one on top of each sandwich <s> Sprinkle with salt pepper and serve immediately <kikoo> Kids I don 't know what the hell has possessed me but I 've baked <s> And not for a Daring Baker is challenge either <s> I baked on my own <s> WTF Here is what I am But the recipe was straightforward thank the baby Jebus <s> The only problems I ran into were bad timing and way too hot oil <s> The timing thing - you need to heat milk to melt the shortening <s> Then you have to wait until it cools to lukewarm because you 'll be mixing it with the water yeast mixture <s> Well the -first- time I did it I started to heat my milk and immediately poured my yeast into the lukewarm water not taking into account that after the milk melts the shortening it 'll take some time for it to cool off enough to a ' it to the yeast <s> Doh You wouldn 't believe how fakkin long it takes for hot milk to cool the fug down <s> Jebus <s> My yeast water mixture had already bubbled and was sitting on the bottom of my very cold metal Kitchenaid bowl <s> If you listened closely enough you could hear their itty bitty teeth chattering and their itsy bitsy knees knockin ' <smiley> I was blowin ' on the milk fanning it with a kitchen towel put it in the fridge for 10 minutes the bottom of the bowl wouldn 't cool off <s> I mean this stuff was HOT <s> So finally we Hubbs was present decided to put the damn bowl out in a snow drift <s> I mean seriously <s> It is not like we were trying to cool off GALLONS of milk it was just a cup or so for crissakes but it wouldn 't cool down <s> And no this had nothing to do with my desire to be eating warm fluffy mouth-wateringly rings of yumminess <s> Much 'kay well maybe it had a lot to do with my impatience over having to wait for the prize but I tell you - that milk was volcano hot <s> Outside it went <smiley> Okay well what are two people to do while waiting on milk to cool They get all caught up in Animal Planet is Puppy Bowl VI is what they do <s> We couldn 't peel our eyes away from the cuteness if we tried <s> OHMYGOD she had been cu 'led under while watching oodles of puppies attacking each other and stuffed footballs <s> That was more exercise than I 've had in weeks <s> GAH <s> As you might have guessed the shortening was no longer liquefied <s> It sat in greasy lumps in the ICE COLD milk <s> Mmm <repeatedchars> <s> Meanwhile my yeast had passed on to the great bread bakery in the sky <s> It was a pitiful scene <s> No bubbles <s> Just murky muck sitting on the bottom of the bowl -sigh- So I cleaned up my lil yeasty dead soldiers put the milk back on the burner until the shortening JUST started to melt <s> Waited 10 minutes and THEN brought yeast and lukewarm water back together again <s> After all of that putting the dough together was a snap <s> The waiting was the hard part at one point I I decided not to panic and to just get out my trusty balloon whisk and start whisking <s> Luckily it all came together again - only now it was almost like peanut fudge which isn 't a bad thing - just something I wouldn 't normally pair with chicken Thanks to the amazing support we receive on the private forums of the Daring Kitchen my question of why it separated was answered by Robert of An Alaskan Cook is Exploration of Food and Technique - and he thought that I had too much heat going on <s> And he was most likely right I did have the heat up pretty high now that I think of it <s> <s> Just as the SNL offshoot Waynes is World brought out Fre 'ie Mercury and Queen freshly remastered for Generation Next to make their own so too does Hotel Chevalier the thirteen minute outtake and or prequel from from Wes Anderson is new movie The Darjeeling Limited bring us back to <date> and Peter Sarstedt is London megahit of that year Where Do You Go To My Lovely with digitized and remastered immediacy Peter Sarstedt was born in Delhi and spent his infancy in Kurseong at the foot of the Himalayas at a tea garden where his father worked and was therefore a real Indian-Anglo-Indian obviously more privileged than the folks depicted in Bow Barracks Forever -- since his parents chose to leave for England in <date> a few years into Independence like other Anglo-Indians who believed the end of the British Empire would bring them harm and left in numbers for Australia and Canada as well as England through the sixties-- but they really were of Indian blood nevertheless <s> Wes Anderson must have learned about this while making The Darjeeling Limited because it was a hi 'en factoid in <date> that would have earned Sarstedt wild fans in India but at the expense of his following in England <s> It only surfaces now when India is on a roll and all that doesn 't matter so much any more but is still not seen on his own web site <s> It is easy to see in these less hairy days that he is Indian and I wonder how acknowledging that will play out <s> In <date> of course I had no idea Peter Sarstedt was Anglo-Indian and would have counted him less hip and more Cliff Richard if I had <s> But I was struck then no doubt like everyone else by his crisp and easy delivery of the franglais back and forth lyrics the clarity evident even through the fuzzy recordings of the day <s> I had no idea who Zizi Jeanmaire was nor how to spell her name nor even for that matter who her husband the great choreographer Roland Petit was but I had heard Sacha Distel is cover of Raindrops Keep Falling on My Head did know that Kar m al-Hussayn Aga Khan IV was gorgeous as well as being the astonishingly wealthy leader of all Shia Muslims that the Dowager Begum Aga Khan always wore saris and last but by no means least that it was as cool to wear Balmain as to keep your Rolling Stones records at a swank a 'ress nothing to do with the Beatles much as one might Le_jeune_homme_et_la_mort I missed the afternoon per- formance at the National Museum of the American Indian but in the evening <s> I saw the most magnificent production of hula I have ever seen <s> speak for themselves <s> Kumu Patrick Makuak ne is such a fabulous presenter as well as a mesmerizing choreographer that he brings the audience right into the show while the show itself plays sensuality thought and feeling with equal command and force <s> Lihau Hannahs and Kellen Paik provided highly evocative live music for the spectacular production with thirty-two magnificently costumed dancers who mixed presentations of traditional legends and tributes with two pieces of piercing satire and several touching graceful modern pieces including two set to Annie Lenox and Cyndi Lauper is most wistful songs a brilliant capture of Peggy Lee is Fever and a somehow heartrending interpretation of Tony Bennet is version of I Left My Heart in San Franscisco with its illustrative gestures for 'little cable cars 'and 'halfway to the stars '-- among other phrases -- casually revealing quite exactly what hula is about <s> A man seated in the row behind me shouted out frantically that he couldn 't see and at least twenty people turned around to shush him pleading with him not to spoil it for everyone so swept up was the audience with the gentle but powerful grace and great wit of the show <s> Antonioni is 'achingly hip 'Blow- <smiley> FASHION SHOOT VERUSCHKA YARDBIRDS JANE BIRKIN TENNIS TRAILER VANESSA REDGRAVE Obits BBC New York Daily News Al Jazeera The Montreal Gazette timesonline Indian Express Telegraph <s> UK Xinhua net Yesterday after dropping off Bear at JFK -- and being totally unaware that the Virgin Atlantic plane she had boarded was slated to stall on the tarmac for four hours waiting for that evening is series of short storms to pass and then take off without most of the food on the menu for passengers on the flight to London--I drove around aimlessly for a while like anyone deprived of their young might and decided to check in at the proudly independent Art Space still known as Galapagos <s> There the twenty-and-now-early-thirty-somethings still milled and jostled partying hard without ever lighting a cigarette because as Director Robert Elmes has correctly sai ' <weirdcaps> have our whole lives to live and that is terribly important 'The reflecting pool at the entrance is limpid and surprising as ever but as Galapagos has prospered it will be moving quite soon from Williamsburg to DUMBO <s> I considered Lillian Godchaux is Solstice VII which was going on inside the storied Back Room and had been described by Lillian herself as 'A night of LSD and Native American freak-out driven folk and SF-based soary acid folk in hither wildering and bewonderment of this great Solstice VII of the New Water Matter Era 'But I was curious about AVAAZ the act scheduled to appear on the Main Stage so I missed Almaden Zachary Cale and Feral Cat <s> Instead I spent the same 7 and one extra on two under- priced drinks at the candle-lit bar especially to watch some of the members of AVAAZ not to be confused with Avaaz org setting up their fast-rising <weirdcaps> <s> T aking in their sleek looks I wondered if they all had gone to MIT and now have day jobs at investment banks-- not that there is anything wrong with that <s> The best version of Sea had just opened down the street when I first saw Galapagos <s> I had gone to N Sixth Street back then entirely because Dave Eggers and <weirdcaps> is held their first and earliest New York events in the now fabled Back Room while they were reinventing fiction and food hilarity and social awareness all at the same time <s> They turned writing into performance art as well -- right there at Galapagos where I recall a gentleman in his nineties telling a tale of death and playground slides to the sound of helpless yet respectfully muffled laughter-- and n ow they need our help getting past their distributor Publisher is Group West is bankruptcy by reason of which they are su 'enly out <date> K in one fell swoop <s> Say it isn 't so <s> They are making a valiant effort with their online sales of all manner of items <weirdcaps> and also with their 'Heartbreaking <weirdcaps> Auction of Staggering Audacity ' <s> I pondered this tale of swinging through the ages by a length of tooth floss and drank two drinks one after another as images of something like starlight played on the blue velvet curtains <s> These were soon drawn back for the laser light show streamed through whirling stencils in many-colored beams by <weirdcaps> and young Pat Miscellane ous bare-chested in chinos and a full dress full length Cheyenne headpiece started rapping through the hai-chai remix that DJ Boo aka Juggaknots and I believe Bollygirl DK also had started up together <s> This was with and sometimes without a duet from-- Samera Reena <s> Then came DJ impala is entr 'acte and she played September Billie Jean Kiss and just a few minutes of the long version of Marvin Gaye is Gotta Give it <smiley> but stopped while people had just started moving to this party-song-to-end-all-party-songs to move on to Patti Labelle is original version of Lady Marmalade <s> How long ago it seems and yet not so far away at all <s> Mean while silhouettes danced on the once again starlit velvet curtains and cellphones flashed as taking pictures became general <s> Then came all-Desi recently schooled Bamboo Shoots who are a really good very special band that somehow brings the lead rhythm and bass guitar plus drums format into the present moment <s> They were reviewed on Sepia Mutiny and played on Conan <s> Strangely it was the Cold War era movie playing on the screen behind them that distracted and because I am not of the three screen generation I spent at least fifteen minutes growing older trying to figure out who was who in black and white in Juliet of the Spirits <s> And then I had to go home while the band played on and go to sleep missing Butterthief and Suspicious Brown <s> The movie is called Evening and if there is only one film that people who think too much and feel quite a lot and like to be slightly but deeply scared should see this summer this is it <s> AL invited me to the Walter Reade Theater preview where Susan Minot and Michael Cunningham showed up after the screening to discuss their experience in co-writing the screenplay adapted from the book with Kent Jones the man with a light touch from the Film Society of Lincoln Center <s> Throughout the screening I wondered about the marvelous filter effects on the dream sequences-- how they came on so wonderfully strong and obvious then tapered off so gradually through the course of the story <s> Were they in the lens or a part of the editing Faces were so closely imaged at the start of the story and with so much particularity that their natural asymmetry led the eye beyond conven- tional judgments about beauty although every actor was stunning by any measure <s> One had to look afresh at already famous faces that then grew familiar very quickly in these new forms <s> The casting is as superb as the cast <s> Of course but of course Glenn Close was Meryl Streep is mother in another life Speaking of measurements Vanessa Redgrave is acting must be measured by the frame not by seconds <s> That is how close up the view becomes in this unsentimental yet touching study of two deaths in played out counterpoint <s> While Redgrave certainly carries it all the others absolutely rise to the occasion <s> Having seen and heard my own grandmother apparently having good time at a fair number of parties on her near-deathbed I found that this tale resonated with me and the telling of it its production seemed to create a convincing experience of the swing between over- whelming wooziness and diamond hard clarity in the course of that personal time travel and that wandering out of body that heralds a slow death <s> Drawing away the big picture of the society that provides the setting for this surprising story is delivered au point as well <s> While the circumstances of the wealthy family seems casually depicted there is an uncanny conveyance of how things are proportioned for the rich <s> The we 'ing is generously informal and correct not ostentatious and the bride is dress is not overly grand <s> This is how it has to be in a summer setting among people who enjoy extreme cleanliness rely on slightly stodgy design established standards of comfort consuming both hand made and manu- factured goods of quality and who take proper care of inherited objects as a matter of course <s> Yet there is also a clear sense of the perilous crowding and living cheek by jowl that imprisons the rich or aristocratic or patrician <s> Their circles must always be suffocatingly small the more so the richer or better-established they are and marriage and even preferred forms of adultery must occur within that small closed circle <s> The comedy of homosexuality in these narrow straits raises its suggestive head several times in the film <s> Sometimes it happens mistakenly as when the mother of the bride happens upon her daughter sharing her we 'ing morning jitters with her college friend and bridesmaid who has crept under the covers <s> Pshaw Sometimes it arises unawares but for real as when that same bride is mother snatches away her son from his partner during a playful jitterbug for a masterfully bone-chilling rhumba purposefully extinguishing any possibility of his attachment to another woman <s> Ouch These people are not incorrectly depicted as being stifled or inhibited though <s> There is nothing in recent film to compare with Glen Close is raw howl over Bu 'y is su 'en young death <s> There is faerie magic in the woods but also there are different ways of seeing and treating a small cliff or those same woods either as the border area between manicured grounds and Vast Unknown Dangerous Nature or simply as perfectly familiar bits of the family is property <s> Playing off the difference in perspectives in a practical joke provides a bit of class-conflict that erupts into rage <s> Alcohol always plays a leading role in Susan Minot is books <s> In making Bu 'y a far more central figure in the film than he is in the book Michael Cunningham ties this story closer to the rest of Susan Minot is work <s> The two writers live four blocks apart in NYC but quite naturally met at a we 'ing in Nairobi soon after SM had recovered the rights to her book after an earlier attempt to turn it into a movie <s> Despite their close collaboration SM said the collaborative process with MC had been like a master class in screenwriting they differed on several points <s> For instance MC believes a book is always a work in progress the print capturing only a moment in the process whereas SM says a printed volume in your hand is a clear indication of completion and enables the writer to let it go <s> MC said that film cannot capture an inner life as well a a book but SM pointed out that one is inner life occurs in images not words <s> But then they spoke of shared delights in the making of the film like watching Meryl Streep and Vanessa Redgrave on a monitor outside the house and being amazed to see them step into character and switch it on discarding their natural selves in a flash <s> They talked about filming at a Newport house of that genre known as a 'cottage 'that belongs to the Cushing family rather than in Maine as in the book which would have proven overwhelmingly expensive to produce <s> They concurred on the problem of turning an entire book into a movie where films are really short stories and the more sympathetic form for adapting a novel into image format is a television series <s> MC spoke fondly of squabbling with cinematographer and director Lajos Koltai over lines about which he had second thoughts but that Koltai wanted to keep <s> SM spoke about about Eileen Atkins having trouble with the cadence of the lines until SM explained that the nurse was Irish <s> They both spoke of Hugh Dancy is out of period long hair and that Lajos Koltai had predicted that critics would be all about his hair <s> We shall see <s> I was walking down 82nd Street day before yesteday late in the afternoon and realized that I had missed this year is Kips Bay Show House which was being dismantled <s> Volunteering there had been one of my favorite 'rites 'of Spring for longer than I care to admit but it is been more than seven years since I turned my attention to another event that raises funds for the Kips Bay Boys and Girls Club <s> The Show House I missed was hosted by the brilliant Janna Bullock and RIGroup <s> This was a very different undertaking from what it once was when I was one of a band of perhaps twenty young women who took turns watching the rooms under the auspices of the original Show House Committee <s> The Committee never changed from year to year but were always there from dawn till dusk in Chanel suits and ropes of pearls fresh as proverbial daisies and well into their seventies-- or so it seemed to me <s> The air was always scented with Rigaud candles and flowers which competed with paint and varnish that was not yet cured <s> There were fads for peonies one year orchids the next and air plants another <s> One had to know what the antiques and paint finishes were to explain them to visitors and and make sure nobody fainted from climbing the stairs as all the terrible things that can happen on elevators weren 't covered in the insurance contracts <s> Once Mrs <s> Mazzola decided to climb to the top and work her way down and had to sit down at the top floor landing which called for procedures reserved for extreme emergencies in terms of the arrangements of those days <s> Luckily a Chinese garden stool came in handy until a proper chair could be brought <s> Climbing the beautiful staircases two and three steps at a time was a special treat for me and the main reason I always went back <s> I was new to New York and missed staircases especially those massive marble ones with low risers in the late eighteenth and early nineteenth century houses of my hometown Calcutta on which one could jump about and play games <s> Between chasing up and down these newer but equally generous staircases I enjoyed the fact that the visitors were colorful international dressed up and wore great shoes <s> My first happy moment of extra responsibility came one year in the first and grandest house which was on 66th Street and belonged at the time to Imelda Marcos who lent it every year for the Show House <s> In the main drawing room situated on the second floor as in a piano nobile Robert Metzger had set up an early multi-channel music system around the edges of the room which featured a lush over-the-top eighties version of period decor with plenty of silk damask and passementerie the console being cleverly tucked away iirc in cabinet with Boulle marquetry or similar <s> I was required to stand by a massive flower arrangement on a round table in the center of the room under a magnificent Russian chandelier smile at visitors and explain the rug and I noticed that both speakers deployed to the west were playing the same channel as were the ones to the east <s> To my enormous delight RM allowed me to pull out the console after the House closed for the day fi 'le with the wiring and fix it <s> That would never be done today as the firms who do the sound would first of all never make that kind of mistake and the House would certainly never allow a volunteer to touch the wiring <s> A few years later at the first Show House at <date> Park also the last chaired by the legendary Rella <weirdcaps> I got to be her right hand gal at the entrance where she handled tickets herself every day transforming that job into a subtle performance that required her great wit <s> That year the pantry with its green-shaded light big silver safe and humongous ancient icebox was just cleaned up because the idea was still only to present a decorated house and the pantry was a perfect relic <s> One day during that run Mrs <s> <weirdcaps> was hurrying to the Show House when a bag lady as we called them then stopped her to ask for help <s> Rella being as warm-hearted as she was elegant asked what she could do for her <s> The bag lady sai ' <weirdcaps> you hold up this mirror for me 'and while Rella did that the bag lady rummaged about her shopping bag drew out and carefully put on a set of big false lashes <s> The house at <date> Park is one room deep but quite wide with a long long Park Avenue facade and commensurate taxes so it stayed on the market for a long time to become the default Show House for Kips Bay and other causes for some years <s> Thierry DËspont created a memorable decor in the paneled room there but I can 't remember whether it was for Kips Bay or the American Hospital in Paris <s> Although pictures of rooms from recent years are available online now rooms that came before live only in one is memories and in the old journals-- a stack of which were lost to me in a heist upstate in which I lost about a thousand books as well <s> What remains in my head Mark Hampton is cream white and sisal drawing room on 66th Street with the bureau plat placed like a sofa table in which all the fine Georgian mahogany became beautifully abstracted The grand yet hilarious dining room that Ruben de Saavedra created at 62nd Street where the fabric hung walls were drawn aside at mirrored intervals for busts of laughing moors to peek out Richard Ridge is almost completely lavender bedroom which a band of his friends left in a group all crying out 'Nurse ' the narrow room at 1 East 94th Street that J <s> Allen Murphy dressed in yellow and Benarasi gold brocade including an unraveled paghri as a pelmet hung with Mughal lanterns which he dedicated to the Raj Mata of Jaipur <s> She came to look and I was embarrassed to see her at Doubles while I was still wearing a dress from volunteering so un-Indian and deeply frowned upon then though pants were fine Richard Ridge is dining room in which the Romney had been cleaned to within a micron of its life the large bedroom that John Saladino turned into a frescoed bathroom with a brass punkhah so insulted was he not to have gotten a drawing room according to my friend who used to work for him <s> Recent memorable rooms include Odile de Schietere is Venetian drawing room with furniture from FerriËres Michael Simon is dix-huitiËme in black the cleanest stable in creation by Andrew Tedesco Larry Laslo is black bedroom where the black Baccarat chandelier made its New York dÈbut <s> Diantha Nype was another reason I was there <s> Diantha had left Bryn Mawr to get married which is like leaving Hogwarts to become a muggle but then she out-Mawr-ed everybody by inventing the Show House-- it really was her idea to start with although this will remain forever unsung because it is totally not the credo to claim this kind of credit considering how many other people have worked long and hard to make it happen <s> Nevertheless start it she did and so all show houses that exist sprouting across the nation every spring and fall -- to Diantha we owe this most excellent concept <s> Of all the original Committee it was she who was always second in command to Rella she who a 'ressed the robbery and she who created the public image of the Show House as it is was and ever shall be <s> Anyway having missed the new Show House and missing the brio of the old days it was a very happy touch of deja vue to see what Matthew Sudock of M Design has done at David Burke Donatella where I met C for lunch <s> The mix of Hicks in carpet and screens with creamy walls plain mirrors backlit red dry arrangement large and loopy chandeliers cheery cherry leather seating and gigantic bouquets of red-and white striped trumpet lilies all scaled for a nice tall New York brownstone reminded me of the panache the hint of improv and inventive flair of the old days <s> The food is great and playful too and the tuna and salmon tartare not to be missed English-speaking people who are deaf to aspirates and aspirated consonants in Indian languages can 't say ghee and tend to produce incorrect spellings like Ghandi and Dehli <s> Because of this speech impediment the word sipahi meaning soldier in Persian and Urdu became sepoy for the British who gave this misheard word currency by giving the Indian uprising of <date> against themselves a misleading nickname --The Sepoy Mutiny <s> The Uprising involved not only huge numbers of mercenary Indian soldiers under British pay and command but also Indian princes their subjects of various classes their armies and camp followers the peasantry of those parts of the Gangetic plain then under direct British control tribal peoples of the Himalayan foothills and Northern plains and motley others <s> By simplifying the facts the spin machine of the British Empire was able to promote the idea nearly unimpeded for well over a hundred years that it was all a matter of animal grease beef and pork tallow needed to insert rounds into Enfield rifles <s> How this single matter was supposed to have offended both Hindus and Muslims so much as to give rise to the events of a whole year in which Indian soldiers and civilians massacred British men women and children burned down their dwellings and destroyed key installations of the colonial administration is quite a mystery <s> Apparently at that time in England a popular supple- mentary explanation for the Uprising was that everybody in India was completely enraged at having to learn to behave themselves under the wonders of British rule-- much the way we are told today that <date> happened because an unspecified 'they 'were 'jealous of our freedoms ' e g see how it seemed to the Metcalfe family William Dalrymple is the first British historian to use material in translation from numerous sources written in Persian and Urdu and among the first to use the palace and city records now stored in the National Archives As a writer of popular histories he has a tough row to hoe in terms of publicizing his perceptions and findings novel and dangerous to some and not radically different enough for others <s> Still signing away on his book tour I suppose he is more inclined to discuss the hard causes of the Uprising during interviews than in this book <s> With respect to softer causes like Evangelism which he positions centrally he doesn 't indulge in overkill to make a point but sometimes confuses anger with fear and takes at face value what he could examine a bit more critically <s> Animal grease and surging Evangelism were no doubt the last straw but only because the orders to use them could not have been perceived as a simple misunderstanding after a century of many kinds of deliberate and outrageous British assaults on Indian culture property laws and human rights <s> About this a variety of Indian and foreign-born people had already reached consensus many times sometimes long before <date> <s> Those harsher provocations are not discussed in The Last Mughal which focuses on events in Delhi which was at that time still a grand and antique city in a state of preservation home to an exquisite culture <s> One hopes <smiley> is saving the tougher subject matter of how to assign responsibility for the background of the cataclysmic events of <date> for another book <s> As it is he has already told The Hindu that this book has made him more friends in India than in England <s> KASHMIRI GATE IN <date> The book is cause for celebration <s> The thinking is sensitive the language is fluid and rich <s> It conveys the excitement of breaking new ground and the pictures and line drawings at the start of each chapter are delightful <s> The two new maps parading as old ones in which Metcalfe House seems to dwarf the Imperial Palace Hindus seem to live east of the Ganges and <date> looks like the 16th century are very silly but one can 't let that get in the way <s> The British sources tend towards diaries and letters and produce an up-close-and-personal effect while the Persian and Urdu source material is more often drawn from professional writing of various kinds so it generates a more public voice and panoramic view <s> Going back and forth between the two sides of the narrative I felt as if I was walking up and down a seesaw faster and faster back and forth until the final British-led bloodbath led onto the slow grim comedy of the denouement <s> As a child I always wondered about the the strange reek inside the Mughal tombs of Delhi something like ancient bird droppings which was missing at the Taj Mahal <s> I 'd been told that these crumbly dark and elegant monuments belonged to the 16th and 17th KHOONI DARWAZA WHERE THREE SENIOR PRINCES WERE STRIPPED SHOT AND THEIR BODIES ROBBED OF JEWELRY by MAJOR WILLIAM HODSON centuries and never thought about that again <s> Now this book has brought home to me how recent was their ruin how active the scent of death and decay that hangs about them still that many of them were family mausoleums and that my great-grandfathers had already been born before a long gruesome seige and a grisly genocide was carried out in those environs in broad daylight <s> I remember the vultures were still all over Delhi more than a century later <s> <smiley> is recent article in The Guardian explores similarities between British thinking in <date> and widespread present perceptions in the West about the Iraq War <s> From some perspectives the similarities are obvious and striking from others the similarities are not fully admissible <s> It is certainly alarming to find that the mainstream press has reactivated the very same language last used by the British in <date> to describe the Uprising <math> to describe THE IRAQ WAR TODAY <s> It is disheartening to see that in the post-colonial world complications and spiraling violence can still be as easily provoked and fed upon by occupying forces playing on internecine rivalries <s> It is unpleasant to remember that the Bush Administration claimed to have received their intelligence about WMD from British sources <s> It is strange to see Queen Elizabeth who last visited Washington to bestow an award on George Bush Sr for planning and executing the first Gulf War now returning to reinforce the military alliance <s> Meanwhile Tony Blair who should probably given the current scheme of things be tried by a kangaroo court and hung up to dry is being sent off on an international farewell tour instead <s> One must wonder are her private assets not yet suitably diversified KASHMIRI GATE I appreciate and enjoy The Last Mughal for the depth and decency and richness of its narrative and will read it many times but I don 't see the point of setting out a new and elaborate defense to counter the British allegations of <date> years ago <s> The British position developed to justify deposing the monarch was that Bahadur Shah Zafar was singularly responsible for fomenting a pan-Islamic rebellion against the British stretching from West Asia across India <s> Although Sa 'am Husein might not have been plotting anything like that either to draw any similarities by implication and suggestion is to stretch facts to fit the polemic <s> The question that goes unanswered is did the British deserve it then and have we and anyone else done anything to deserve it now There is no question that the movements of <date> included Muslim jihadis as did others that came before in the multitude of violent eruptions that represented efforts to rid the Subcontinent of the British occupation <s> Surely the more important point is that these populist pan-Indian movements brought about consensus across religious and cultural lines about British wrongdoing and eventually gave birth to cooperative sustained resistance rather than belonging to or advocating for any religion <s> Today is popular resistances in West Asia carry forward a different set of historical grievances and cultural motifs although they may one day coalesce and draw a motley set of movements together so that even Sunni and Shia will come to terms <s> <smiley> either avoids or misses a key opportunity to emphasize the crossover nature of the Uprising When the sipahis call Zafar 'Prithviraj ' <smiley> offers a literal translation i e Ruler of the World <s> If this had been their intention the sipahis might have called him Shah Jehan IV <s> Zafar was more Rajput than Timurid by blood though he was also considered a Sufi pir so the the sepahis were more likely referring to the heroic and legendary 12th Century Rajput emperor Prithviraj Chauhan <repeatedchars> the last Hindu monarch to be seated at Delhi <s> But of course at 82 years of age though he might be the rightful emperor Zafar could be no Prithviraj <s> <smiley> suggests that if Zafar had led the charge to defend Delhi while the defense was on an upswing he might have reversed the course of history <s> But at that point in the book <smiley> has already established that the aged cultural and spiritual leader was far too physically feeble to do anything of the kind <s> Except the occasional nut job most European monarchs were by then pretty far distanced from being military leaders and e

<s> well many of you know the battle that is waged in the gotch household almost every day jen vs andrew in THE BATTLE OF SOUP dah dah dah <repeatedchars> it has been a losing battle on my end for about 4 years running you know how he has his list of foods he hates wet meat pulpy juice cherries pickles and on and on well soup always seems to find it is way to the top of the list this is a problem for me since i am a soup lover i love to eat soup i love to make soup and when i feel that first bit of cold in the autumn air which in l a means when it drops below 70 degrees i want soup and yesterday for some o ' reason he agreed to a pot of soup i think it is mostly because i told him it had peanut butter in it and peanut butter is at the top of his 'foods i love 'list right after hamburgers so after a short trip to the market some chopping of vegetables and warming of bread soup was served and it was good real real good andrew ate every last drop only quizzing me a few times about the ingredients i was reluctant to tell him there was salsa in it because he doesn 't like cooked tomatoes or tomato soup it didn 't seem to phase him he even ate the garbanzo beans and he hates beans except green beans later that night when the truth was rising to the surface he confided in me that next time he could do without the beans i reminded him that he loves humus but that was not enough 'it is a texture thing not a taste thing 'he calmly replied either way i feel like some progress was made here last night there is even talk of more soup next week i 'll keep you posted here is the recipe if you are interested

working with Creative Therapy <s> IT has been related to me O happy King said Shahrazad that there was a certain merchant who had great wealth and traded extensively with surrounding countries and one day he mounted his horse and journeyed to a neighbouring country to collect what was due to him and the heat oppressing him he sat under a tree in a garden and put his hand into his sa 'le-bag and ate a morsel of bread and a date which were among his provisions <s> I didn 't know I would ever be able to tell about it but it really looked like one thousand and one nights 
<s> Whatcha got cookin ' Al the Retired Army Guy is a reader of this here blog and a student at the New England Culinary Institute <s> Here is a quickie blog on of one of his latest projects <s> From Al Here are a few pictures of a display platter my classmates and I worked on <s> If you 're wondering why everything appears shiny it is because all of the food is coated in aspic gelatin to give the food a shine for display purposes only <s> It isn 't meant for consumption though you could eat it if you wanted to <s> I wouldn 't mainly due to the gelatin <s> Without the gelatin though-- - In the pictures you will find a terrine a liver pate and a duck galantine as well as two vegetable garnishes <s> There is also a beet pickled onion salad with an orange vinaigrette you can 't really see the vinaigrette <s> The single plate represents a single serving of the components contained in the platter <s> It took us about six hours to put five coats of aspic on every individual piece <s> The vegetables were individually carved and placed as well <s> I did the 'pointy ' rutabaga bases you see as well as the chioggia beets the purple ones carved into fleurons or a crescent shape <s> I did the orange white squares you see inside the circular garnish on the right side of the platter <s> The terrine galantine and liver pate were made for us by classmates and our instructor <s> Overall it was a lot of fun <s> All the attention to detail I learned while in the Army definitely pays off while doing things like this - - - Looks good Al <s> Now whydontcha come over here and wrangle up something for dinner - - - Thirteen years ago I pulled a novel from a bin at the library is used book sale and paid one dollar for it <s> Sapphire is Push immediately engaged me and I didn 't put it down until I 'd reached the last page <s> The book takes stylistic risks with Precious Jones narrating her own story in a phonetically realistic voice <s> She is poorly dressed and obese the sort of person many of us pass on the street and never see <s> Therein lies the brilliance of the novel <s> Push puts Claireece Precious Jones and her harrowing life squarely in front of the reader <s> If this was difficult and compelling to watch unfold on the page the trailer for the movie Precious indicated it would be stunning on the screen as well <s> After much consideration I decided to take my <math> year-old daughter to see Precious 'I was really rooting for Precious 'I said as we talked about the movie on the way home 'Me too isaid Jessie <s> I was bowled over by Gabourey Sidibe is portrayal of Precious <s> If possible she realized Sapphire is vision with near perfection--as someone who is so easy to dismiss until you really see her <s> Then she is impossible not to embrace <s> To be honest I had some literary quibbles with the novel but my respect for the risks it took overwhelmed them <s> The film has received raves as well as scathing criticism for being 'a strange combination of liberal guilt and condescension 'which is a point well taken <s> I apologize that I cannot find the link now but one of the reviews I read took issue with Precious is weight saying something to the effect of must she be so fat that her face is distorted Then darling Howard Stern chimed in last week with his obnoxious comments about Sidibe <s> I was infuriated by this stupidity <s> Don 't these morons realize that the driving force of Precious is a main character who is the antithesis of Gwyneth Paltrow and Reese Witherspoon Her physical size is symbolic <s> It is one of the reasons she will not be denied <s> Whether you 're on the pick or pan side of the reviews that ambition deserves respect <s> As for Sidibe I think you 're beautiful Gabourey <s> Now go bury the likes of Stern with a long and illustrious career - - - I apologize in advance for this but some things just have to be gotten through <s> See what I mean Now for a random list of observations 1 <s> No small task keeping the cleft of venus off screen in that footage <s> Kudos to filmmaker Gary He 2 <s> Those crystals aren 't going to be very jazzly after <weirdcaps> and <weirdcaps> have a few rolls be 4 <s> I 've always liked Jennifer Love Hewitt <s> She is not A-list or B-list <s> She is your A- B list and I can get behind that <s> Hence you can imagine my reaction when she goes on George Lopez and announces she is had some spa-person glue beads around her zorch <s> Who does that 5 <s> Regarding this exciting new phenomenon my bud Steven Gould had this to say 'I am still a guy who prefers hair uh hairy uh you know <s> Vahaired 'I think he is onto something with 'Vahaired 'With all this new shit coming down the pike we 're going to need titles categories--the whole drill 6 <s> I wonder if there are guys out there with beads stuck around their peckers <s> I wouldn 't ever want to see any dickazzled or ballazzled anything <s> Nope regular big hairy guys with beer for me Did you notice how I got right behind Steven on the New Age vocabulary job I am cool like that 7 <s> I bet Snooki is jazzled in places Jennifer Love Hewitt can 't even imagine 8 <s> You 've probably noticed by now I am avoiding the word 'vajazzled 'It makes me nervous <s> A word like that lands in your life and boy are you stuck with it <s> I don 't like ultimatums so I deal with this sort of thing in my own way <s> Hence this post 9 <s> I refer to my own pudendum as Glorious Steinem - - - 'I can 't think of anything that I liked in my twenties that I would want tattooed on my body now <s> Okay maybe chicken Parmesan but that would take up too much space 'Now go read the rest of my good bu 'y Paul Ita is latest essay for masslive My Horrible Tattoo A Cautionary Tale for America is Young People - - - The above word cloud is courtesy of Wordle <s> I cannot get enough of that silly gadget <s> To have your work instantaneously analyzed and transformed into a piece of literary artwork is like masturbation for writers <s> After Alex Pruteanu introduced me to it yesterday I fooled around Wordling this blog old articles even my writing bio <s> The source text for today is Wordle cloud was lifted from an article wherein I recount a professional 'girlie 'photo session which explains the photo on the left yes that is your humble hostess <s> You can read the full text of the article here - - - Fifty degrees and sunny <s> THE CABIN-FEVER CRAZED O 'BRIEN CAN FINALLY WALK OUTSIDE despite all the blasted snowdrifts <s> Riunite Lambrusco anyone Above the bar at Cleve-o mega hot spot Melt <s> The Goat bought a new <weirdcaps> <s> Yay Goat The old <weirdcaps> looked sad when we left it at the dealer <s> Boohoo and bye-bye old <weirdcaps> <s> Indian spirit money house blessing rainbow incense sticks--only six for a dollar at the discount grocery <s> Man-o-man my luck never ends <s> Sorry ghost of George Carlin <s> Come-hither bra display at the low grade closeout store 'Honey springtime is high time for a new toilet '- - - A post chock full of writing tips for all the young writers who contact me with questions about this crazy business and craft <s> Last updated <date> - - - Start local and small <s> My first paid bit of writing was for Ohio Writer <s> For my <date> word book review of Judith Hemschemeyer is The Harvest I was paid the royal sum of 10 <s> That was in June of <date> you can see how the next ten years unfolded for me here <s> Building a professional writing portfolio and the associated career takes time and it sprouts from humble beginnings <s> If I were starting out today I 'd probably fish around for casual blogs associated with professional publications <s> Many daily and weekly print papers have online blogs that might not pay much but would be an excellent place to earn a link and a bonafide publishing credential <s> Who knows If an editor likes your style it might lead to something more serious and lucrative <s> Bonus tip Leave a few comments on a blog under your real name that you might like to write for before querying the editor with your idea <s> Small local papers are often looking for writers to cover things like school board meetings and local government <s> These usually are paying gigs <s> I spent five years doing that sort of thing for The Broadview Journal <s> That stint earned me experience street smarts clips a bit of local notoriety and a steady paycheck <s> Get involved with a local literary or publishing organization <s> Here in Cleveland we have The Lit Cleveland Digital Publishing Users Group CDPUG and the Cleveland Society of Professional Journalists <s> These types of organizations host all sorts of events parties and classes where you will meet professional writers and editors <s> If you want to be one of these people you have to support what they do <s> That means buying their books paying the club fees and having a genuine interest in their community <s> It means learning from them in an organic sense <s> This is perhaps the most important piece of advice I can offer a new writer <s> I am sure there are plenty of online sources as well <s> Many professional journalists I know are members of Freelance Success for example <s> Go to the library <s> There you will find droves of books dedicated to publishing and writing advice <s> Librarians are wonderful and can always make good suggestions <s> In my home library I have a shelf full of Writer is Market editions <s> Two other good books to start with are The First Five Pages and The Elements of Style <s> Mind your manners in a cold contact <s> Don 't ask established writers for big favors <s> Never send them unsolicited writing to critique <s> Also don 't ask a writer to do your work for you <s> Finding the right publications to query is hard work <s> The question 'Where can I publish this 'is almost never appropriate <s> Get online and start researching for yourself or go find a copy of the LMP <s> Follow guidelines <s> When you 're ready to submit follow the guidelines on the agent is or publisher is site <s> If there are none a one-page query is your best bet <s> NEVER use cutesy fonts or graphics or anything that discredits your professionalism <s> Get tough <s> The more successful a writer is the more rejection they 've faced because they toughed it out and lived to submit another day <s> If you want to achieve success you will get kicked <s> Hard <s> And repeatedly <s> When you get a rejection send out another query the same day <s> It will help you keep your game face on <s> Sometimes you have to resort to Plan B and rethink your approach or your project but giving up gets you no where <s> Your submission or query will likely get rejected again and again--until the one day when it gets accepted <s> Be warned there is a growing trend in the publication industry wherein the powers that be simply do not respond to submissions that don 't interest them <s> All you can do about 'passive 'rejections is keep a meticulous spreadsheet detailing all your queries with dates names pertinent websites etc <s> Include any special notes as well <s> How long you wait to give up on getting a response is up to you although sometimes an agency or publication will have response time info on their webpage <s> Simultaneous submissions Again your call <s> You are your own publicist <s> The days of the reclusive and mysterious writer sucking deeply from a Winston before his trusty Royal typewriter are gone <s> You must represent yourself and you must do it online <s> Prospective agents and publishers are busy people with no patience for ineptitude <s> If your information is more than a click away you 'll lose them <s> I recommend you maintain two types of webpage <s> This blog is my main active webpage <s> Content here is frequently updated <s> Here is my static informational site <s> Content there does not change very often <s> If you are just starting out your static page might simply include some education and contact information and your active page may be a twitter account <s> However you choose to do it you must have these things <s> Design develop and shape them in a way that properly represents you and your work <s> They will evolve with you <s> They will surprise you as well <s> Bonus tip 1 Google Docs is a brilliant tool for creating static public webpages <s> Bonus tip 2 The way you drive a readership to your blog is by going to other sites that have the sort of readers you are trying to attract and leaving brilliant comments <s> And now for some miscellaneous links They don 't call it isubmission 'for nothing <s> Where I go to bellyache about writing <s> A whole podcast featuring Erin on Writing <s> Lastly a bit of nostalgia <s> When I was a kid I had a Mattel Knit Magic toy <s> You threaded the yarn through this squiggly little thing in the front turned the crank and PRESTO a knitted tube would come out the bottom of the plastic machine <s> You were supposed to be able to do all sorts of things with the tubes make groovy hats and stuffed dolls and scarves but all I ever ended up with was a long tube although I did love my Knit Magic machine <s> When I lead discussions on writing I often say that there is no Essay Magic machine wherein you thread an idea in turn a crank and watch an essay wind out from the bottom <s> The process I go through in order to produce a good solid piece of writing is laborious wonderful frustrating difficult and satisfying <s> It has matured through the years <s> It is important to be in love with your process to truly revel in the revelations and savor the small victories <s> If you focus solely on that 'big 'publication you risk missing the small and wonderful things that happen along the way <s> Write because you have something to say and your own way to say it <s> Write because you are driven to the craft <s> Above all write because we need the good writers <s> We need their words and observations <s> We need them to scale and record the human condition <s> I will likely revise this page from time to time so stop by again <s> And if you have good news bad news or your own advice to share please do tell all in the comment section <s> Best of luck Erin - - - My daughter had a tummy ache yesterday and we soothed it with many things including a healthy dose of MTV is Liquid Television which was one of my favorites shows of all time <s> We have about six hours of Liquid Television on VHS taped in the 90s so there was enough for this tummy ache and the next one as well <s> It worked perfect-as-you-please in the tape player that is still hooked up to our shitty 20 'CRT television <s> I swear people this is how you win - - -
