<s> Activists help put an end to gross negligence and primate deaths at a University lab <s> It is amazing to me that most Universities even seemingly progressive ones like UC Berkeley conduct useless experiments on animals <s> Legendary 'Humanzee 'Oliver his friends and the bitter fight over animal welfare at a Texas refuge 'MEPs Jens Holm Caroline Lucas Sajjad Karim and Robert Evans are today calling on other MEPs to back a landmark call to make plans for an end to the use of chimpanzees and monkeys in experiments across the European Union EU <s> The call comes at a point when almost 50 MEPs have signed a declaration before the European Parliament to end primate research across the EU in the next six years 'Let is hope the U <s> S wakes up and follows Europe is lead <s> I find it very sad that we as a nation aren 't leading this fight for compassionate science <s> New Iberia Research Center NIRC has the most captive primates in the world and is affiliated with the University of Louisiana at Lafayette <s> A former employee revealed disturbing allegations of animal cruelty that prompted an investigation and lawsuit and another group that analyzed reports requested from the University as is our right under the Freedom of Information Act found disturbing signs of abuse and neglect relating to a group of rhesus monkeys <s> NIRC has also conducted maternal deprivation experiments what I consider to be one of the more cruel useless abominable 'research 'activities <s> Write to Thomas J <s> Rowell the veterinarian in charge and request that the aging chimpanzees under his care be released to a sanctuary <s> These animals will not be forgotten <s> Thomas J <s> Rowell DVM New Iberia Research Center University of Louisiana at Lafayette <date> W <s> Admiral Doyle Drive New Iberia LA <date> Karen - age 48 Billy Ray - age 47 Clay - age 46 Diana - age 46 Jan - age 46 Julius - age 46 Lady Bird - age 46 Pumpkin - age 46 Sandy - age 46 Walter B - age 46 For example Primarily Primates Inc which housed several retired research chimps is apparently a pit of despair <s> Also facilities that receive federal funding such as Chimp Haven must return animals to laboratories if they are requested to <s> In my book that is not really retirement <s> Project R R has a list of sanctuaries that can take animals and notes which have received funding and I assume approval from them <s> Personally after watching Chimpanzees An Unnatural History on PBS and getting to 'know 'Gloria Grow I think the Fauna Sanctuary is truly a place that is earned it is name <s> Most Americans think that chimpanzees who have spent more than 10 years in research deserve to be retired seventy-one percent of us in fact <s> Despite this nearly 90 percent of lab chimps have been used for more than 10 years <s> Jane Goodall is pioneering research has opened a window into the private lives of chimps <s> To read how similiar they are to humans visit JGI is Chimpanzee Central 'Once we admit that we are not the only beings with personality reasoned thought and above all the ability to feel and express emotions such as joy despair and empathy then we develop a new respect for chimpanzees <s> The line between human and other non-human beings once thought so sharp becomes blurred <s> This forces us to a new respect also for the other amazing animal beings with whom we share the planet 'From the Wisconsin State Journal <smiley> 'A Dane County judge said Monday that the law is on the side of animal-rights activists who want to buy buildings next to the <smiley> -Madison is primate labs and open a museum highlighting the cruelty they say happens at the labs 
<s> There was a stream of cars passing right before I took this picture <s> Each one paused as it approached the green light thanks to the curb extension which pinched the intersection as well as making the walk crossing distance so much shorter <s> Such a nice treatment for this block which is actually rather lengthy though residential with parking on both sides <s> Cars used to speed up the hill to catch the green light - this pinch point helps to remind them to take it easy <s> In the world of transportation this is really great stuff and part of the Downtown Brooklyn Traffic Calming study which T <s> A instigated ages ago and is finally coming to fruition <s> There are more than <date> improvements slated for this spring according to the NYC 'C and above is an excellent example <s> An interesting thing about NYC is improvements on the street though there is an attempt to standardize improvements with the Street Design Manual there is also a wide variety of applicable treatments <s> These are the first white ADA-compliant curb cuts I 've seen in the city - I 've also seen yellow and gray <s> I kinda like that there is some flexibility and experimentation with this and not one size or color fits all <s> After decades of one-size fits cars seeing how things break loose is rather fun <s> Image by Youngna Park available via the always wonderful 20x <date> Exciting news T <s> A is starting up a Planning Corps to gather together planners designers and apply their amazing skills for change on our streets <s> This idea was hatched out of numerous conversations with two different groups that only sometimes interact <s> One set was with T <s> A staff who wanted to beef up on technical expertise and stay relevant <s> The face of advocacy has changed considerably in the past few years tools are very different technology development outpaces a small non-profit organization is ability to keep up and the political climate is very different <s> Generally we 're pretty nimble but this is partly because we know when to change accordingly <s> The second set of conversations was with planners who had a itch to change the conventions of urban planning <s> How do we use planning in a way that benefits communities and organizations that really need it instead of contributing to master plans that sit on the shelf or to EIS is that become a mockery of true environmental sustainability impacts Not to say that long-term planning isn 't necessary but what can be done now to enable change A call was put out for planners e-mail me if you 're in the NYC area and are interested in participating and a project list from T <s> A staff was compiled <s> But <s> As I was trying to come up with projects that people could work on I realized that I was really grappling with conventions of planning and experiencing how deeply ingrained they really are <s> The staff came up with a long list of projects necessary for their campaigns <s> Most of them are those that are one-on-one with a staffer or small group aka the 'client ' longer-term due to research data collection where the planner goes off to do work whatever that is and hopefully comes back with a final product <s> But the ones that the planning group expressed interest in are those that can be done in a group at once and still end up with something useful Charrettes qualify but few other things do - can you think of any I was really challenged with coming up with 'on the spot 'project ideas where a group planners could come in and get their hands dirty right away <s> At minimum planning projects must have a strong connection to T <s> A advocacy - so that there is a high potential for change <s> That part wasn 't hard <s> What was hard was thinking about re-structuring work so that it had at-the-moment application and was highly productive <s> I stopped worrying about how it would happen and embraced the idea that what we needed could be done in many different ways <s> But that means that the hard work is really on us the organizers of Planning Corps to structure creatively any piece of work on the existing project list so that it can be done in a group at once and productively <s> If we get through this though then maybe we 'll start to see a shift in how planning can change <s> Planning Corps is new with lots of space for experimentation so if you have ideas and suggestions please do share <s> Our first meeting will be March 24 location TBD <s> People is schedules change quite a bit as job personal responsibilities shift so the hope is that the way Planning Corps works - matching planners to non-profits campaigns for change - will endure <s> It is all over the transportation world but worth posting about here <s> NYC is getting closer and closer to delivering transitways - first Select Bus Service especially the designs for 1st and 2nd Aves now this proposed project on 34th Street <s> Thanks DOT for trying out another innovative design in CBD Manhattan <s> This is a huge improvement in terms of prioritizing use on our streets <s> What do vehicles really need to move This is a much more efficient use of the public right-of-way let alone a vast improvement over streets clogged with one-passenger cars <s> You can leave comments on the project page and there is a series of public input workshops going on this spring I would be curious about handling bicycle traffic curbside management of drop-offs and deliveries and timing of projects in other boroughs via Streetsblog which you should visit for a detailed discussion and some interesting comments Always love to see who wins the Young Architects Program competition to design the front yard of P <s> S 1 <s> Pole Dance by SO-IL doesn 't look as salacious as it sounds d you 're coming back to NYC for the opening right Go for it Update not public space related nor really planning related I realized belatedly <s> Did I really fall for the sparkling logo Maybe <s> From GOOD the OBJECTIVE Make an infographic about neighborhoods and or your neighborhood the Assignment Missed the MAK Center is how many billboards in LA <s> Update Was wondering how I missed the billboards when I crossed paths with the art so many times in the car that is <s> I am rarely in a car in general <s> Guess I never looked up in LA <s> I am fascinated by driving behavior in general <s> Everyone trying to talk to each other while muted imagine trying to tell someone where you are going while covering your mouth <s> Little signals mean a lot <s> I also obsess over pedestrian behavior are they walking for fitness fun or work with friends where are they walking to from do they cross with the light Enthralled by the few mixed-use retail areas <s> It seemed like LA lacks bus shelters though there are many bus riders <s> Finally I literally count cyclists check out their bike and see if they obey traffic laws <s> Total urban planning-transpo-geek <s> Real guerrilla gardening from the artist Pete Dungey 
<s> Julia has a friend who started keeping bees four or five years ago <s> The friend had four hives <s> Almost as soon as she started on this hobby a crisis occurred - her house burned in a really bad fire <s> So the bees have lived in her backyard for four years with nobody taking care of them <s> The friend invited Julia my partner at Blue Heron to come and salvage these hives <s> Julia in turn invited me dangling the possibility that if there were live bees we might each get a hive out of it <s> We decided that if we did get hives we would probably put them at Blue Heron or at the new Little Nancy Creek Park where I have asked that we be the beekeepers <s> The first hive was dead and empty of everything <s> All of the wax had been eaten out by wax moths <s> New wax had been built in the hives but it was abandoned <s> There were wax moth cocoons under the inner cover and the hive was dead <s> Probably the original bees had died and a swarm moved in making the new wax and then either absconded or died as well 
<s> <date> 'Mind you stay together you lot Make sure you 're back before it gets dark and don 't go far You hear ' 'Yes Mam ' echoed the trio of children hu 'led around the door of the small terraced house before setting off down the street and making their way to the lane leading up to Sky Pond their tongues wagging and jam jars clanging when their clogs made contact with the cobblestones <s> Half way up the lane the mood changed as the rules for the afternoon were laid down 'We don 't want any whinging from you our Gracie ' the tallest boy snapped pointing a bony finger into the chest of the frail-looking girl in front of him <s> His other arm lay limply by his side 'If me and our Bunny find a docker and want to share it we will <s> If you go telling our mam we 'll have yer guts fer garters ' 'I know better than to tell me mam Alan ' Gracie snapped back at him 'I 've still got the bruises from last time ' 'Right then <s> Don 't say I haven 't warned yer ' 'Don 't think Gracie <s> because you can never have too much yarn porn january 1 i started a <date> photo-a-day project and in consultation with many of your good selves i created a flickr group to support it and for us to have a place to share our photos and give feedback to one another with the idea of improving our photography in the initial heady days of january it was so much fun it seemed like the year would fly by and the inspiration would continue to flow like a fountain all these people who knew one another from the blogosphere and a few new ones joined in and we became friends and everyone learned and made explore and was happy then february struck most of those in the group live in the northern hemisphere so it was the darkest coldest most dreary part of the winter and it was hard now it is march and spring is taking its sweet time in coming at least where i live there are days when i look outside at the aging snowbanks and the bare trees and i think 'i can 't possibly take a picture of anything worthwhile today 'but then i take a wander around the house or i look at the photos the others in the group have taken and i feel inspired by something someone else photographed and i get through it because i promised myself i would and my promises to myself have to mean something and you reach a point where you keep doing it BECAUSE it is hard and because doing things that are hard can be good for you and because it makes you buy fresh flowers on a regular basis my reasons for doing this have already changed in the 75 days it is been running at the beginning if i am honest i wanted to show off my ability to take breathtaking pictures and develop more consistency in that now i realize that such a project is more about documenting what is going on in my life and i admit that it is most decidedly not breathtaking on a daily basis some days i use my <weirdcaps> thank goodness i 've got hipstamatic and camerabag and other apps to make that more interesting when the weather gets good i am going to use some of my film cameras they 're best at outdoor photos i realized that a profound macro of the inside of my cat is ear doesn 't actually help me document my life on a daily basis so i 've worked at pushing myself away from those and towards things that will help me remember what was going on and what was important to me at a particular moment in time i think ultimately i 'll find that this project is about memory for me the other reason i did this was to be more mindful of the world around me to notice things to see differently last year at about this time i got on a total eyeball kick which i later realized was about my wanting to SEE differently having to take a photo every day makes me look differently at the world i 'll admit it is hard for me not to see the current e <kikoo> dus from the group as a personal rejection of sorts despite endless explanations to the contrary but i am trying and until i can forget about it that is all i can do remain committed after all i read recently about a guy who took a picture every single day from <date> 'til his death in <date> now THAT is commitment if you 're not now totally put off the idea of taking a photo every day and you 'd like to join us please check out the blog camp <date> group on flickr it is never too late to start - - - and the picture at the top what does it have to do with all of this well it was one of THOSE days where i took what felt like <date> pictures of the new yarn that i am going to use to make granny squares after kristina and ulrika teach me this coming very thoughtfully here yesterday in the flickr group kristine had a shot of her passport and used it to tell the story of how she was soon moving on to her next assignment i didn 't have any idea what i was going to do for my photo so i did one of those tribute shots as they 're called when you blatantly copy what someone did and give them credit i located my old passport and my current one and as can often be the case with these daily photos took a little trip down memory lane old on the left current on the right my passports are fatter than your usual passport and that is because both of them have had pages a 'ed to them twice you 'll also notice that my old passport was green it was my first one and i didn 't know that most americans have a blue one i was 'lucky 'and got the green one during a very small window when they issued ben franklin commemorative passports it is actually thanks to benjamin franklin that we all have passports at all as it was his idea the unusual green passport caused me no end of grief when i was traveling a lot in the balkans in the late 90s border guards constantly questioned its authenticity and one guard at the turkish-greek border actually sai 'dgreen passport very bad very ba 'dand made a slicing motion across his neck i was quite alarmed but the conversation stopped there as that was apparently the extent of his english and my turkish was nonexistent i 've survived to tell the tale so i guess it wasn 't really very bad and i never did ever meet anyone else with a green one as an american you get stamped everywhere you go and you often need visas the first passport filled up because the macedonian visa took a whole page every time and i had to have a new one if i popped down to thessaloniki for a weekend or up to belgrade for a coffee it was early days after macedonia found themselves rather to their surprise with their own country and it took them awhile to realize they could issue multiple-entry visas i eventually got one of those but not before they had used up ten pages of my passport a number of countries - china and india come to mind - think nothing of taking up an entire page of your passport for the visa and the visas are elaborately colorful and often feature shiny holograms i guess they want you to feel you got your money is worth on the bright side they 're usually good for a least six months so you don 't need a new one should you be sent those places again i did use up two whole pages on indian visas as i had to go there frequently enough that one expired and i needed another audible sigh the bulk of my travel occurred during the bush administration and i clearly remember standing in lines at passport control concealing my passport as i felt a little sheepish about being american during those years i happened to be in the philippines when obama was elected and i very clearly remember the sense of relief tho ' bush was still president when i realized that i no longer had to hide my passport while i stood in line on that occasion people in line saw it and several actually smiled and gave me a thumbs up with the incomprehensible debacle of health care reform who would seriously not want to <s> Fifteen years ago I was on my way to the Austin airport to catch a flight to New York City when the friend I 'd be staying with called and said that we 'd be attending a dance performance that evening in the East Village <s> Admission was free she said but the organizers requested a donation of two canned goods for a food pantry <s> So before walking out the door I grabbed a couple of Ranch Style Beans as my offering <s> Ranch Style Beans are a Texan staple and they 've been satisfying people since <date> with their take on classic chuck-wagon fare <s> It is a distinctive flavor the beans aren 't fiery but they do have a depth and brightness that can be very a 'ictive <s> When I lived in Texas we ate them often either topped with cheese and rice as a base to bean salad alongside enchiladas or even in my mom is King Ranch casserole <s> But beyond the deliciousness and versatility of Ranch Style Beans there is the appeal of that iconic black can with its distinctive Western-style font and illustration of a man with his tongue sticking out stating the beans are Appetite Pleasin ' Of course the latter is a recent development for if you 're as old as I am you remember when the beans were Husband Pleasin ' I love that can and I 've read that if Andy Warhol had been a Texan he would have painted Ranch Style Beans cans instead of Campbell is Soup cans <s> I believe it <s> In the 15 years since I 've moved to New York City I 've seen this city become more hospitable to fellow homesick Texans <s> We now have a Texan-style barbecue joint selling Kreuz sausages and excellent brisket you can find Ro-Tel tomatoes at several grocery stores dried and canned chiles are a common staple and Austin-based Whole Foods is now here selling decent brands of tortillas chips and salsas <s> But despite the advances this city is made there is still one thing missing my beloved Ranch Style Beans <s> To help with the drought every time I go home I load up on a few cans <s> And my mom has even been known to put them in my Christmas stocking which is always a very welcome gift <s> But when I recently came to my last can with no trip home in my immediate future I realized that I should just figure out how to make these beans on my own <s> The recipe is a closely guarded secret so I was flummoxed on what to do <s> And then I read one fan is observation that Ranch Style Beans are simply pintos swimming in a chili gravy <s> At last it all made sense I decided I 'd cook a pot of pintos in a chili gravy and see what happened <s> When making my chile gravy I used the ingredient list on the back of my remaining can as my guide <s> Sure there were some vague terms such as ispices ' and 'natural flavor ' but the basic building blocks were in the open tomatoes chile peppers paprika vinager and beef fat <s> And of course pinto beans <s> Even though the can didn 't specify what type of chile I went with anchos as they 're the base of your common chili powder <s> I rehydrated the anchos and then blended them with some tomatoes vinegar cumin and paprika <s> And instead of beef fat I opted to use beef broth instead <s> While the beans cooked the house smelled gorgeous and the broth tasted right <s> But it wasn 't until after a few hours when I ladled out a bowl that I realized that this bowl of beans far exceeded my expectations <s> I threw in some sour cream warmed up a flour tortilla and had a most satisfying meal <s> And even though it is been 15 years since I gave away those beans I 've often wondered if the New Yorker who ended up with them enjoyed them <s> I hope that they did <s> Ranch style beans Ingredients 16 oz of dried pinto beans 6 ancho chiles stems and seeds removed 6 cloves of garlic minced 1 onion diced 1 15 oz can of tomatoes or 2 medium-sized tomatoes peeled 1 teaspoon brown sugar 1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar 1 teaspoon paprika 1 teaspoon cumin <math> teaspoon oregano 1 cup of water 6 cups of beef broth Salt and black pepper to taste Method Soak the beans covered in water either overnight or the quick soak method in which you place the beans in a pot cover with water bring to a boil cover and remove from heat and let sit for one hour <s> Drain the soaked beans <s> In a cast-iron skillet heated up to medium high cook the anchos on each side for a couple of minutes or until they start to bubble and pop turn off the heat and fill the skillet with warm water <s> Let them sit until soft and rehydrated which should happen after half an hour or so <s> In the pot you 'll be cooking your beans heat up a teaspoon of canola oil and cook the onions for ten minutes on medium <s> A ' the garlic and cook for another minute <s> Throw the cooked onions and garlic in a blender and a ' the tomatoes brown sugar apple cider vinegar paprika cumin oregano water and hydrated ancho chiles <s> Puree until smooth <s> A ' the pinto beans and beef broth to the pot and stir in the chile puree <s> On high bring the pot to a boil and then cover turn the heat down to low and simmer for two and a half hours stirring occasionally <s> At this point I check my beans for tenderness as depending on the freshness of the beans I find that the cooking time can be as short as two and a half hours and as long as four hours <s> When you 're satisfied that the beans are done salt and pepper to taste <s> Feeds four to six <s> Notes If you can 't find dried ancho chiles you can substitute either ancho chile powder or regular chili powder <s> I 'd use <math> of a cup <s> These are not fiery beans but if you want a bit more heat I 'd throw in a bit of Cayenne <s> And I always a ' a pinch of baking soda to my soaking beans to help with digestion issues <s> You may do the same <math> Are you on Facebook A reader recommended I set up a Homesick Texan fan page so I did <s> Please stop by and feel free to share links upload photos or just say howdy Homesick Texan fan page If you were in Houston in the <date> is it was hard to escape the ubiquitous tacos al carbon <s> Ninfa Laurenzo of the eponymous Ninfa is made them her signature dish and as with her green sauce many Houston Mexican restaurants soon a 'ed these tacos to their menus as well <s> Tacos al carbon became a defining characteristic of Houston Tex-Mex But what exactly are tacos al carbon The term al carbon is the Spanish phrase for cooking over coal so you should expect grilled meats inside a tortilla <s> If you have tacos al carbon in Mexico you will indeed find a variety of meats wrapped in either corn or flour tortillas depending on where you are geographically <s> But in Texas tacos al carbon came to mean one thing cuts of grilled beef nestled in a fluffy flour tortilla <s> But wait isn 't that a fajita Now this is where it gets confusing <s> So what is the difference between fajitas and tacos al carbon As I understand it very little <s> Fajitas which translates to little belts are traditionally made with the tough diaphragm cut of beef known as skirt steak which is a long and narrow much like a belt <s> The meat is often marinated and then grilled or gri 'led and it is served with a prescribed array of condiments such as guacamole pico de gallo sour cream and a stack of flour tortillas all used to roll your own tacos <s> And yes you can make fajitas the dish out of shrimp or chicken but since the word itself refers to the cut of beef technically it should be called something else <s> Tacos al carbon however can be made with any type of meat not just the traditional skirt steak <s> And unlike fajitas the tacos are already made instead of being a do-it-yourself affair <s> I think this is the main difference but even for me it is a bit of a semantic stretch <s> Small differences aside I still prefer tacos al carbon to fajitas <s> Sure fajitas are a quite the spectacle but sometimes you crave a more refined presentation Or perhaps I prefer tacos al carbon because I burned myself on the sizzling fajita skillet one too many times But no matter how you serve it it is hard to resist a fresh flour tortilla wrapped around succulent beef so flavorful you can eat the two together unadorned <s> I live in a small apartment without any outdoor space so there is no cooking over coal for me <s> But if I get my cast-iron skillet hot enough and then slide my steak under the broiler I get a nice charred crust that is almost as good as what I could get on a grill <s> So yes technically these aren 't true tacos al carbon they 're more like tacos a la plancha which means tacos of the gri 'le <s> But I don 't mind because after one bite I am back in that little restaurant on Navigation where the beef is juicy the tortillas are soft and the green sauce is plentiful <s> Tacos al carbon small-apartment style Ingredients 2 pounds skirt steak Juice of 4 limes about <math> cup 4 cloves of garlic <math> cup cilantro 1 jalapeno 1 teaspoon cumin 1 teaspoon salt 1 tablespoon black pepper 1 teaspoon of canola oil or nonstick cooking spray Four green onions optional Method To make the marinade in a blender mix all the ingredients except for the skirt steak canola oil and green onions <s> Pour over skirt steak and let it marinate for 2 to 8 hours in the refrigerator <s> Before cooking rinse off the marinade and let the steak come to room temperature <s> Heat on high for 10 minutes a large cast-iron skillet or grill pan you may have to cut the steak in half to fit <s> Also turn on the broiler in your oven <s> When the skillet is hot to test I throw in a drop of water and it should immediately evaporate grease your pan with either the oil or nonstick cooking spray and a ' your steak <s> Cook on one side for two minutes then turn and cook on the other side for two minutes <s> After it is cooked on both sides place the green onions in the skillet with the steak still in it and place the skillet under the broiler for two minutes <s> Remove steak from pan and let it rest for 10 minutes <s> If onions aren 't charred enough slide the skillet back under the broiler <s> After meat has rested slice the meat against the grain and roll in fluffy flour tortillas with green onions on the side <s> Serves <math> <s> Notes I don 't have a grill or outdoor space so I don 't know as much as I 'd like to about the subject but to cook the steaks truly al carbon I 've been told five minutes per side should do the trick <math> Homesick Texan has been nominated for best regional food blog in Savuer is First Annual Best Food Blog Awards <s> I am pleased as punch about this nod as it just confirms what we 've all known for a long time Texas food is wonderful Please be sure and check out all the excellent blogs nominated--it is quite a round up And if you 're so inclined I 'd love your vote which you can place right here <s> Thank you I am roasting chiles and frying up bacon <s> What am I making you might ask What everybody wants to eat after being ill for a few days chipotle macaroni and cheese <s> With bacon of course <s> OK so this might seem a bit heavy for a re-entry into the land of the normal eating but let me tell you I am hungry And while the best thing I can say about not feeling well is that your skinny jeans are su 'enly a viable option in your wardrobe in the end I 'd rather be well than ill <s> Though who wouldn 't But let is talk about chipotle macaroni and cheese shall we My family much like yours I reckon has always made homemade macaroni and cheese <s> Sure we 'd have the box stuff on hand for after-school snacks or donations to the church food pantry but in my house the real homemade stuff was what was preferred <s> Mom makes her macaroni and cheese in a variety of ways but my favorite is a casserole of pasta suspended in a luscious sauce comprised of egg yolks cheese and heavy cream <s> And just when you think it couldn 't be any more extravagant she throws in diced thick ham and tops it off with buttery breadcrumbs <s> Yes this is an excellent dish but because of its richness I only advise serving it on special occasions <s> When it comes to a more everyday simple macaroni and cheese I turn to a method I learned in the New York Times <s> This recipe requires little effort besides pouring cottage cheese blended with milk over dry pasta tossing in some shre 'ed cheese and baking it for an hour <s> No endless stirring a sauce or boiling a batch of pasta which makes it a cinch to make <s> The Times version kept it plain but I 've made it my own by a 'ing chipotle and garlic <s> And I top it with bacon and cotija which a is contrast to the oozing cheese and soft pasta <s> I realize that my macaroni and cheese may appear decadent as decadent as my monm is but feel free to convince yourself that it is a touch more healthy due to the cottage cheese and all <s> I do <s> But you know what We 're nearing the end of a long cold winter and sometimes you just need to pamper yourself <s> And for me comfort comes clothed in chipotle chiles cheese and bacon <s> Chipotle macaroni and cheese with bacon adapted from the NY Times Ingredients 2 cups of dry elbow pasta 2 cups of milk 1 cup of cottage cheese 1 chipotle chile in adobo 1 teaspoon mustard powder 1 clove of garlic roughly chopped Pinch of cumin Salt and black pepper to taste 3 cups of shre 'ed cheese a mix of che 'ar and Monterey Jack <math> cup of crumbled cotija cheese optional but delicious 4 pieces of cooked bacon chopped 1 tablespoon of butter Method Heat the oven to <date> degrees <s> Grease a 9-inch cast-iron skillet or a 9-inch square or round baking pan with the butter <s> A ' the dry pasta <s> In a blender mix together the milk cottage cheese chipotle chile mustard powder garlic cumin salt and black pepper until it is smooth <s> Pour mixture over dry pasta and stir until sauce is evenly distributed <s> Stir in two cups of the shre 'ed cheese cover the pan with foil and bake for 30 minutes <s> After 30 minutes remove the foil and stir the macaroni and cheese a couple of times <s> Top with the remaining 1 cup of shre 'ed cheese and chopped bacon and cook for another 25 minutes uncovered or until brown and bubbling <s> Remove from oven sprinkle with cotija and serve <s> Note If you 're not familiar with cotija cheese it is a Mexican hard cheese that is like a cross between feta and parmesan <s> It is become increasingly more common so you can find it at many regular grocery stores and Hispanic markets <s> And if you live in New York City I found at Mexicana Bakery in Jackson Heights at <date> Roosevelt a wonderful cotija coated in dried chiles <s> Also chipotle bacon jam might go dandy with this as well The day before Ash Wednesday Yep I am a pancake eater <s> I grew up in an Episcopalian family and that is how we rolled in warm gri 'lecakes and cold glasses of milk <s> And even though most of my friends prepare for Lent in a more colorful style old traditions are hard to shake and I still enjoy a tall stack of pancakes on Shrove Tuesday <s> Pancakes might not be shiny beads feathered costumes fevered dancing or boisterous singing but they don 't have to be completely boring <s> I 've been known to serve gingerbread pancakes buttermilk pancakes banana nut pancakes and chocolate chip pancakes <s> But to truly get in the frenzied spirit on the eve of Lent Uncle Austin is coconut pancakes more colorfully known as Uncle Austin is Mexican pancakes are a definite must <s> When I was young Austin would make these pancakes for us on special occasions <s> Their main attraction was their size he 'd make one pancake the entire width of a <math> inch pan <s> And you didn 't even have to share this big baby no way this over-sized coconut pancake was all for you But incredible heft aside Austin is Mexican pancakes were sweet with fresh coconut and some family members allege that there was chocolate and nuts in them as well <s> I asked Austin for his recipe but he said that not only had he not made these in 30 years but also that he never really had one <s> Instead he just took my grandpa is basic pancake recipe and dolled it up a bit with the shre 'ed coconut chunks of brown sugar and extra pats of butter <s> Curious why they were known as Mexican pancakes he admitted that there was nothing authentically Mexican about them but it was very very important to be listening to Tejano music preferably loud while making them <s> He stressed however that the main excitement was in the flipping of the <math> inch pancake the messier the better If you 're celebrating pancake Tuesday why not try Uncle Austin is Mexican coconut pancakes they 're far more adventurous than your usual buttermilk pancakes <s> And with the Tejano thumping and the pancake batter flying it may be the most thrilling pancake supper you 've ever had What is your favorite pancake recipe Coconut pancakes Uncle Austin is Mexican pancakes Ingredients 1 egg 1 <math> cups of milk 2 cups of flour 1 tablespoon of whole-wheat flour 1 tablespoon of fresh baking powder <math> tsp salt <math> cup brown sugar <math> cup fresh shre 'ed coconut Juice from one lime about 2 tablespoons plus <math> teaspoon of lime zest <math> teaspoon of cinnamon 4 tablespoons of melted butter Method Beat together the egg and the milk <s> Stir in the rest of the ingredients and mix until smooth <s> If too thick a ' more milk For regular-sized pancakes pour <math> cup of batter onto greased skillet heated at medium low <s> For Austin-sized pancakes pour about 1 <math> cups to 2 cups of batter into pan <s> Cook for a few minutes on one side until edges are brown and bubbles form in batter <s> Flip and cook on other side a couple more minutes <s> Makes about 12 small pancakes or 3 extra-large pancakes <s> Note Chopped pecans and chocolate chips are an excellent a 'ition if you like <s> Austin recommends serving them with pineapple and I agree <s> I also top my pancakes with yogurt but honey or syrup would be dandy as well <s> And Austin didn 't a ' limejuice or cinnamon in his original recipe that was my doing <s> When I was invited to a party where Southern pork dishes were being celebrated the decision on what to bring was a no-brainer Mexican chocolate pralines <s> Now before you call my contribution a little o ' let me explain myself <s> My first and more obvious choice was to make cookies with lard <s> I didn 't have any lard on hand however so I went to the Union Square farmers ' market to pick up a tub <s> But a snowstorm had threatened to blanket the city and my preferred lard vendor wasn 't there clearly I had to come up with another plan <s> I 've been spending lots of time lately reading old cookbooks <s> I am curious to see what our ancestors ate and to see when certain dishes may have come into the common culinary vernacular <s> When looking for inspiration I recalled that I had recently come across an old Mexican-candy recipe that called for piloncillo or brown sugar to be cooked with water and a strip of raw bacon <s> Now I know bacon in a dessert is a trendy thing these days but I was intrigued to see it listed in a <date> year-old recipe <s> And while I didn 't have lard to make cookies bacon was easily attainable <s> In another cookbook I had seen a recipe for Mexican-chocolate pralines <s> So for the pork-themed feast I decided to combine the two thoughts and make Mexican-chocolate pralines with bacon <s> Making a first-time dish to share at a large gathering is always brave if not foolish <s> And while the flavor of these pralines was pleasing the texture was too delicate <s> So instead of patties thick with pecans and bacon I had broken chips and shards instead <s> My pralines looked sad <s> Plus you couldn 't even really taste the bacon But I was out of time and couldn 't show up empty handed so I threw the pieces into a tin and headed to the party <s> I suppose my offering these praline pieces was the equivalent of a student who shows a failed project to a teacher to prove that she has at least tried to complete the assignment <s> I gave myself about a C for effort <s> But then a strange thing happened <s> While at the party I witnessed people eating the Mexican-chocolate praline pieces <s> And they were smiling With pleasure So with a little work I knew I could make the Mexican chocolate pralines into something special <s> Buoyed by my friends ' comments the next day I attempted to make these pralines again <s> I threw out the bacon even though it had been the primary impetus to make these in the first place a 'ed more nuts let the candy cook longer and threw in some orange zest for a hint of brightness <s> And after an hour of letting the pralines harden I had a long sheet of parchment paper lined with a fine batch of Mexican chocolate pralines <s> If you 're looking for Valentine is inspiration these take little time and effort to make but are very impressive even when they 're not entirely perfect <s> But you don 't need a special occasion to eat them as they 're a simple pleasure that can be enjoyed at any time <s> Mexican chocolate pralines adapted from Aprovecho Ingredients 1 disc of Mexican hot chocolate such as Ibarra 2 oz of unsweetened baking chocolate 2 cups of pecans 1 cup chopped and 1 cup whole 1 <math> cups of sugar <math> cup of brown sugar <math> cup of milk 6 tablespoons of butter <math> teaspoon cinnamon 2 teaspoons fresh orange zest or 1 teaspoon dried orange zest <math> teaspoon Cayenne pepper <math> teaspoon sea salt 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Tools needed Candy thermometer Parchment paper Method In an oven set at <date> degrees roast the pecans for 10 minutes <s> In a large pot melt together on medium heat the chocolates sugars pecans milk butter cinnamon orange zest Cayenne and sea salt stirring occasionally <s> Place a candy thermometer in the pot to monitor the heat <s> When it reaches <date> degrees remove from fire and a ' the vanilla and stir the pot for two minutes <s> There should be a bit of shine to the candy but the candy will be a bit more thick <s> Scoop pralines onto parchment paper If it is too stiff a ' warm water to mixture Let cool for an hour and remove <s> They will still be a bit shiny but will lose that shine after a few hours <s> No matter they 're still delicious Depending on how large your scoops may be this makes about 20 pralines <s> They will keep for five days <s> Note If you want to a ' bacon to these I 'd fry up four slices crumble them and stir into praline when you a ' the vanilla <s> Growing up in Houston I am no stranger to chicken and sausage gumbo <s> The city is close proximity to Louisiana is Cajun country insured that I knew plenty of kids with family names such as Boudreaux Guidry or Hebert whose parents often had a big pot of the chunky soup simmering on the stove <s> After an afternoon of riding bikes you could walk into one of these kitchens grab a bowl and ladle a portion thick with smoky succulent meats over a pile of rice <s> Gumbo is good and during the cold months it was almost as prevalent as chili in my part of town <s> With the New Orleans Saints going to the Super Bowl for the first time the decision about what to make on the big day is simple <s> Sure quarterback Drew Brees may be a Texan but my Super Bowl plan is to cook a big pot of chicken and sausage gumbo <s> And while I 've long been a gumbo eater for some reason however I 've never been much of a gumbo maker <s> So when I needed advice I turned to Ken Wheaton <s> Ken Wheaton who lives in Brooklyn but hails from Opelousas Louisiana is famous in certain New York City circles for his gumbo <s> So much that when his editor caught wind of his prowess he insisted that Ken include his recipe in his excellent new novel The First Annual Grand Prairie Rabbit Festival <s> Ken is novel isn 't a food novel per se <s> Nope it is a story about a confused Catholic priest struggling with his faith and vows <s> And while that may seem like a heavy topic in Ken is hands it is a humorous heartfelt story that will make you laugh and might even make you cry <s> But it will also make you hungry for both Cajun food and culture as Ken deftly captures small-town Louisiana life in all its church-going Zydeco-dancing and gumbo-making glory <s> And yes please note that there is also lots of swearing drinking and rabbit-stew eating it is not a book for the easily offended <s> I won 't get into plot particulars nor will I delve into any other English-major mumbo jumbo that I probably knew at one point but have long since forgotten <s> But do know this Ken is an expert storyteller who has an amazing gift of creating a sense of place <s> And if you 've been aching to spend some time in Cajun country with some colorful characters his book will tide you over until you can enjoy the real thing <s> Of course you can also satisfy your hunger by making a batch of gumbo <s> Because I like to tinker I messed with Ken is method just a bit but I followed his key rules to not a ' tomatoes mushrooms or carrots <s> And while the word gumbo stems from the Bantu term for okra kingombo I didn 't a ' that as well even though it is quite common to include it for both flavor and its thickening power <s> If you 've ever been intimidated by making gumbo as I was don 't be <s> The hardest part is making the roux which I now do in the oven so it is a snap and waiting for the soup to be ready <s> And when you tuck into your bowl filled with a rich broth smoky sausage and tender chicken you 'll be happy that you made a batch <s> Your friends and family will thank you too <s> But enough about me what are y 'all making for the Super Bowl Chicken and sausage gumbo adapted from Ken Wheaton Ingredients 1 four-pound chicken cut into parts 2 pounds of andouille sausage sliced 2 onions 1 diced and 1 cut into quarters 10 cloves of garlic 5 minced and 5 whole 4 ribs of celery 3 diced and 1 cut into quarters 2 bell peppers diced 4 bay leaves 2 sprigs of fresh thyme or 1 teaspoon dry 1 bunch of green onions green part diced 1 cup of canola oil plus a tablespoon 1 cup of flour 1 tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce 1 teaspoon of filÈ powder plus more for serving Salt Cayenne and black pepper to taste Method To make your roux in a large cast iron skillet mix together the flour and the canola oil <s> Place in an oven set at <date> degrees walk away and let it cook for two hours <s> No hovering no stirring no nothing After a couple of hours take it out of the oven and it should be chocolate brown <s> Now you can also do it the standing over the stove method if you prefer but I don 't <s> While the roux is cooking make your chicken and broth <s> First season your chicken parts generously with salt black pepper and Cayenne <s> Place the chicken parts in a large pot with the quartered onions whole garlic quartered celery 2 bay leaves and 8 quarts of water <s> Bring to a boil and then simmer for an hour and a half skimming any foam that rises to the surface <s> Take the chicken out of the pot and when it is cool remove the fat and pick the meat off the bones and cut into pieces Be sure and save the bones for another round of stock making When the broth is cool strain and throw out the vegetables <s> Remove the fat with a gravy separator or by the plastic bag method <s> To do the latter you 'll pour the broth into a quart-sized plastic storage bag and once you see the fat rise to the top snip off a bottom corner and drain it until you reach the fat layer <s> Do this in batches <s> You should have about 8 quarts <s> Clean your pot or get another big one if you 're blessed with a large well-stocked kitchen and in the bottom of it heat up 1 tablespoon of canola oil <s> A ' the diced onions and let them cook for 10 minutes <s> A ' the chopped celery and bell pepper cook for five minutes stirring occasionally <s> Throw in the minced garlic and cook for a minute <s> Now stir in the roux and cook it with the vegetables for five minutes stirring every so often <s> A ' the chicken meat and half of the sliced sausage and cook for 15 minutes stirring occasionally <s> If things start to get sticky pour in some water or wine <s> Now slowly whisk in your strained chicken broth to the roux vegetable meat mixture <s> Throw in two more bay leaves thyne and the Worcestershire bring to a boil and then simmer for an hour <s> At this time a ' the remaining sausage and cook for another hour <s> Fifteen minutes before it is done a ' the minced green onions and filÈ powder and check to see if it needs salt black and Cayenne pepper <s> Remove bay leaves and serve over cooked rice with file powder for people to a ' to their bowls <s> Notes This is a soupy gumbo <s> If you like it thicker use less liquid and or cook it for a lot longer than stated here <s> FilÈ pronounced fee-lay powder is ground sassafras leaves and a dash of it will also help thicken it <s> If you 're feeling wild replace the canola oil with bacon grease <s> Ken also a is tasso a Cajun ham to his chicken and sausage gumbo but I couldn 't find that here in NYC <s> If you 're in that predicament however Ken suggests ordering your sausage and tasso from his hometown butcher Kelly is Country Meat Block Diner Toll free <date> MEAT <s> He says 'I usually order pure pork sausage but lots of people are fans of the half amp half beef and pork <s> The andouille is killer <s> The tasso is awesome <s> They also have rabbits too 'Or he likes to use Bruce Aidell is andoille sausage as he believes it has an authentic flavor <s> He also prefers cooking up only chicken thighs and skipping the whole broth-making step and just a is water to the pot as he lets his pot of gumbo simmer forever <s> Do this if you prefer <s> Full disclosure Ken is my friend and I 've been watching him write this novel for many years so you can take what I say about it with a grain of salt <s> That said please know I would never recommend something unless I loved it and thought y 'all might love it too <s> A friend and I were comparing notes about our favorite childhood treats <s> As I was raving about my grandma is chocolate pie my friend said 'So how is your grandma is chocolate gravy ' Huh Chocolate gravy is that like mole I asked <s> Nope it is spooned on biscuits she said <s> I had to admit that I 'd never heard of chocolate gravy clearly I 'd been deprived <s> Curious why I had been denied the joys of chocolate gravy all my life I called my grandma and demanded an explanation 'Why don 't you make chocolate gravy ' I asked <s> She replied gravy Because I know everything I assumed that if I hadn 't heard of it then it must not be Texan <s> I was wrong <s> I poked around and not only had my friend a long-standing Texan grown up eating it within slapping distance of Dallas but other Texan friends had been eating it all their lives as well <s> I heard chocolate-gravy stories from friends as far west as Midland and as far south as Houston <s> Though friends who had grown up in Arkansas Tennessee and Georgia had also indulged so it is not particular to just Texas <s> But no matter my family had been missing out on a very good thing <s> I needed to make up for lost time <s> A little research revealed that there hadn 't been much chocolate-gravy recipe evolution over the years <s> The biggest schism I found in the chocolate-gravy community was whether to use milk or water as your liquid <s> I was surprised that no one had thrown some chipotle or bacon into their gravy but actually this pleased me as it proved that chocolate gravy was indeed a classic that didn 't need any tinkering <s> But enough about thinking it was time to eat <s> I made my first batch and it was a deep dark concoction smooth creamy and thick <s> I sliced a biscuit in half and plopped some chocolate gravy on each half <s> My first bite revealed this gravy is pleasures <s> Its pu 'ing-like consistency is pure comfort on a cold winter morning <s> And while biscuits are in no way virtuous their texture and heft prevents the gravy from sliding into total decadence which is important as this is a breakfast treat after all not dessert <s> Does chocolate gravy and biscuits replace my beloved chocolate pie No but I certainly wouldn 't pass up an opportunity to pass an occasional morning with it poured on top of a biscuit <s> And am I the only one who didn 't grow up eating this No matter I am very very pleased to finally make its acquaintance <s> Chocolate gravy Ingredients <math> cup of sugar <math> cup of flour <math> cup of cocoa powder <math> teaspoon salt <math> teaspoon cinnamon 2 cups of milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 tablespoon of butter Method Mix together in a pot the sugar flour cocoa powder salt and cinnamon can sift if it is too lumpy <s> A ' the milk and while stirring cook on medium heat until it thickens <s> Stir in the vanilla and butter and serve immediately with biscuits <s> Notes As you can see in between my legs at an awkward angle <s> A little embarrassing trying to extricate myself and get back up except no one witnessed it <s> Ha Keith and Dan were already waiting at the top <s> Falling is just part of mountain biking <s> But I could feel the disparity in my quad muscle strength as I attempted the climb <s> It is a little bit of a bummer but I know it will get better <s> It messed with my head for the rest of the ride though <s> We went on a new singletrack trail that was built with Keith is help while I was away Ticketron <s> Normally it would 've been no problem <s> Okay maybe I would have popped off the bike in a couple of places <s> Instead I walked a lot of it with my bike <s> The steep climb out of Deer Canyon usually called for some hike-a-biking but I was doin ' way more hikin ' than bikin ' <s> When we arrived at the first stretch of single track on Fenceline it was no problem but the second stretch I had to clip out so quickly and so often that I gave up and walked the rest of the way <s> My knee ached a little enough to give up on the idea of doing a brick workout with a little run afterwards <s> I got through it <s> I went to places I haven 't been to in a long time on my mountain bike <s> And I had a lot of fun hanging out with the guys <s> Dan thought for sure that he would slow us down <s> Nope it was me <s> When we stopped for some nutrition I mentioned that I really liked the Hammer Gel Apple Cinnamon flavor <s> I said 'Wow this tastes just like apple pie ' Dan replied right back 'Oh I 'd need ice cream with that ' Which pretty much gives you the flavor of the conversation that went back and forth between three immature trail patrol volunteers <s> When we arrived back in the parking lot we had a visit from <date> is Dad who rode across a couple of mountain ranges to meet up with us and say 'Hi ' What a guy Next week I get to do it all over again <s> <repeatedchars> maybe I 'll take a different route <s> Would you believe Slow n Easy Yup that is a trail <s> A winding mile-and-a-quarter fire road <s> I wasn 't really sure what I 'd write about here after my knee surgery last winter <s> I knew I wouldn 't have a triathlon season <s> I wanted to talk to others who came back strong after being sidelined <s> It was an idea that was kickin ' around in my head for a few weeks when the unthinkable happened <s> A dear friend of mine was in a serious ski accident and suffered a spinal cord injury and a few days later a stroke <s> I felt helpless to do anything for him as he lay in the hospital <s> I decided to start a new series Comeback Kids <s> I 'd do a new story every Friday for him his family and his closest bu 'ies for as long as he was in the hospital <s> That was the plan <s> I had no idea how I 'd pull it off <s> I put it out there and hoped for the best <s> And I truly met the best in the process <s> Friends friends of friends acquaintances and complete strangers who were more than willing to do the phone interviews email me pictures and review their story drafts prior to posting on the big Friday deadline <s> They divulged some pretty personal stuff some pearls of wisdom and always some kind words for my bu 'y <s> I 'd like to thank each every one of them once again <s> Hall of Fame Triathlete Karen Smyers who called me from a yellow cab in New York City on a business trip <s> Pro triathlete Joanna Zeiger who said 'Don 't quit with your rehab until you are satisfied with the results ' Yes she spent five hours a day doing rehab for her back injury She inspires me to keep doing two or three-hour workouts at my rehab gym My physical therapy aide and former NFL player Erroll Tucker who still encourages me during every weight workout <s> I 'd venture to say that every single one of these Comeback Kids has a lot of heart but Dwight Kroening completed Ironman Canada after receiving a heart transplant and Wayne 'The Dead Guy ' Wright completed 50 Marathons in 50 U <s> S <s> States this October after undergoing a quadruple bypass <s> Dennis Tapp found a way to ride his bike across the country with the partial paralysis caused by five gunshots <s> Sterling Kwong completed Ironman mound <s> My fellow rehab patient Lydia continues to bravely fight cancer on top of the severe back pain from her paragliding accident <s> And my dear coach Beth Hibbard became a pro triathlete after helped me start this series off with a bang and his brother Brad helped me keep the streak alive Yes there will be something nice for you under the tree I mean in the fridge this Christmas Some walking again with assistance <s> I look forward to the day when I can write his Comeback Kid story <s> Until then I plan to write a few more of these stories in the year ahead <s> And I thank you for making all of these stories possible <s> Happy holidays 
<s> I 've been thinking lately about what it is that draws a woman to a man and vice-versa And is there really such a thing as love at first sight <punctuationfreak> I know for myself there are certain things that immediately draw me in and I am talking pure aesthetics a great smile nice teeth engaging eyes good skin nice hands to name a few <s> But love <punctuationfreak> What is it beyond that immediate attraction that makes someone take a second and a third and a fourth look People often say that they know within the first 5 minutes whether someone they 've met has boyfriend girlfriend 'potential 'or not <s> I think what is more often the case is that you know instantly if someone doesn 't have a chance but not necessarily if they do <s> Personality is such a HUGE X-factor and it is truly such a variable that I think it is almost impossible to completely rule someone out without having a conversation <s> And what is an appealing character trait in one person doesn 't necessarily carry the same appeal on another <s> Weird how that is but when people overlook the fact that someone is rude thoughtless selfish unkind or disrespectful just to be with the bombshell or the handsome hunk we know how long those relationships last - not very There are certain deal breakers however <s> Instant No-Can-Dos <s> Shorter than me Nope <s> Unintelligent I 'll pass <s> Smoke cigarettes Hell to the no Now while I don 't think I 've ever experienced love at first sight I think I 've had lust lol but I would never rule out the fact that i 
<s> I don 't remember the last time I had visited a grave on the Mt of Olives <s> Yes I 'd been to Ibrahim is home but he lives in the neighborhood of the living I guess I don 't know that many holy people The Mt of Olives is the world is oldest and holiest Jewish cemetery dating from biblical times Many holy rabbis over the centuries have been buried there Even Madonna visited one of the Kabbalah rabbis when she was here with the Kabbalah center This past Friday however was the anniversary of my friend is son is death 5 years ago He had a rare genetic thing which left him since birth severely handicapped He never walked or spoke When he died at the age of 14 he was buried in the Mt of Olives in a special plot for holy children - those who never spoke bad about anyone It is a special merit to be buried there because space is limited and is usually reserved for renowned rabbis these days Legend has it that when the resurrection happens people buried there will be resurrected first <s> It was tough on my friend to visit his grave She lost a son It is always tough for the living She knows he is fine not trapped in a very handicapped body When she dreams about him he even speaks to her - something he never did when he was alive I looked around at the gravestones Some were so tiny - the babies must have been a few days weeks or months when they died Someone pointed out that right behind my friend is son is grave were the graves of the two Holzberg children - the children of the Chassidic couple that was killed during the Mumbai massacre a couple of years ago by Islamic extremists They had died of illness before the tragedy with their parents occurred Now they have no parents visiting their graves - only a 4 year old brother and grandparents After we read the psalms and the quorum of 10 men left the mother and a few of her friends stayed on to sit and keep this young soul of her son some company We listened to the mother grieve for her son for her loneliness and some shared what they felt too grieving for a loved one I felt serene and there was an atmosphere of contentment sitting around the little souls tiny grave There were red poppies growing wild by unmarked graves I looked at the Holzberg graves and told my friend that her son and this boy were now friends and learning chassidut together Cellphones are expensive but so necessary I wonder how we managed years ago when we had to depend on pay phones to tell someone we 'll be late or make impulsive last minute arrangements with friends and relatives How inconvenient it all was trying to find that quarter or whatever the cost was then But my cellphone bill has been expensive of late and so I called up the competitor of my current cell provider There are three major cellphone companies in Israel Cellcom Pelephone and Orange I got a much better offer from the competitor after complaining about my current cellphone provider so after a week or so I got on the phone with my current provider and told them about the offer <s> Can they match it Closely They connected me with a special department called Customer Retention or something like that I would get a new phone at <math> of the cost I complained that their competitor offered me a free one OK - then they 'll give me a free one too Wow It sounded so easy I went to their service store and waited nearly an hour to be seated with one of their reps They wrote my number down on a piece of paper <s> I was number <date> Number <date> flashed on the screen but there was no customer They probably got impatient and left I could have been crafty and written the number <date> on the other side of the paper to be promptly seated - but I am too American Or Canadian I 'll wait my turn the way civilized people are apt to do I finally got my turn The sales rep gets my phone number and asks me questions 'How much did they offer you 'I asked - 'Isn 't it on the computer 'Yes but you 're a special case from the retention department What exactly did they promise you ' I told him 'Yes you 're right 'he says - obviously regaining his eyesight as what they promised was probably on the computer screen all along I couldn 't figure out why they were playing this game <s> About 5 minutes into this a woman comes over to me with a typed up survey in her hand - asking me how the service is and how is the sales rep I am talking to 'Isn 't it o ' that you 're asking me how is he when I am right in front of him 'Give me a 10 isaid the sales rep to me 'Ok I 'll give you a 10 but if I find that you 're saying 'ok ' to whatever was agreed on the phone and I get a totally different more expensive bill I am coming back to rate you a 1 'Don 't worry The new rate will show up on your bill 'The new rate didn 't show up on what I signed and after I questioned him he said it was standard I 'll get the new rate on my next bill because I was a ispecial 'case 'So in case you 're lying to me how long am I contracted to you '18 months 'Fine That is better than the more common 3 year contract If they 're a bunch of liars I 'll use my phone minimally and pay the minimum charge and after 18 months switch to another provider For years ever since we made aliyah I was considered by my kids to be so uncool After all I am an immigrant speak Hebrew with an embarrassing accent plus my grammar is often wrong I like Western music Arabs Arabic music health food go to a trippy synagogue in Jerusalem invite non-Jews for Shabbat dinner eat in different restaurants all the time see foreign films and often go alone My oldest daughter even bought me a birthday gift - a <math> movie package - at Jerusalem is landmark Smadar theater I love the Smadar They didn 't destroy the Ottomon-era terracotta stone floors and opened up a restaurant attached to the theater Unlike the cinemateque you can bring in your beer and cappucino or hot cider - even wine - into the theater There are others like me who sit alone in the theater Lately I saw the movies Push and A Serious Man there Next week I am seeing a Korean film with a friend But now all of a su 'en I am cool My complainer daughter hardly complains anymore She hugs and kisses me daily The reason She has a new boyfriend This guy comes from a Moroccan family BUT and here is a big BUT he enjoys Ashkenazi European Western culture more than his own <s> He doesn churns out Israeli hits This new boyfriend loves the Beatles Doors Stones and Fats Domino My daughter doesn 't know the songs to any of these But now she is coming to me to learn this new Western source of the smoke The odor was quite strong They were with me in the apartment for a good 20 minutes Then I lift up one of my pots that was on the stove and see a little rattan coaster sticking to
