<s> The little copper tree and the wood on which it sits were sent to me by Aleph <s> I a 'ed the birthday candle and the little figures about <math> inch tall <s> This twisting tree reminded me of the Wallace Stevens poem On the Road Home <s> I tried something pretty simple with this- instead of blending bits of the three photographs I liked I just stacked them I think this reflects the mood of mutability in the poem <s> Alice picks up the red king chesspiece who does not know what force is lifting him through the air <s> Feeling at the mercy of forces beyond our control frequently results in reverting to the primitive did someone say reptilian brain 
<s> 14 x 5 'About five years back when I was just starting to paint I emailed a well-known artist and asked him to take a look at my work and tell me what I was missing <s> He offered one comment that stuck with me - to pay as much attention to the edges as the content <s> I was too tight - too illustrative <s> And it is not what I wanted to achieve - I wanted to find the balance of details needed and leave the rest to impression <s> With each and every painting I have to pay great attention to that fine line - not to say there are days when I desire to tighten up and other times I desire to really lay on the painterly strokes <s> I don 't have a favorite feature in this new piece - I love all of it <s> That final dab of light blue on the bathing suit mattered although I don 't know what made me do it other than intuition <s> The edges are just as I want - allowing some to be rough and some soft <s> Please click here for a larger view and purchase information 12 x 12 'Front and center on the third floor of the Art Institute hangs Gustave Caillebotte is enormous painting 'Paris Street Rainy Day ' - certainly the biggest crowd-pleaser in the museum <s> There is plenty of room to not only get up close but to back up a good 30 - 40 feet and take it all in <s> When I was a teenager I would sit on the floor in front of this masterpiece and draw dozens of versions of parts of this urban scene - not knowing I 'd paint it dozens of times thirty years later <s> My favorite feature of this new piece is the man on the far right on his way out <s> I have wanted to a ' more movement in figures - a slight blur or even a ghost of a shape - just knowing when it is right is the tough part <s> And knowing how to get the idea across without looking like my hand smudged the paint unintentionally is even harder <s> It is something I am working on more and more mostly behind the scenes <s> Please click here for a larger view and purchase information 16 x 16 'This new painting is the largest piece in the show - done on a cradled masonite panel - and like the painting 'Below the Belt ' I a 'ed a paprika-like ground color on top of the black and let that vibrant warm tone show through in many of the edges as well as the floor which is what I love most about the end result <s> The two figures were wonderful to paint especially the woman who has that great S-shaped posture <s> Included front and center is Georgia O 'Keeffe is 'Black Cross New Mexico ' one of my all-time personal favorites in the Art Institute of Chicago <s> Please click here for a larger view and purchase information 9 x 12 'How about a moment of Zen - forget the cold wet dreary weather outside and imagine yourself soaking up the warm sun on the beach all by yourself <s> And remember brighter days are ahead <s> Not soon enough - but it is coming <s> My first thought about this new painting is it can best be appreciated in person <s> The vibrancy of the skin tones the yellow towel and especially the turquoise water and multi-blues sky - the texture and warmth in the sand which I used a palette knife for most of that - yes I wish I could hold up the real thing right in front of you <s> As with most paintings <s> In the process of painting this I did the figure first the water next the people walking about and in the ocean way in the distance - and then wiped the whole thing off <s> Those moments are funny - here I just spent hours on what I thought was nearly complete and it is as if my hand just took over and grabbed a rag and in seconds trashed it <s> So I sit there stunned for a minute hearing that little voice that assures me it wasn 't right and get over it <s> Just as quick as it disappeared I start it all over again - lessons learned - which usually makes the second attempt much more successful <s> Now mix yourself a margarita and click here for a larger view and purchase information 12 x 12 'I may have said this before - when I am in a museum I find myself so focused on looking at people rather than the art <s> It is been an obsession since I was a kid - watching the human figure and studying how we move stand balance sit all of it <s> And when I start a painting there is always something that stands out right away - a feature that is essentially why I am interested in the photograph in the first place <s> In this case I saw this gentleman and his clothes as one united interesting form - I felt the weight of the fabric the heavy load of the backpack and especially the zigzags created by the folds of the pants <s> I just love that feature <s> I also saw the warmth of the overall tones - the golds reds greys - and chose to paint a rich paprika-like color on top of the black surface I usually start with and hoped it would peek through in parts as long as I didn 't go too far and cover it all up <s> The challenge being to let the edges do what they do without nit picking <s> Like here in the legs <s> I was so happy with the some of the red showing through the creamy wall and the looseness of the shadows around the Picasso - again allowing edges to overlap and disappear into each other <s> That is what I get when I stay away from small brushes - I am forced to take more control of the strokes but I can 't over-paint it <s> This young man was studying Picasso is 'Mother and Child ' which hangs in the Modern Wing in the Art Institute of Chicago <s> Please click here for a larger view and purchase information <s> Booster Seat I and II each is 8 x 10 'Whew All of the new paintings are officially in the Morris amp Whiteside Gallery currently being hung for the three-artists-show opening Friday the 26th and I feel I can relax a little bit <s> And I am very happy to start showing you each and every painting - and if you don 't mind - I want to a ' to that some of my favorite details or isweet spots ' that make them special <s> Let me start with the paintings you see above - two women taking a rest on a bench in the Art Institute of Chicago <s> It is where thousands of visitors take a load off and hopefully get a boost of energy to get back to exploring <s> Now you may recognize the woman on the right I had painted her a few years back - but with this new piece actually both paintings - I applied the oils with a palette knife nice and thick then carved into it with a brush a 'ing more detail and control <s> I can attest to this being more difficult and frustrating - but the challenge lies in moving the paint around almost sculpting it in parts <s> Some areas have slabs of color on top of color like in the pants and the back wall and the swirling of thick paint to move with the folds of the clothes <s> You may also notice even though I am one of three artists in this show I titled my work 'The Tute and a Tan ' <s> Let me explain how my brain works with respect to getting the job done <s> I can move forward fairly quick if I have a specific direction <s> In this case I chose to paint scenes from two of my favorite people-watching spots - the Art Institute of Chicago aka the 'Tute ' - and the beach <s> Once I can visualize a grouping that marries well with each other I start working <s> There isn 't an artist that doesn 't get stuck not knowing what to paint next - and this way of thinking and preparing helps me motivate <s> All of my paintings in the show can be viewed here - and thank you for looking <s> A short video can be viewed here as well <s> Hope you enjoy 'Cruise Control ' sold This might be a workshop meant for you - my second Field Expedition this year taking place November 1st - 5th at the Arts Center of Coastal Carolina on Hilton Head Island in South Carolina <s> I 've seen the studio space it is fabulous - and like the New York City workshop we 'll be painting in the early part of the day and photographing in the afternoons <s> I picked this location because it has provided me with loads of imagery for paintings - the beach the low-country landscapes and Savannah and Charleston are near enough for a short road trip for more <s> Also the fine people at the Morris amp Whiteside Gallery will be hosting an evening get-together at their gallery for our group and you may also be interested in scooting over to Charleston after the workshop is over for their Palette and Palate Stroll during the weekend <s> Should be great fun <s> More information can be found here and you can call Vince Fazio at the Sedona Arts Center for further details and registration 6 x 6 'oil on masonite sold I am sure there is many of you out there that aren 't embracing the snow right now <s> But remember I live in the deep south and this is not only a rare occurrence it is an unusual opportunity for me to paint something different and I love that <s> It is staggering to see my world blanketed in white - almost no hint of color anywhere - the muted silver sky - the amazing quiet <s> If it wasn 't for my slipping on the ice and dropping my camera right smack in the snow I would say that day was a perfect day <s> I also get to play with thick blended warm and cool white paints - laid on thick and as heavy as the snow itself <s> So much fun <s> And I promise - the 18 new paintings you 'll see in a few weeks will warm you up and remind you that brighter days are ahead 
<s> I plan to stop being a public personal storyteller <s> Let me explain I went to TED last month which is a conference in Long Beach and was asked to perform a 3 minute story in between speakers I got up and told this story about Mulan learning about sex for the first time I call it the Mulan-frog story it begins with frogs It got big laughs and even a partial standing ovation at the end People really loved it and I was so high and happy afterwards I am proud that I have the skill to tell a good story and make people laugh <s> I have a million happy memories of being onstage and making people laugh There is always a dark side however I am usually telling some story that could embarrass another person or I am talking about something that irritates me about someone specific When I got home from the conference I realized that if Mulan saw my story or a fellow student did she could be very embarrassed I was mortified and could not believe that I hadn 't considered this before Mulan looks good in the story a curious smart nine year old But the whole topic is embarrassing to a girl her age I was really struck deeply about what I do onstage and the fact that I have a child I hated telling stories about my mother because I knew that it could be hurtful but I did it anyway because I loved getting the laugh I loved getting to vent and I felt I had the right somehow to talk about her onstage I guess I thought there was some sort of unwritten code that made parents fair game I actually feel that is true and if Mulan grows up and tells stories about me no matter how unflattering I will gladly accept that as her right I 'll be in the front row no wait More lovingly I will not be anywhere near the place But the other way around me telling stories about her That is different <s> After much agonizing little niggling things that I have hated for a long time about performing stories about my own life fulminated to the surface I no longer wish to be so naked and bare I am surprised I ever did want to do it Don 't get me wrong I am glad I did I am proud that I learned to craft my experiences into a story and I am proud that I learned the craft of being on-stage But now I need to stop doing it I am happily married for one thing and it is boring and inappropriate to talk about My daughter is ten and she reads my blog OMG she goes to my shows In fact we have spoken at length about the stories I tell about her Not that at ten she is really capable of understanding the ramifications Still she says it is okay to tell the Mulan-frog story But ugh I don 't think she really understands I feel the need to protect her from myself In some ways this is just another example of our Internet age When I started telling stories about my life it was in a basement club in L <s> A called Luna Park in <date> where the maximum capacity was 50 people We were recording the shows but it wasn 't for mass consumption What I mean is that I could speak as if it were 'off the record ' This lulled me into a sense of secrecy and intimacy and allowed me to say anything no matter how raw I was uncensored <s> But there is no more 'off-the-record ' anymore Anything can be posted online Immediately I think this is on balance good it makes people accountable in a new and direct way But for me well let is just say I would probably never have begun telling stories about my personal life if I 'd thought they could be available to any interested person instantly But once I started I got used to the open-nature of talking about my life I learned to live with the downsides the embarrassment possibly even when it hurt or embarrassed other people Then when blogging came along it seemed like such a natural thing to do Jill Sobule and I have been working for a few years now doing a show together I tell about ten to fourteen stories in our show She sings songs I tell stories We have worked hard to make the show work dramatically and musically <s> I think we 've succeeded In fact I think our show is at least as good as any other show I 've done maybe better I am glad I tell all those stories in our show But I don 't want to tell any more The stories that are out there well they 're out there But then after this well I want to retire from it At least for a while Maybe forever I dunno <s> We have about 12 scheduled shows for this year <math> Mostly in the summertime and mostly in the Northeast and the Northwest After talking this over with Jill we have agreed to do those shows We may actually a ' a show or two We may also find a way to film our show in the autumn But by the end of this year I plan to stop doing this show And then face <date> not performing <s> I haven 't written in my blog because I am always so suspicious of any type of big revelation or big announcement I almost felt that if I announced that I was going to stop performing there would inevitably be some reason not to stop it I have mulled this over for the last month or so And it feels good It feels right <s> Sometimes I feel that my creativity and not just mine but everyone is creativity is like the snow on a mountaintop melting a little at a time All my various outlets performing and writing in all its manifestations -- create little rivers through which the snow can melt I always liked having so many things going at once I always felt that in show business you had to have five pots on the stove just to get one of them to boil I benefited from being so multi-able I could do voice over and then perform at a club I could write a monologue and then write a pilot for a <smiley> show But lately it feels that I have fragmented my focus with this policy I want the snow to melt into a couple of larger rivers not into several smaller streams And so after the TED experience I found myself wondering what I am doing with myself How am I directing my energies I began to look at the darker side of telling stories about my personal life The guilt the anguish the desire to emphasize this over that the slant the small or large exaggeration the worry that someone I am talking about will see or hear me Then I suppose you could say the tipping point was Mulan <s> Also many things have changed I am now more able to be isolated having moved to the Midwest from Los Angeles and conversely I am now in more regular and intimate interdependence with people I guess what I mean is that I have a husband and a child There is already a lot of interaction in my life and I have begun to crave more and more alone time I desire privacy I don 't want my personality to be so known anymore My personality has been so slutty Time to join a convent So in the last few weeks I have beta-tested my new views And it is already had such forceful and creative results I am focusing on a couple of screenplays with my writing partner Jim Emerson I may or may not finish writing the memoir of my letting go of God time 'My Beautiful Loss-of-Faith Story ' Of course I 'll do the Jill amp Julia shows with Jill Sobule during this year Then I plan to hang up my mouth I can see Jill and I doing another show someday but not until way into the future If she wants to In ten years I do honestly have that fantasy Or I can imagine that I will change in a few yea rs time and want to get back up on stage Or maybe I will develop the skills to talk about things that aren 't so personal and private like many other comics do That could happen But I doubt it And at the very least I doubt it for the foreseeable future <s> Anyway here I am making a big pronouncement just what I didn 't want to do I am trying to write this in a way that appears that I am mindful of the unpredictable events that could occur But insofar as I can plan ahead and insofar as I can predict my attitude and insofar as I have the ability to point myself towards one thing over another I feel the plan to stop talking about myself publicly is right <s> So this means that I won 't be blogging about my family Or really blogging at all <s> I am so thankful for all the people who have read my blog and commented Please if you can come to see one of the Jill amp Julia Shows this year For me this show is so meaningful it is an end of an era For 16 years I have been getting on stage and spilling my guts while simultaneously attempting to make people laugh That is a long time This decision feels like a death It is hard to envision myself as myself without the outlet and the drive to get onstage and talk about it On the other hand it doesn 't seem right to continue either This decision feels inevitable and yet surprising and mostly very very right I am so excited about this to be honest Imagine me a private person I recently joked with Jim Emerson about how I feel I was a butterfly but I am morphing into a caterpillar I 'll be posting all the places where Jill and I have booked shows very soon Thanks for reading <s> Botanic Gardens Kauai Hawaii I took this pic a few years ago when Mulan and I spent Christmas with friends in Kauai <s> I 've been thinking about Voltaire a bit In our last writing session Jim reminded me of the poem that Voltaire wrote after the Lisbon earthquake of <date> when all the priests were railing against the people themselves for being the culprit The disaster occurred because of their sinfulness And now <date> years later and we still have the like of Pat Robertson and his voodoo pact-with-the-devil Christian belief that Haiti brought all this on itself <s> Here is Voltaire is poem Poem on the Lisbon Disaster - Wikisource And here is a good excerpt What crime what sin had those young hearts conceived That lie bleeding and torn on mother is breast Did fallen Lisbon deeper drink of vice Than London Paris or sunlit Madrid In these men dance at Lisbon yawns the abyss <s> Tranquil spectators of your brothers ' wreck Unmoved by this repellent dance of death Who calmly seek the reason of such storms Let them but lash your own security Your tears will mingle freely with the flood <s> Pat Robertson is an anomaly now The public is ridiculing him This makes me optimistic In Voltaire is time it the Catholic Church was everywhere and this was the general attitude <s> I really think things are changing SLOWLY What shocks me is that while the mainstream may mock Robertson they don 't seem to take it a step further If God didn 't cause the earthquake then does God cause anything Is he a sad bystander Is he able to do anything about it Of course not Then why believe in any God at all But no one takes it that far It is PC to extoll the belief that God IS there to rely on you can cry on his shoulder you can ask for strength Why is that so acceptable And why did the font on my blog just change OH I cannot stop and noodle with it I have dinner to prepare <s> Val my cat on my desk Here is an experimental blog post - a straight-up diary of my day <s> So <s> This was my day <s> Got up nudged Mulan along as she groggily got dressed for school Got her breakfast and made some coffee Helped her look through her homework to make sure everything was done Nudged her to finish a math page and a bonus challenge homework page Gave her a pre-test for her spelling quiz Nudged her to get her teeth brushed and especially to floss <s> After she left I took the dog Arden on a walk to Lake Michigan I listened on my iphone to an audio biography about Paul Durac a British Theoretical Physicist I am convinced he had asperger syndrome only the biographer doesn 't mention that I get jelous of Dirac is life where everything is arranged so he can work constantly I wish I had a Mancy his wife is name who made sure I was undisturbed had food and could take long walks Today as I walk it is very deceptively icy <s> The sidewalks look clear but they have the thinnest layer of ice <s> I almost fall down a hundred times I don 't like the cold today The lake is sad looking a lot of dirty looking piled up snow on the edge of the lake <s> I look closer and see that what I thought was dirt is really sand I marvel at Lake Michigan and all it is sand <s> Get home and Michael is completely absorbed in some lighting project at the house He is a man obsessed with lighting He wants to program every single light in our house so that we can stand at the door and push one button and every light we don 't want on will go off <s> This requires a lot of work hooking up this outlet but not that one etc He is frustrated with the software for the program and it is the third incarnation of this software he has worked with <s> He has been up for two nights until at least one or two a m working on the lighting project I kid with him and say when he gets it done I expect him to say with glee 'Now all you have to do to turn down the lights in the family room is log onto this website on your computer enter a certain number and the light will automatically dim ' He does not like my joke because you see it is not really a joke <s> I leave and go get a mammogram <s> I have not had one for a few years <s> I having had cervical cancer should be more vigilant but I have let things go I get to the Evanston Medical Center and read the book I am completely absorbed in 'Lacuna 'by Barbara Kingsolver It is such a great book a fictionalized account of a young Mexican American in the thirties who befriends Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera and Trotsky I am pulled out of my reverie by a stern woman asking me to put on a gown The gown is awkwardly configured so even after you tie it in the places it wants to be tied you have to hold it closed otherwise your whole front shows as you walk down the hallway to the mammogram machine The woman inside is friendly and I am thankful for her warm hands as she manipulates my breasts this way and that I think about what a weird job she has I wonder if she says to people 'I just sort of fell into it ' There is no hi 'en meaning in that configuration of words I just wonder if that is the phrase she 'd use <s> As I leave we discuss the gowns She agrees they suck <s> I leave and take a moment to consider that I could get a bad response on my mammogram and have cancer <s> I fantasize what I would do if I learned I had only one year to live I decide that I would just go places to look at animals and nature and the sky at night I would go to the Galapagos or Hawaii and just sit and watch <s> I don 't need to see any more people I 've seen big cities but I 've done it I get it Big vibrant city I crave quiet and nature without people I decide that I would have to pull Mulan out of school to go with me to Hawaii or the Galapagos Of course Michael would have to come he 'd have to shut down his business and come Jill Sobule would have to come too as well as Jim Emerson I guess there 'd be some people Then I think it would be bad for Mulan to be pulled out of school right now because she is really doing well and loves her school Then I remember this is all a fantasy I blink back tears and come back to life <s> I go to my favorite bread store in Evanston It is Friday and I get challah I don 't ask for challah bread I used to do that Then Michael told me that was like asking for Guinness beer You just say Guinness not Guinness beer just as you just say challah We like to buy challah for french toast on Sundays I don 't have Mulan with me but I remember while I am at this store that this was where Mulan made her first decent pun She said they should put a sign out on Fridays saying 'Celebrate it is Challah-Day ' While I am at the bread store I also get a turkey sandwich on their popeye bread It is so good it is worth all the points <s> I come home and eat my sandwich while I watch some <smiley> footage about Haiti <s> I get really upset I start to cry It all seems so hopeless What if you were stuck and had so much time before you died to know it was going to happen Or worse you didn 't know if your loved ones were okay or not Or even what just really happened out there This is happening to someone right now This makes my heart heave <s> I answer a few phone calls I speak with a woman at Minnesota Public Radio about doing a show at the Fitzgerald theater in St <s> Paul in March It seems like it is going to happen Then I do some business paperwork for example I send <date> to Sony for the rights to sing 'Is That All There Is 'in 'Letting Go of God 'for one year <s> Then I try to write I decide my book of essays is not as important as 'My Beautiful Loss Of Faith Story 'the book i 've been working on for years <s> I wonder if I can reach my goal of finishing it this year <s> I wonder how many years I 've had this goal <s> I feel depressed I remember we have no food in the house and Mulan is bringing a friend home after school I go to the grocery store I buy chicken noodle soup and oyster crackers for Mu and her friend to have after school This is Mu is big <smiley> day She cannot watch any <smiley> during the week but on Friday after school it is a <smiley> free-for-all I also buy vegetables and after I come home I quickly make a pasta sauce in the slow cooker <s> I run to meet Mu after school but I am a few minutes late and she is nearly home and I end up meeting her half way <s> She has her friend with her <s> Mu got <date> on her spelling quiz and I am elated I heat up the chicken soup for them Nadia comes over to watch the girls because I have a hair appt Michael has gone to work I get my hair cut really short <s> I really look like a nun now <s> And I like it I feel I am in 'A Nun is Story 'as I leave the hair salon I tell myself that if my hair is going to be this short I really have to remember to wear lipstick I love my hair dresser She gets my hair <s> I come home from the salon and Michael is already home and working on his lighting project again <s> Mulan is upstairs in our room watching <smiley> I make everyone eat the pasta and sauce It is only okay not great I beg everyone to watch the Netflix movie I have 'Winged Migration ' I already saw it when it came out in <date> but it was so great - all about various birds ' migrations across the earth Michael wants to work on the lighting project Mulan wants to watch <weirdcaps> they don 't want to watch it I am too tired to do anything useful I briefly decide to go read my book in the basement but then rally and force everyone to stop what they 're doing and watch 'Winged Migration ' I really have to push I momentarily hate everyone and wonder why I am doing this I think that if I am going to die in a year I really must finish the screenplay that Jim Emerson and I are working on <s> We are having so much fun Working with Jim has been one of my life is great joys Just as I am giving up on Mu and Michael they agree yes let is watch the movie together I su 'enly feel a huge surge of love for them <s> Before we watch the movie we make popcorn in the microwave Michael has experimented and experimented and if you take <math> cup of popcorn and a dab of oil and put it in a kid is paper lunch bag and staple the top zap it for exactly 2 minutes it turns out great <s> We watch Michael loves the film but is skeptical about how much they doctored itto get certain types of shots Mulan is rapt with the film and so is Arden - it is the first time my dog watched most of a movie But when it is over Mulan announces she is thrilled she is now let out of this horrible prison I 've put her in forcing her to watch this movie Also she announces that she will never eat a bird <s> Ohmygod I love my family so much <s> Mulan goes to her room Michael goes back to the lighting project and I come in here and write about my day <s> Snow snow everywhere <s> And I love it <s> Wow All those posts to the last blog entry have my head in constant conversation I think the post that I 've thought about the most was the one which indicated I was breaking the question down in a poor way Well there were many posts pointing that out This one broke down the debate in a different way - between religion with supernatural claims and religion without supernatural claims That is true I guess I don 't normally think of or remember that there are religions without supernatural claims <s> Bu 'hism is the only one I can think of Not all sects of Bu 'hism Or the Unitarian Church <s> To me religion works best as a ritual keeper and community builder These things are very important In my observations - which are mostly about my upbringing in Spokane in the Catholic church and then watching my friends who have stayed in the church - the best thing they get from their religion is the shared rituals and community These are the things that I really craved in retrospect I had mouthed the words and didn 't think all that much about the readings I liked Bach and the candles and the idea that I had stood in this same church year in and year out on one particular day that earmarked the dead of winter or the beginning of spring - saying the same things hearing the same songs watching kids grow up flirting with boys seeing who was getting married mourning those who had died All those things can be a part of a life without the supernatural <s> On the other hand the supernatural specifics of what we were all supposed to believe were in my opinion a great hindrance to the development of a skeptical outlook and even general critical thinking skills So the ideas we were so benignly taught had an insidious price We paid with our critical minds SOME of my friends from Spokane for example have - in my humble opinion - undeveloped political opinions Worse they back off from any debate They make ad homonym attacks Tragically some of them have no understanding of the tenants of other faiths and even of their own faith Sometimes it seems that they are even proud of their lack of information Is the Church to blame <repeatedchars> <s> I kinda think so I hate to say I do <s> But the rituals and community continue to give And I can see that it is a great value <s> I think the Unitarian Church can offer this but not at the cost of your critical mind <s> But for me I do not feel in need of the community anymore I like the idea of it but not the practicality of it It involves a great deal of socializing and I feel that I am filled up with that <s> What I crave now and I am fifty so maybe this is a natural thing to happen but I want less socializing and social obligation in my life I crave quiet and contemplation I want to learn I feel I am hungry to learn and read and think well it is almost as if I had scurvy and were in need of an orange And true learning and thinking take a lot of time and quiet With a husband and a child as well as a few very close friends I feel I am up to my ears in interaction with people A 'ing a church would put me over the edge Even if Mulan may benefit from it she would have an even more frazzled mother and I don 't think that is good I could just see myself getting caught up in it at first volunteering for five committees no 'ing 'yes 'to the bake sale and then being in the worst possible mood about it all for the next six months Wait This is what being at a public school is like already I 've so far been able to back away from most things But yes I feel guilty about it Guilty or Angry That is always my dilemma I think me and my friends would have been better served by a Church that did not subscribe to supernatural beliefs We would have gotten the ritual and community but not the inanity <s> But sometimes I wonder would we stick to it if it didn 't have a whiff of a real God on High I might not have It would require inculcating me about the need of community and social obligation and not about someone looking over my shoulder who could see everything <s> I wrote the above jumbled blog entry this morning and was intending all day to get back to it reread all those wonderful posts from the last entry and rewrite it <s> But now it is I wrote this below last week and I guess I 'll paste it here now <s> Amongst the non-believers of this world there appears to be a split in thinking between 1 Those that think religion is good - regardless of truth - for some people Religion is useful for those who are trying to get sober for those who have no where to turn for those that might not follow society is rules for those who might not otherwise respect others for those in complete despair and for those that need the idea the concept - as a new drug - to get off another one 2 Those who think religion and the idea of God is never good for anyone <s> I have always put myself in the 1 category It suits me because I don 't want to proclaim that seeing stark reality which is very dark and full of potential catastrophe is good or possible for everyone <s> But this thinking is very condescending It is Plato saying religion is good for the masses It is Will Durant saying how religion helps to bind people together and so for society it is good It is AA using the idea of a higher power to get people to let go of another actual drug <s> But 2 is so arrogant too <s> I mean this is all just for the rumination - religion and the idea of God is not going away and most likely never will - so this is all just blathering about the number of angels who can dance on the head of a pin I have always stayed away from the 2 thinking because it puts me in a position of dismissing so much in others <s> I am not comfortable with it It is very judgey Of course that is no way to decide what you think Being judgey is the point of this whole debate But in my private thoughts what do I really think It is like a little debate between Plato and Voltaire Plato did think religion was good for the masses Voltaire believed religion enslaved people <s> Truthfully now I am beginning to lean towards Voltaire <s> I asked my husband yesterday if he thought religion did any person any good at all 'Think about Anne Lamott a nice liberal happy Christian 'I said 'Or people who get off drugs and alcohol because they find Jesus I mean aren 't we all better off because of that transfer of the more dangerous drug to the more benign one 'And he sai ' <weirdcaps> <s> But now those people are primed to follow Jesus might be the idea for now but it really could be anyone <s> They have made themselves programmable and basically they are sheep and now anyone could lead them - it could be to the top of a mountain or it could be off a cliff 'Again I am paraphrasing and a 'ing imagery for emphasis And may I remind you that I do not hang on this guy is every word far from it But I thought about that all day I mean I have always thought 1 was the benevolent point of view the humble point of view the less-judgemental and superior point of view but actually that is wrong <punctuationfreak> The 1 thinking is really so cynical and superior and 2 has all this faith in everyone to use rationality and critical thinking to get through 2 is actually the humble - or no the optimistic point of view Not that being humble or optimistic is some sort of proof for an argument But you know neither of these words is right it is more like empowering - it is the empowering point of view <s> I have not really come to any conclusions about this But I am just realizing how there is this split in thinking and I am not sure - I vacillate between those views <s> Arden in the backseat of the just-bought mini-van as we drove from Los Angeles to Chicago embarking a year ago today Dec 17 <date> <s> A year ago Mulan and I after watching a moving company depart with all of our possessions joined Michael as we drove together from California to Illinois There was a huge storm which prevented us from taking the route we wished to take - through Santa Fe and instead we drove south through Arizona and then Texas It took four days We had a dog in the car who wanted to kill really truly kill and eat the cat in the car We stopped at Motel 6s we saw billboards in Texas that proclaimed that Obama was not born in the U <s> S we watched Arden pee in ice for the first time It was an adventure <s> We arrived here just before Christmas slept in our new house all together on sleeping bags in the master bedroom and wandered our neighborhood thinking 'What the hell did we just do 'And what have I done this year Adjust be a mom who is around a lot do a few shows write a pilot and empty a bunch of boxes The house is still not totally organized - the basement is on it is way But I am much happier here and thrilled to be in this new family It really does feel like a family Mulan can barely remember life before Michael Last night we talked about the drive For Mulan this was our biggest adventure of all She often refers to the drive and wants to do it again - with the cat and the dog That part was not so much fun for me Anyway as I have not taken a picture the last couple of days I thought I 'd throw up that one of Arden a year ago on his way to his own new adventure here <s> What am I thinking about Well I am very sad about the healthcare 'overhaul ' I am very sad about Obama and I am wondering if he is really who I thought he was I read Robert Reich is and Glenn Greenwald is articles on Salon and I am just really so sad and so disappointed and I wish they would not vote for this deal and I like Howard Dean even more than I ever have and I hate Joe Leiberman even though this demise is not all his doing Last night I overheard Mulan telling Michael 'Mom was in the car driving and yelling 'That Joe Leiberman ' and her fists were clenched ' Anyway let is change the subject What other things am I thinking about I am thinking about all the letters I have gotten from people and how much they mean to me <s> I want to write back everyone and I hope to send at least a thank you I am trying to just be present and take it all in <s> I am thinking about some of the questions that people have asked Some people worry about having meaning in a world without god in it I don 't have the best answer for that yet I am mulling on that one but I remember once being at a convention with 
<s> Male Yellowhammer hatched last <weirdcaps> Goldfinch also hatched last <weirdcaps> ringing again this time on our monthly visit to Beeston <s> It was really too windy to be very productive but we did catch the first Yellowhammer for quite some time an array of Greenfinches and Chaffinches and a Goldfinch <s> Yesterday we were very close to catching a Sparrowhawk but by the time we 'd legged it to the net it had got out and flown off <s> To make up for the disappointment we caught three Long-tailed Tits <s> Two of them had consecutive ring numbers - they were the same two we 'd caught together at dusk the previous month Everyone say ' <repeatedchars> ' <s> I 've been so busy lately that I 've barely had any time for photos during the week and I haven 't managed much at weekends either <s> Hopefully normal service will soon be resumed <s> Highlights in the garden have been up to 15 Reed Buntings and four Yellowhammers <s> No sign of newts in the pond yet though there have been a few Backswimmers and Lesser Diving Beetles pootling around photos taken with Canon EOS 30D

<s> The World Health Organization said the Swine Flu does not appear to be spreading in a significant way <s> Mexican health officials have lowered its suspected death toll by 75 people which indicates the disease is not as widespread or dangerous as originally suspected So far cases of the Swine Flu outside of Mexico haven 't been as severe <s> At this point 18 countries have reported outbreaks of the disease and significant measures have been taken in each to prevent further contamination Overall initial concerns and predictions haven 't been substantiated Originally reported by the BBC Scars are a part of life but not for much longer <s> Scientists have discovered a drug that reduces the appearance of surgical scars Scaring is prevented when the compound avotemin is injected into the skin around a surgical incision before and after a surgery <s> Avotemin works to send signals between cells so the body is collagen knits more effectively which reduces scars With more research the compound may result in an anti-scaring treatment <s> Even thought the drug is only cosmetic it can help people feel better about themselves - always a good thing <s> No one wants to be reminded of their injuries and illnesses Originally reported by Daily Mail A recent study on sperm may result in a win for everyone <s> Researchers discovered a gene mutation that causes infertility and the discovery may lead to a cure <s> The discovery may also lead to the development of a male contraceptive pill <s> In just one study two issues may be a 'ressed The researchers were initially trying to isolate genetic causes of deafness but instead found two different DNA mutations in the CATSPER 1 gene that effected a man is ability to produce a protein related to sperm 'hyperactivity 'or sperms ability to move fast enough to penetrate a female egg <s> It is possible that antibodies could be developed that could bind to the defective protein thus creating healthy active sperm <s> A 'itionally the mutation would be selectively applied in pill form and create a male birth control pill <s> Both applications need more research and development <s> Nevertheless - there is hope for those who and don 't want children Originally reported by the BBC Seeing is believing and a <math> year-old man that lost his eyesight thirty years ago can now believe - his sight is back <s> With the help of a bionic eye Ron can now track light and make out basic shapes <s> He says he can short socks for the first time in thirty years Ron is experimental surgery took place at London is Moorfield is eye hospital <s> A tiny camera mounted on a pair of sunglasses transmits data via a cable to electrodes that sit upon Ron is retinas <s> When the electrodes are stimulated they transmit messages to the optic nerve in Ron is brain which in turn allows him to see the light pattern experienced by the camera With training patients will be able to create meaningful images based on the light patterns they can now see <s> To date eighteen people have bionic eyes and more will follow Originally reported by the BBC Half a million people with severe asthma now have an effective treatment Two groups of researchers from the UK and Canada found injections of mepolizumab an antibody help reduce the frequency of severe attacks in people with asthma exacerbated <s> Aside from decreasing the number of attacks the treatment also allows asthma patients to decrease their use of steroids which have multiple negative side effects like weight gain and bone loss This type of asthma is linked to abnormally high levels of white blood cells called eosinophils <s> The antibody injections bring the white blood cell count down and that prevents the server airway inflammation associated with asthma The treatment reduces attacks by up to 50 percent and increases the quality of life for asthma sufferers Originally reported by the BBC Learning about endangered species is no easy task <s> The Saharan cheetah falls into this category and is rarely seen - until now <s> A team from the Zoological Society of London has captured several images of the endangered animal <s> The images help identify individual animals and provide information about the allusive species which little is know about With fewer than <date> mature individuals in the wild the Saharan cheetah faces extinction <s> By gathering images of the animals that roam just six countries Algeria Togo Niger Mali Benin and Burkina Faso zoologists hope to understand the animals ' movement and ecology <s> This information may help save the species If nothing else the images provide another face to a problem humans love to ignore - endangered species Originally reported by the BBC Photo by Farid Belbachir of the Zoological Society of London An allergy to peanuts is no joke <s> For some just smelling peanuts can result in a fatal reaction <s> Which makes finding a cure all the more important and useful <s> A team from Cambridge is A 'enbrooke is Hospital may have done just that <s> The team effectively cured four children of their peanut allergy Over the course of six mouths the team gave the children larger and larger exposures to peanuts to build up their bodies ' tolerance to the nut <s> By the end of the six month period the children could eat five peanuts a day and have no reaction <s> This is the first food allergy to be mitigated by exposure Even though more testing needs to be done on the method it does give people with the debilitating allergy hope <s> People with peanut allergies agonize over food products and often can 't eat in certain restaurants because of the allergy If the allergy is curable that means improved quality of life It also means airlines might start serving peanuts again <s> Here is hoping Originally reported by the BBC We 've all done it - forgotten to charge our phone then appealed to a friend for theirs but of course they have a different brand of phone so their charger won 't work <s> This annoying scenario will be a thing of the past The major phone companies - Nokia Motorola Samsung Sony Ericsson LG T-Mobile Orange 3 AT amp T and Vodafone - have agreed to come together and create a universal phone charger that can be used with any handset model <s> The majority of phones will support the new charger by <date> A 'itionally the charger will be environmentally friendly and consume 50 percent less stand-by energy compared to today is chargers Let is give props to the major phone companies for thinking about their customers and how they can make our lives easier <s> It is also impressive that they would make the charger use less energy <s> Too bad the <weirdcaps> isn 't included Originally reported by the BBC 
<s> Well I made it to Fairbanks <s> It is a beautiful first day of spring sunny and warm - 33 degrees <s> Downright tropical in this part of the world <s> I haven 't been to this region of Alaska in nearly seven years I am actually surprised how much of it feels familiar to me <s> We had a great trip up traveling overland - the only way to travel <s> We took the ferry to Skagway and chugged up White Pass in my friend Bjorn is old Subaru crossing our fingers the entire way <s> We visited friends in Whitehorse and continued north on the Alaska Highway to Kluane Lake where we geared up for an overnight iski 'trip I was on snowshoes in the frigid mountains of the Yukon

<s> Dear friends of Bubby Six years ago we started a blog with our grandmother Bubby as a way to share her wise advice with the world <s> We knew that everyone would love her wit candor and compassion <s> This little experiment soon turned into something more special than we could have ever imagined <s> Within months Bubby was receiving letters from thousands of people around the world pouring out their hearts and sharing their most personal stories with our grandmother <s> She loved offering her help <s> She loved reading your letters every day <s> She was so proud to be a Bubby to all of you <s> Sadly last night we lost our Bubby <s> At 94 she was still beautiful <s> Thank you for all of your contributions over the years <s> You helped make her life that much more special <s> With love the gran 'aughters Reader Update In July of <date> we received a letter from a <math> year old woman with a broken heart <s> And this wasn 't the first time she had to pick up the pieces <s> She and her fiance were supposed to be married in <date> but he called it off and they parted ways 6 months later he found his way back to her begged for forgiveness re-proposed and she accepted <s> A few months went by and he called off the we 'ing again <s> But of course he kept her dangling and her hopes for a third reunion remained high <s> When you hear a story like this you want to yell from the rooftops 'FORGET HIM 'But as we all know the heart can be hard-of-hearing sometimes <s> And this girl needed some advice <s> Leave it to Bubby to set things straight <s> Bubby wasted no time referring to this man as an 'immature fellow 'She wrote 'I recommend you forget him and if he calls just tell him the party is over <s> There are many fish in the sea and I am sure there is one who is looking for you <s> Life with this person will never happen <s> I wish you all the happiness in the world 'Even an anonymous commenter left a note saying 'Bubby is quite right <s> If he breaks it off once and comes back and all is well fine <s> We all make mistakes and we all have doubts <s> If he breaks it off twice <punctuationfreak> Run and never look back 'There is nothing we love more at this website than an update letter with a happy ending <s> So we are pleased to report that nearly 3 years to the date of this original posting we heard from this woman again <s> What do you think happened Did he finally grow a pair Did she learn her lesson Did she take Bubby is advice 'Read on to find out <s> Dear Bubby I wanted to write to up-date you and to thank you for the very good advice you gave me some three years ago now <s> My then fiance had called off our we 'ing for the second time and I was so distressed <s> You said I should forget this immature person who had wasted so much of my time <s> I took your advice and it really really worked out After deciding to end all contact with my ex-fiance I worked hard on my career and found a fantastic new job <s> The very first month I met a colleague in another department and in time we fell in love <s> We married last year and are now expecting our first child <s> With my ex everything was difficult <s> With my now husband everything is easy - we can really talk and he is so kind fun and gentle <s> And he was from the beginning absolutely sure about me <s> He is also supportive of my career as we work in the same field something my ex never was <s> Really he just cares deeply about my happiness and I couldn 't imagine that I could ever love someone as much as I love him <s> I never would have found this wonderful man if I hadn 't taken your advice <s> Anyway just to thank you <s> Writing to you and receiving your sensible response was a great comfort to me then and I am so grateful I listened to your wisdom <s> Wishing you and your family every happiness No longer 'Heart-broken all over again ' Thank you <punctuationfreak> <kikoo> the gran 'aughters and Happy Passover Searching for the afikomen Can be quite a chore new year <s> Over the years we have received so many thousands of touching endearing tearful hopeful soulful letters from people around the world asking Bubby for life advice <s> We wish for all of you that your stories turn out happy and everyone sees all their dreams come true <s> And on that note how 'bout a happy update letter On July 25 <date> we received a letter from a <math> year old woman living in Belgium who told Bubby she was planning to marry her boyfriend <s> She was looking for her first job after graduate school but the only one available to her was far away in Paris <s> She wasn 't excited about the job and didn 't feel like it matched her qualifications <s> But she was afraid her parents would be mad if she didn 't accept it <s> Bubby wrote her wisely 'It is a terrible feeling to get up in the morning and go to a job that you don 't like or are not qualified for <s> Just give yourself more time to find the job for which you are trained and you are qualified 'And then she a 'e ' 'on 't worry about your boyfriend <s> If you really love one another distance will not make a difference 'Bubby knows what long-distance love is like And she knew there was a way to solve this problem if everyone sat down to talk about it 'Put your thinking cap on 'Bubby told her <s> A few years went by and on March 8 <date> we received a great update letter <s> They were still happily in love and getting married She did find another job that she was much happier with even though it still meant geographical distance for the couple <s> But they visited each other every weekend and spoke on the phone every day <s> She wrote 'This is working because we made it work with lots of patience and love <s> Thanks for your nice advice to me when I asked for it <s> I 'll send you another update for the we 'ing 'Well we 're happy to report that she kept her word <s> This week we received another great update letter <s> She wrote Dear Bubby I am very happy to tell you that due to my good job and good fortune he was able to come join me in Paris to look for a job which he found easily <s> We got married in April <s> We first met in <date> and it was a difficult 5 years <s> We got through it partly thanks to your advice <s> So thank you very much and take care <s> From The Old Continent 
<s> Happy New Year everybody What an incredible year <date> was <s> It was such a great journey and I have met so many wonderful and talented people along the way <s> Thank you to everyone who has participated in my portrait project here <s> It was such an honor to have spent time with you and to take your portrait <s> I am so lucky to have had the chance to meet people from all over <s> I know some of you thought I should make myself the last portrait but I had already shot myself earlier this year <s> Take a scroll back and find me But the main reason I chose not to make myself the last portrait was because I wanted to be surprised <s> I didn 't want to plan or think about that too much <s> I also knew that it would be hard to choose one person so shooting a family seemed to be a great way to end the project <s> I have been going back and forth with whether or not I should continue the project in <date> and I have also decided not to continue L 'image Quotidienne in this new year <s> I am sorry if I am disappointing anyone but this project was to be for one year and although it would be great to continue on indefinitely for that matter there are some other projects that I would like to work on <s> I know I won 't be able to completely stop shooting portraits of random people I see on the street but please look for those posts on my M Photo blog <s> Thank you everyone for your kind comments and support <s> I am so grateful <s> But before I say goodbye I wanted to leave you all with two last portraits <s> They are the same ladies I shot at the beginning of this blog <s> What a difference a year makes And please don 't forget to check out what my December portraits are into <s> Super cool stuff people Thanks again and all the best in <date> <punctuationfreak> Mercedes Zen Rock Caraid O 'Brien Delancy Street Foundation Wooly Hoodwinks Scalabrini Villa Alan Gallo Photographer - <s> Here are two things I never expected to happen one the most amazing is to find my name on a Forbes list <s> Not the one headed by Oprah but deeply exciting all the same I can now paraphrase all those Oscar winners and say how honoured I am to be named alongside such talent etc etc <s> The second thing is that yesterday s pressure cooker rice was excellent <s> Call it risotto or call it arroz caldoso it was just unbeleivable as in hard to beleive creamy perfectly cooked rice full of flavour in less than fifteen minutes from the minute I turned on the hob to sitting down I was deeply sceptical but figured it worth a try and so it was <s> Risotto long banished from my kitchen except as an occasional treat comes back as a weeknight dinner staple <s> The rice cooker reigns supreme for white rice and for truly hands off restful cooking but for quick and incredibly delicious results this is the one <s> Here is what I did yesterday with what I had but of course onions can take the place of leeks chorizo for bacon if you re so inclined any other vetetable for the peas and aromatics can vary saffron herbs etc <s> Pressure cooker arroz caldoso or risotto adapted from Lorna Sass Sautee two chopped leeks and bacon until the bacon releases its fat and the leeks begin to look floppy <s> Deglaze with some white wine let it bubble up and a ' 1 <math> cups short grain rice <s> Stir a ' 3 <math> cups of stock and cover the pressure cooker <s> Let it come uo to high pressure and count five minutes five <punctuationfreak> seriously aren t you in love already <s> Now release the pressure and have a look <s> You might want a bit more broth or you might want to let some of it evaporate <s> I thought it was just fine with those meassures <s> A ' butter and parmesan and there you are risotto for three hungry people or four staid ones <s> I m a gadget-driven cook <s> It s all very well to extoll the virtues of unplugged cooking and wax lyrical about pesto lovingly made in a pestle and mortar but for day to day food-on-the-table purposes I d be lost without a Thermomix a rice cooker a blender and a radio I thought a slow cooker might be a good thing since my favourite stews are off the radar <s> The idea of leaving an oven on for hours in the vicinity of a danger-seeking to 'ler makes me pale <s> Plus with two children in the world I m beginning to feel guilty about our fuel consumption <s> But slow cookers are hard to come by in Spain and I have had a pressure cooker sitting in a cupboard since I got married almost six years ago so yesterday I had my pressure baptism <s> Chickpeas in minutes convinced me in seconds and I ve been playing with it ever since <s> My first solo flight was based on this rag ˘ <s> I did t lock the pressure valve properly and scorched the bottom but all the same I had a really tasty chunky sauce that s made a great filling for empanada <s> So far so good <s> The chicken stock is what has me lost in wonder <s> I was convinced it would come out cloudy but tried it anyway thinking P ' a wouldn t mind <s> But amazingly in 45 minutes I had a pot of golden beautiful clear broth <s> I did skim it before locking the lid mind you but it didn t take so long <s> So now instead of making a giant 5 litre batch of stock every month or so I ll make a amaller 2 litre batch all the time <s> It s magic I have a chunk of pork shoulder marinating even as we speak waiting to be turned into melt-in-the-mouth shreds of aromatic meat for tomorrow s lunch <s> I ve only been using the pressure cooking for 24 hours so maybe it s just a coup de foudre and I ll drop it in a week <s> But I don t think so <s> I think I ll be making a lot more beans and curries and stews and can t wait for Lorna Sass book to arrive <s> In the meantime it s risotto tonigth with this morning s chicken stock <s> And if that works well then I can see myself becoming the official pressure cooker bore as well as the official rice cooker bore <s> After months of bot being allowed to eat rare red meat I m craving a burger bigtime <s> But I think burgers are best left to professionals and are best had in greasy smoky places and I m not about to take my precious new baby there yet lest he come back smeared with ketchup <s> A good home alternative A Pepito <s> Ask for a pepito anywhere in Spain and you will be given a steak sandwich <s> If you re lucky it will be a thin juicy paillard type thing and the oil and meat juices will soak into good crunchy bread <s> If you re not which is more often the case you will receive a slab of grey cardboard hunkering between two slabs of nothing bread <s> This is sad <s> This is not the sort of sandwich one wants as the namesake for a son and heir <s> It is a sad testament to the terrible lack of imagination most of Spain gives it sandwiches <s> To my mind a proper pepito should have something sharp like mustard or horseradish <s> Something crunchy like cornichons <s> Greens like ruccola <s> Butter if J isn t looking <s> And some slippery onions either just made or in the lovely form of onion jam <s> As for the meat I favour a thick steak salted then marinated overnight in whatever s around <s> This time it was olive oil two smashed cloves of garlic a sprinkling of thyme a splash of sherry and some fish sauce but anything goes <s> Sear it so it s black outside and pink within let it rest while you assemble the sandwiches on a good fresh baguette and open a couple of beers <s> Slice the meat thin and sneak a few slices as you put it inside the bread <s> You ll have to agree that this is a beautiful thing and I for one would be more than glad to share a name with it <s> Here s a very good reason to stop the rather infrequent postings on this blog Pepe two weeks old today <s> He was born three weeks early and so overset all my plans to stock my freezer get a haircut and write a few posts to have as backup <s> It s a pretty blissful life sure I don t sleep much at night but thanks to J and my family I m allowed to take naps at o ' times eat all sorts of delicious things practically nonstop and enjoy my beautiful babies <s> My chicken guy at the market is a very sweet fellow who doesn t mind selling me only half a chicken <s> Free range chickens are so big that even half is over a kilo and that s a lot of chicken for me <s> Not that I dislike chicken but I do find it hard to be fascinated by it <s> However stomach flu being what it is and my baby being now in the grip of it chicken breast must be gently poached <s> So my half of a big chicken gives me one big breast half skin off that the butcher cuts out <s> The thigh and the drumstick <s> A wing <s> A piece of backbone and the neck <s> Wing neck and bone go into the freezer for the making of stock whenever my storage runs low <s> The other two pieces I roasted today following the method called by la Lawson 'one-pan chicken ' <s> It results in roast chicken that is quite ok but that I am happy to leave for a sandwich or pot pie some other day <s> The star of the show for me are the vegetables potatoes onions and carrots that soak up the chicken juices and the fat char and burn and turn crispy or melting and are just the best thing ever <s> This time I spooned yogurt over them and it was quite a revelation <s> I ve been down a couple of days with the stomach flu that s going around <s> Whenever I ve had stomach trouble always the get-better food has been the same <s> The first day one is allowed nothing but lemon water with sugar and maybe a little salt <s> Then plain white rice perhaps some dry toast tea if you re looking good and a little boiled chicken <s> Next day you might progress to boiled ham and chicken broth or yogurt with a little stwed apple <s> You know that you re definitely getting better when you re allowed boiled potatoes in their skins <s> These come with a thin trickle of olive oil and some crunchy salt and they are the most delicious thing in the world <s> Not just because you know that you will soon be back to normal but because after some days of eating really dull stuff your palate is clean your senses are sharp and you are reminded of just how great very simple things can taste <s> Luckily for me it s come just in time to feel pleasantly detoxed and mammothly hungry for my mother s birthday today <s> This is going to be a lazy post by which I mean I am not going to write up a recipe <s> The reason Ethnic <s> I don t feel I can speak with any authority or knowledge about Asian soups <s> I was born and have always lived in a country that used to have no immigrants where all Chinese restaurants were called 'La gran muralla ' <s> They served fried rice and gloopy lemon chicken and if anybody ever asked for a soup there I ve never met them <s> Now things have improved and it s possible to have pretty good stuff at least in Madrid <s> Most importantly it s possible to buy lots of ingredients that allow you to replicate many of the lovely things found in books and around the internet <s> And that s what the beauty of my lack of Asian food education comes in my standards are so low that I just <repeatedchars> what I make <s> The fun bit with all these things is stocking up the pantry <s> A trip to the Mostenses market and its adjacent shops will have you coming back with bulging bags for very little money <s> I buy noodles won ton wrappers dried shiitakes fish sauce chili garlic sauce Hoisin sauce big bottles of soy sauce sesame oil bean sprouts good cheap chicken massive ginger roots even chinese chives and bok choi and pak choy <s> It s a lot of fun <s> You can even brave the underworld and try to eat at the subterranean restaurant in the Plaza de EspaÒa parking lot which is always packed and so rather difficult <s> I hear it s great and hope some day to put it to the test <s> Meanwhile I ll be trying to make won tons and making lots and lots of soup <s> What kind Well on lazy days it might be instant miso soup <s> On more energetic ones good chicken stock with fish sauce a hint of chili and some mint or chives <s> And for true soul warming stuff filling yet light the full on chicken noodle treatment or a version thereof with scraps of leftover roast meat <s> It s a very accomodating patron the noodle soup and one that always hits the spot so have a go <s> Here s Gasparini a blog I ve been meaning to link to for ages <s> It has the most drop dead gourgeous meringues and shares the recipes which is lovely of course <s> Not that I could ever make anything so pretty ever at any time but isn t it lovely to see it I have contributed to the all around prettiness I like to think in the blog header and the logos so go have a look

<s> Everyone forgets that Icarus also flew <s> It is the same when love comes to an end or the marriage fails and people say they knew it was a mistake that everybody said it would never work <s> That she was old enough to know better <s> But anything worth doing is worth doing badly Like being there by that summer ocean on the other side of the island while love was fading out of her the stars burning so extravagantly those nights that anyone could tell you they would never last Every morning she was asleep in my bed like a visitation the gentleness in her like antelope standing in the dawn mist Each afternoon I watched her coming back through the hot stony field after swimming the sea light behind her and the huge sky on the other side of that <s> Listened to her while we ate lunch <s> How can they say the marriage failed Like the people who came back from Provence when it was Provence and said it was pretty but the food was greasy I believe Icarus was not failing as he fell but just coming to the end of his triumph 
<s> And when I speak German I have to express myself in exactly the same way <s> I can 't convey the dark subtleties of my inner-being to the person in front of me <s> I ask <s> I get <s> Simple as <s> So naturally my personality and view of the world how others percieve me and how I percieve myself changes automatically When I visit a restaurant and my meal isn 't quite right I have to tell the staff as clear as day what is wrong with it <s> Straight off <s> If I were in England given the nature of our language I would be ridiculously apologetic for any inconvenience I may have caused them <s> If I said roughly the same thing in German the waiter would look at me quizzically and ask what I 'd done to it <s> In English I 'remember ' in German I 'remind myself ' In English I am the height of politeness <s> In German I am constantly apologising for things I haven 't done - and therefore just a bit weird <s> And in French I am a German - over-rolling my 'r is and sticking verbs at the end of sentences <s> The languages I speak as much as I may try to contort the words into something understandable to a native you can guarantee that the words are contorting me twice as much Foreign languages - the best and quickest way to contract multiple personality disorder what say you

<s> Even when I first started the lunches were much better than your average school lunch <s> The kitchen exclusively served organic milk and yogurt and the salad bar always had lettuce tomatoes and other fresh vegetables Even with a few great items in the cafeteria it still has a long way to go <s> The majority of students and staff eat food from the main meal line and the food is just a small step up from an average school lunch <s> Hot dogs hamburgers nuggets and pizza are monthly mainstays <s> Yes the hot dogs might be lower sodium and the buns are made with whole wheat but healthy and nutritious they are not Before taking this job I worked in a few upscale restaurant kitchens as a cook pastry chef and sous chef <s> I rarely cooked at home and I ate pretty poorly during those years <s> It made me wonder why I was cooking in the first place I would never have guessed I would end up working in a school cafeteria five years ago <s> New York City was just beginning to revamp its school lunch program when I was finishing up culinary school <s> They were hiring at my culinary school is career fair <s> I was interested but I didn 't linger at their booth too long <s> Why would I spend two years of my life learning to cook and then work for a school where little cooking is done on premises Several years later and exhausted from twelve hour days feeding a select few restaurant-goers I began to think about school food <s> I heard more and more about people like Alice Waters and Ann Cooper <s> I taught a free cooking class for high school students and their stories reminded me how bad school lunch can be <s> At some point tackling a stagnant school food system seemed much more interesting than making truffle risotto day in and day out

<s> I am honored that my painting 'The Divine Mother ' 4 ' x 8 ' acrylics has caused such controversy <s> The theme of the <date> Artery Exhibit in Eureka Springs AR was Icons and I chose to paint what I believe to be one of the most beautiful and inspirational iconographic themes that transcends the world of art to include the history of mankind the simple and beautiful image of a woman breastfeeding her child <s> The judges at the Portfolios com Creative Awards an international competition also found this to be beautiful and gave me an award for this painting Illustration ' <math> <s> Since ancient times people have been so inspired by the beauty of this image that incredible myths and religious stories and artwork have been created even worshipped <s> This includes depictions of the Egyptian Go 'ess Isis breastfeeding baby Horus an ancient myth which bears striking similarity to and which many scholars say inspired the Madonna del Latte or Maria Lactans imagery of Europe which reached the height of its popularity in the mi 'le ages <s> I title my painting 'The Divine Mother ' though it is not a depiction of the Virgin Mary as many people erroneously believe <s> The Virgin Mary is just one divine mother icon of many my divine mother is one of unity love gentleness compassion and so she combines world traditions and religions transcending time and space melding pre-Christian religions with Christianity to be an icon we can all identify with and find peace and beauty with <s> Look closely at her face it is half-blue many Egyptian statues of Isis are blue and she is wearing Egyptian makeup <s> As many people have noticed I put a new twist on this subject by a 'ing the text 'Does this halo make my face look fat ' to the painting <s> The Madonna Lactans and Isis imagery began as a way to show the compassion of the divine mother and therefore to make her more real human and accessible to us <s> A 'ing the text was my attempt to refresh and modernize this theme to make her accessible relevant and real to a modern audience <s> The divine mother in all her forms is undeniably the greatest supermodel of the art world since the beginning of mankind so I believe that like you she worries about how she looks in a painting photograph or sculpture 
<s> A question for God looms in my mind like water rolling and spinning chortling into an abyss of time <s> When I was nineteen I was dying so that I could live <s> I survived this challenge to come through this lifetime with the knowledge that God is within I was a college student home for the summer and had gone to a party <s> At that party there was drinking and pot smoking <s> A good friend is boy friend had come on to me and I was tempted to flirt back <s> In fact I did flirt back <s> I was young <s> I was beautiful and I was an atheist A year earlier my longest childhood friend had a swimming pool accident which left her a paraplegic <s> My friend the athlete was changed forever and I felt guilty <s> It was the unreasonable kind of guilt that summons over the young just because it can and it did <s> My friend was changed and I too changed <s> I grew angry and in a way I became uncaring about life itself I learned years later that often when we have profound thoughts they can manifest into reality <s> My thoughts at that time were 'Why didn 't it happen to me ' That night of drunken partying with a cute boy who was supposedly attached to a good friend I got into my car to drive home and through no fault of my own was hit <s> Su 'enly my car flew out of control spinning around and around in the darkened summer night <s> I sat in the driver is seat with voices going through my mind of my father and my brother 'Don 't do this <s> Do that ' Paralyzed I began to pray 'Dear God I don 't know what to do Help me ' In that moment I gave up my arrogance and went into complete surrender and when I did that an extreme and blinding white shield of light came directly out of my chest surrounding me like an egg shell The car continued to spin and finally slammed into an apartment building narrowly missing a telephone pole <s> I jumped out of the car mainly to see if I could still walk <s> My car was totaled but I was okay The man who had hit me had been 'joy racing ' with another driver going over 90 miles per hour and I had inadvertently gotten into his way
